reviews.text: This little cafe has become our go to spot to have a quiet coffee when we visit our daughter on campus. Plenty of seating at both tables and soft chairs. All the tables are regularly sanitized between seatings and the restrooms are super clean! The staff is friendly and happy to bring your order while you stay seated.  Seems to be a popular place for students to study in small groups or individually. Standard Covid precautions are enforced. I highly recommend it!

Been here twice, and tried both their vegetarian pizza's: shiitake pizza and fig & pear pizza. Both were fantastic (I think I liked the shiitake one a tad more). Service is great, prices are reasonable.

Social distancing is in place and all the staff had masks on, which I really appreciated. Hand sanitisers are available, as is disinfectant spray if you want to buy stuff down. 90% of the patrons also had masks on. There is usually a good amount of outside seating available. 

Also a great place to get some work done or read a book.

I'm not quite sure how to describe the location of where this restaurant is at because I'm not to familiar with the Lafayette area. However it seemed like this restaurant was somewhat attached to a community center, play park, apartment, study area, and church. There is plenty of parking and areas to sit outside which was nice, especially in the summer months. 

The menu isn't too crazy big so it won't make it too difficult to choose what you want to eat. However I would recommend the mushroom pizza as it is refreshing and light tasting as there isn't red sauce on it. White sauce pizzas are one of my favorites and this little cafe did not disappoint. I shared this pizza and a Caesar salad with one person and it was plenty of food for a lunch time meal. We even had some pizza left over. The fresh greens on top of the pizza added such a nice touch which was wonderful. There wasn't anything special about the salad, I would just say it tasted pretty classic. But it was good that is for sure. 

I also noticed the huge study area that is attached to this Café which was closed at the moment due to COVID19 however I can imagine that this is a hot place to study because there were a lot of places to sit and even private room areas for silent study.

Update: returned on Sunday afternoon, and it was super busy. Staff was still friendly and service was fast. Had a latte and the Harvest Pizza special- a wood fired pizza special with butternut squash, pork, sage, and onions. 10/10. 

This is probably my favorite coffee shop in West Lafayette. It has a huge breakfast, lunch, and coffee menu. Staff is friendly and quick, and the general atmosphere is very calm and welcoming. I had an almond milk latte, which was hot and tasty. Coffee is high quality. I also had a bacon, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich. Egg was cooked well but under seasoned. The bacon was cooked perfectly, and the everything beagle it came on was tasty. The patio out front is a great place to sit in the shade and enjoy the weather.

Totally loved the panini I had here. My food was fresh and warm and definitely hit the spot after a long day. I took off a star because they were out of a few side items when I was ordering. The order was ready pretty quickly and the tables were all very clean.

Place was a little hard to find, it's just north of where Smitty's used to be.  It's in a complex with a church, a school, and apartments.  Lots of room to spread out, or even go into another room altogether.

We were here during a very slow time so service was fast, but our pizzas were missing the torn basil.  We got a pile from the kitchen and all was good.  They had some specialty sodas, a pretty good college type menu, and the decor was kind of a cross between steampunk and industrial modern.

I am sure this place is busy when school's in session.  We'll try to visit again next time in town.

Awesome concept being attached to church & great hipster vibe/decor. Service was good/quick/polite even when they made an order error. Coffee was very good. Sadly, the breakfast foods were very meh, not much flavor; we had ordered 3 different items (ham panini, bacon bagel, sausage bagel) & all agreed on lackluster flavor.

I have been here several times, and I love the atmosphere. The place has trendy decor. It's great to grab coffee or lunch with a friend or catch up on work. The brick oven pizzas are by far my favorite! I love the smoked bbq pork and corn pizza. I know that sounds strange, but it's delicious and topped with a few veggies and chipotle. The pizza is a good sized portion. They cook the pizzas as they are ordered, and the wait is never too long!
Blasting music, tepid coffee, mediocre pastries and slow service. I've given Literato several chances over the last few years, and the establishment consistently disappoints.

Wow! What a great place to grab lunch when in West Lafayette.  About a mile north of Purdue, this place was packed on a Tuesday.  I found the last parking spot in their lot and headed inside.  The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating.  I placed my order at the front counter and after paying, gave my name and waited for the pickup counter to call it out.  Not the most efficient if people have the same name, but the food came out so quickly that as long as I was paying attention, I could get my food in hardly no time!  Fortunately, there were plenty of seats inside, so I sat down with my selections.  

I went with the Cranberry Walnut Chicken Salad sandwich and the Red Skin Potato Salad as my choice for a side.  The sandwich comes served on a rustic Italian bread (fairly thick) and the chicken salad was about an inch deep across the sandwich!  No skimping here!  The sandwich had just hint of blue cheese for depth to go with the dried cranberries, walnuts, lettuce, and Roma tomato slices.  Very hearty and flavorful!

The potato salad was excellent!  Instead of a mustard base, this creamy coating tasted more like butter.  The potatoes were diced and al dente for a nice bite, not mushy.  Just right for me!

The price for both options was under $10, so very reasonably priced for the amount of food offered.  I highly recommend this combo.

Oh, and before I forget, the walls are covered with text.  Some are informational, some inspirational, and others humorous.  It gave me something to look at while waiting for my order or while eating since I was dining by myself.

Note:  The customers are expected to clear their own tables and deposit the dishes and trash at a station by the door.  The staff does come by and clean the tables as well.

Review #283

Great portion size for the money. Fresh and healthy options. Fun atmosphere with many seating options. Great spot for breakfast or dinner. The music selection was Les Miserables and The Greatest Showman, but it wasn't obnoxious...They even had a gluten free breakfast option for me.
Food tastes slightly above average, but is very aesthetic for those who are interested. Moreover, the food is also fairly priced and served quickly, so there's not much to complain about.

Verdict: I'd go back - Quiet coffee place

Location: Okay
Decor: Good
Drink/Food: Okay
Service: Good
Price: Okay

Details: The location is a bit disconnected from the Purdue Campus but it is a good place to get away to when you want some quiet. Other reviews made it sound like it gets busy around lunchtime, but I had no issues finding empty tables on a saturday afternoon. I loved how quiet it was and it was a nice place to work. I would have liked to say comfy place to work too, but they have limited comfortable seating. Wifi was good. 

I got the almond milk latte and a Mediterrano Pizza (based on employee recommendation as the best pizza they have - see picture). I felt that both the latte and the pizza were just mediocre. Nothing to keep coming back for. I've heard their panini's are good, but that will have to be a future review. Prices would have been reasonable if the food tasted a little better. 
I also have to say that the folks working behind the counter were very nice and courteous.

I was in town visiting some friends at Purdue, and they suggested that we go here for brunch. It is in a good location, and the inside is very bright and airy. Rather than table service, you order the food and pick it up at the counter, so if you're looking to go somewhere to eat and really be able to talk with friends this is a good place to go. I think the food and prices matched pretty well, but the reason for my 3 stars was because of a pineapple situation. That sounds really weird, I know, but I am allergic to pineapple, so I asked about what fruit came in the seasonal fruit cup. Being allergic to pineapple sucks because it's so yummy, but I just can't have it. They said that there is pineapple in the fruit cup, so I asked if I could have double of whatever other fruit they were feeling instead of pineapple. When I got my fruit cup, they ended up still putting pineapple in it and charging me for a whole other fruit cup even though my sandwich was supposed to come with one. I was really confused and also worried because if someone was more allergic than me and ended up with pineapple, that could be a really big problem :( 

The food and coffee were good, but I was a bit put off by the whole experience when I went up to the counter to tell the person ringing what happened and she seemed very reluctant to have the manager come over to try to do a refund. I ended up just passing it off and deciding that I probably wouldn't go back.

In town on business and heard about Cafe Literato and checked it out for lunch. This is definitely a spot that I would both recommend and return to if I were local. The restaurant is open and just a nice space. I liked that you order at the counter and then head up to the pass to get your food from the kitchen.

I had the Brick Oven Pork sandwich and a bowl of tomato bisque soup. The sandwich was really good but what put it over the top was that Italian batard bread. Wow. Nice and light/crispy on the outside and soft and moist inside. While the pork was good, all I kept thinking about was replacing the smoked pork with some really good porketta. It would be just killer on that bread. Either way, I'd suggest they hit the sandwich with some pan drippings because the only drawback was that the pork was a little dry. Not to fear, I was dunking it in the bisque, which was delicious...rich, flavorful, and with little bits of crushed tomato left over from the blending process. So good. 

I'd probably head back there tomorrow but have other joints to patronize and try out while I'm here.

Thanks, Literato, for a great lunch.

Chose this spot for vegetarian options as we passed thru West Lafayette.  A large, bright and lively spot on a Sunday morning, filled with students and churchgoers, Cafe Literato is attached to a church and feels like a community center with food. Order at the counter, find a table.

The menu offered lots of expected beverages, including smoothies and baked goods, sandwiches, salads and soups. Ordered an all-veggie grilled sandwich and appreciated the offering: eggplant, zucchini, peppers.  Unfortunately, the tomato soup was sweet and cloying, and the grilled cheese just ok. Mango smoothie was a hit. A good place to meet friends but not the food we'd hoped for.

Cafe Literato is attached to a large church off Northwestern. It has a creative and upscale variety of pizzas, salads, and sandwiches. They also serve coffee and smoothies. I especially appreciate their variety of vegetarian options. I haven't been disappointed with their food when I've eaten here. I've had and can personally recommend the grilled cheese, margherita pizza, shiitake mushroom pizza, and red pepper and feta panini. 

The atmosphere is also really nice with famous authors' quotes etc on the wall. Great lighting and decoration as well. 

It's worth stopping by if you're in the mood for a light lunch/brunch or better coffee than Starbucks.

It's an excellent place to lunch or dinner. It's location is perfect, because isn't to close or to far to Purdue. Each one of my family ordered a different sandwich and all of them was exquisite. The friendly employee suggested a flavored latte, oh my Gosh was delicious. Every time will return to visit my daughter at Purdue I will stop at this place.

I'm a student at Purdue, and Cafe Literato is my friends' and I go-to place for a delicious off-campus lunch or dinner. Their sandwiches never disappoint, always flavorful and fresh. They also have awesome pizza, with plenty of interesting (and delicious flavors). It's only about a mile from campus, and also includes a student-friendly study space in the building its attached to. Great spot for a quick and well-priced meal!

This is probably one of my favorite hangout places. It's a great place to study and a nice place to have lunch! The people are always friendly and super nice. The food is a little more on the expensive side, however, their brick oven pizzas are so good! Their salads are very big and are always made fresh. I absolutely love this place!

reviews.text: This is another of our family favorites! We love the family atmosphere and the food! Cathy always greets me by name and asks about my family. The food is authentic and very reasonable. We are so blessed to have this option! They also have a lovely outdoor patio and a drive through.

I went here for an early lunch today and was blown away by every aspect of this restaurant. It was spotless & you could literally smell the cleaning products they used when you walk in the door. Obviously, with COVID, that's much appreciated. I ordered grape leaves (came with 2), a bowl of lemon rice soup, a side of falafel (came with 6) with tzatziki, and cheese pie. All of this, plus a 20% tip, was only $16!! I had maybe a couple of bites of the soup because I was already stuffed from everything else, but I couldn't recommend it enough. Soup- perfect. Cheese pie- best I've ever had. Tzatziki- delicious & homemade. Grape leaves- flavorful & tender. Falafel- not my favorite but I'm pretty picky when it comes to falafel. Would 100% eat here again. Customer service was great & they had my order ready FAST. Next time I want to try the spinach and cheese pie & see how it compares to the cheese pie.

Parthenon serves some of the best food you can get in West Lafayette for sure! When I used to work in the area I'd buy a stack of pita and a tub of hummus and be set for lunches for the week. The hummus is so light and fluffy- it's my favorite hummus! Their gyros are delicious and super filling.

Service is always friendly and quick. It's such a great little lunch spot; I recommend getting bite here if you're ever in the area.

Ordered dinner online on a Saturday. Ordering was quick but they wouldn't take payment over the phone. Used their drive through for pickup. The food was ok, but nothing really stood out. We ordered the Gyro sandwich with greek fries, feta plate, falafel sandwich with green bean side. Verdict: Maybe if you're really craving greek food.

Came here on a weeknight for dinner.

There is ample parking in the parking lot.  This resto is located in a strip mall and the last place I expected to find authentic Greek food. The owners are Greek the menu is authentic but limited. We ordered the Gyros platter and a salad.

Food came out quickly was hot and delicious this is the only place I have found in Indiana that serves mythos beer.   this beer is authentically Greek and even harder to locate in Chicago.

I would definitely come back and it is an order at the counter style with the food being delivered to your table.

Make the trek to this location for the only REAL Greek food left in this town. They even have a drive through, if you want to call ahead and take it home.

Atmosphere is low key and family friendly. Fun old photos on the walls. They do serve beer and wine, if that's your thing. 

The food is so good! Lemon rice soup is the best I have tried. It has a creamy texture, with a light bite of lemon. The gyro meat is homemade and so is the yogurt sauce! You really can beat it anywhere. Feta chucks on the salad are large, fresh and delicious. They have all of the other Greek favorites you might be looking for, including a sampler where you can try the classics! Try this place!

The food is good, but we decided to stop going here after the owner was really rude to us for no reason. The last time we were there he got angry at us because we didn't have a number on our table. Our cashier didn't give us one and we didn't think to ask (because we don't work there so how the hell are we supposed to know); we told him we didn't get a number and he angrily said "next time get a number!" WTF?! I don't need to be snapped at for no reason, so now we go to the other Greek place because those owners are really, really nice.
Best food from top to bottom of menu.  Gyros are great, but the salads and lemon soup, turkish coffee and desserts are outstanding. The feta plate is perfect!

I really like this place!  I took my daughter and her friend (both college students) here for lunch while I was visiting during the day.   The food was excellent and service was great.  Location is about a 10 minute drive from campus and easy to find!  I wouldn't hesitate to go back.  The ambience was a little sterile and bathrooms needed attended to otherwise I could give this place a 5-star.

Tried it for the first time, yesterday. I ordered gyros and fries. The meat was bland. The tzatziki also lacked flavor, as did the fries.

I would rather get my Greek grub elsewhere, across town.

I first started going to Parthenon at their old location (Chauncey Hill) just under 20 years ago and it is still a must-visit when I am back in the area.  Don't let the (new-ish) fast casual chain look fool you, this place is a long time family business that takes their food quality and consistency seriously, run by great people.

The gyros meat here is exceptional: plenty of lamb flavor, made in house (very rare, 99% of Greek/Med/etc restaurants serve mass-manufactured gyros from Kronos), sliced very thin, and always browned nicely.  The rest of the menu is mostly very good as well, but the gyros meat is the star for me.  I have been searching for something similar for 10+ years in the greater Los Angeles area and nothing is yet to compare.  Love this place!

Great food!  I have not once been disappointed by the quality and flavor.  I definitely enjoy coming here.  The star loss is for service.  I have not once been here where I received acceptable service.  The servers have always been short and borderline rude.  When you ask for an extra napkin (because all you get are those thin cheap napkins) and they look annoyed...that's not good.  Especially when you are one of three total tables sitting down.

I will continue coming here because the food is good and just hope the service gets better.
Great falafel but I can't stop thinking about their hummus and pita. It's was delicious.

The falafel sandwich was amazing. And even better, so was the staff. The owners were working the register and it was evident that they cared about their business and customers. They made polite conversation with everyone that walked in and several customers appeared to be regulars, as the staff knew their orders. It is nice to see a business with people who are passionate about the food and the people.

Fantastic authentic Greek diner! We had moussaka and a gyro, and started out with agelomena soup. Everything was tasty. This place is old school in the best way, reminding me of my earlier days at Greek diners in New Jersey. Satisfying!

We picked up takeout from here the other night. I had a chicken gyro and wasn't that impressed. The pita was fine, but the meat was a bit tough and fatty and tzatziki sauce was watery and clumpy. I much prefer both the chicken and tzatziki at Captain Gyro's. I did like that this sandwich came with cucumbers in addition to tomatoes and onions. We shared Greek fries. The fries themselves were pretty mediocre but I did like the feta and seasonings on top. The fries were about a dollar more than the online menu says, which always annoys me. My husband had the combo platter (which was expensive - $17 - but came with a lot of food) and he was more pleased with the food than I was.

This became my go-to place given that I live right down the street. I love their honey cake, falafel pita classic, and hummus appetizer (totally my go-tos). I've also had the Greek fries but they left much to be desired. To be fair this probably isn't where you should go and have fries, though. Now that I'm leaving the area for good, I will miss my frequent stops here on my way home.

My go to Greek place around Purdue.  Same as in the original location on Chauncey, now with a bit more flare and more "American" options.  Same classic, time-tested recipes.

At this occasion we had lemon rice soup, spinach pie, the Parthenon platter (a bit of everything), and Vilage chicken.  The service was prompt and friendly as always.  Food spot on.  Moist chicken, moussaka properly spiced, gyro meat moist and flavorful.  

Highly recommend this hidden gem to all Boilermakers... makes me want to go back to my college years!!  Such great memories!

Thank you Parthenon!

Finally a newer construction Greek grill and nor a Mexican. This place was a gem with Gyros and several variety of ethnic Greek dishes in a fast setting as there is a drive thru I believe here as well. The place is clean and you can walk up for refills and there seems ample seating in this strip mall location far from everything else in this area. Many college students make the trek here and few I would imagine would be disappointed by the quality of food

I've been going here since I was a student mumble mumble years ago.  I simply love their food.  Saganaki, house made gyros and sauce.  Better than your average gyro you get around Chicago.  Every time we head through the area we stop.

reviews.text: Amazing Irish recipes mean fine, tasty dining with great brews! Our party enjoyed dining on the outdoor patio which is partially sheltered.

We were taking Daughter 1 back for 2nd semester of sophomore year. It was cold and chilly out, so some warm stick-to-ribs food sounded good. It was a Saturday night, but we got right in and sat in the "patio" area.  The service was fine, but I could tell that it,might suffer on a busier night. I ordered a Smithmick's and settled in. The appetizer was the Pot of Gomd and came out pretty quickly. I had the fisherman's stew and we also had corn beef and cabbage as well as the patty melt sandwich and breaded tenderloin. Everything came out piping hot and was quite tasty. I would like to go back and try a few other good looking items.  One caution, if any is thr parking...not much.

I got fried fish tacos and they were amazing!! Mashed potatoes are also great! Next time, I'm excited to try the fish n chips. Our waiter was really nice, and I felt they did a great job spreading out tables for social distancing. I haven't dined in a lot during Covid, and so it was a relief to see them take precautions. The furniture is really unique here- I loved the style!

We've met friends here a couple of times for drinks and appetizers. For Celiacs, the menu is pretty limiting but the atmosphere is nice. 

Even pre-pandemic, the eastside location is quiet on weekdays nights so a good place to catch up and chat with friends. The decor is appealing and the staff is friendly and courteous. 

There are an okay amount of gluten-free drink selections but again the food  choices can definitely use an improvement. That said, after the pandemic ends, it's a place I'd stop by again for a drink with friends. But dinner will be served elsewhere.

Fun spot to have dinner with my favorite 
Boilermaker  We started with the Irish nachos, they were , the potatoes are cottage fries. I had the Ruben, it was ok, but too much bread. The Irish stew was very good and the fish and chip was fabulous
Of course, we had dessert...the shamrock pie & seasonal pumpkin cheesecake were delicious
An essential visit when you're in West Lafayette. The food is great and they have friendly service. My family loves to eat there whenever they can! The staff and owners are especially wonderful.

YUMMM!!!! This location is super close to Purdue campus and has the best outdoor patio in WL. With the colder weather approaching, I layered up pretty significantly and ate on their patio. The area is under a tent, heated SO well, and has fans going--in addition to some openings in the tent. I was super comfortable here, parking was easy, and the food was phenomenal! I had a nice beer and an amazing half-order of corned beef, mashed potatoes, and cabbage. Mind you, this was only a half-order and was quite the heap of delicious food! The meal also included a tasty slice of soda bread. I'll definitely be back!!

Friendly staff and nice sized portions! 
The fried fish was huge! Unfortunately it wasn't as flavorful as I would have liked. The batter needed more salt and seasoning. The stew and pots of gold were yummy!

Got some food hear the other day at really enjoyed it. We ordered the Shepard's Pie and the Fish and Chips. I was not that impressed with the Shepard's Pie. It came with the mashed potatoes mixed in as opposed to baked on top (like a pie crust). The fish and chips though we're fantastic. Not too battered and plenty of fish inside. The half order filled me up. Would definitely go back for that.

My daughter attends Purdue.  I am Irish.  It was a no brainer.   Amazing reuben sandwiches, banger sandwiches (winter special) and fish and chips.  For appetizers goat cheese fritters, fried pickles and the pots of gold.  All good.  Their Irish soda bread is some of the best I have had and I have had a lot!  Yum.  The atmosphere is fantastic and this and the West location.  Love the people, food, beer and atmosphere...never disappointed.  I keep saying I will have to try more places but cannot break the habit.  Thanks

The food here is fantastic. Everything I've tried has been great- fish and chips, corned beef Reuben, bangers and mash, fried pickles- all incredible. Great quality food, with indoor and outdoor seating, and a cozy and fun Irish pub theme. I definitely recommend! Next time I go, I want to try a dessert!

One of my fav dishes at an Irish pub is mussels. Since I wasn't very hungry, having driven all day, this sort ofmeal was perfect!  The sauce is creamier than the place in Ann Arbor, but still got soaked up by the bread. 

Trey was great!  I sat outside (sweating) but I avoid eating indoors these days.  The table spacing needs to be increased IMHO.  It wasn't busy that night, so only four other tables had guests. 

This is a comebackable place.
Love this place. All the food we ordered tasted good. We sat outdoor. Will go back again in the future. Fish and chip is a must. Parking is not an issue the time we went, early about 5pm.
We love going here, food is consistently great and service is too. Their fish and chips are 100%!

I can't believe that I've never reviewed this place before. The food, alcohol, and service are all good. The side room with the fireplace is nice on a chilly night. The menu covers Irish favorites like Guiness stew, Shepherd's pie, fish and chips, etc. but also has fish tacos, burgers, mussels, etc. Everything that I've eaten here has been good. 

On the down side, it is pretty noisy and, even with their overflow parking lot, parking sucks. 

Most recently, we hosted a party of 14 here. They were very accommodating and welcoming from the initial phone call. They put our group on the patio which has a roof, heaters, tent-like sides. The patio was quieter than inside and was warm even on a cold rainy night. Great service for a large party.

Stopped for dinner on Sunday night with my prospective Purdue student. He had the fish and chips it was such a plentiful serving that he couldn't eat it all. I had the open faced roast beef and it was delicious. Everything was delightfully presented. They do an excellent job with social distancing and safety.

Had a great dinner with great service and literally marveled at how affordable our bill was.  Will be back!

I need to be gluten free and they have a great allergy guidance sheet for those who need such information.  The specials were even marked on menu if they were GF or not!  I had the fisherman's shepherds pie and it was amazingly awesome comfort food.  A huge treat in my GF dining world of usual salads and plain dishes.  They have nice selection of hard coders as well.

Hubby got a Guinness and the Guinness stew which looked great and he finished and said was great as well.  Pub chips as an appetizer with very nice mustard dipping sauce.

Sorry no pictures-we dug I'm too quick!:-)
The food is always amazing and the wait staff on point. Yummy food and delicious libations, one of my fave places to go!

Passing through town and found this gem and tried it based on Yelp reviews and was not disappointed.  A couple of Harp lagers (on tap) and a couple of Rubens was all it took ... we were already planning our next trip before the check arrived.  Thanks Yelp and thanks Nine Irish Brothers.

One of my favorite restaurants in West Lafayette! It's family owned and it has one of the best fish and chips and pint of Guinness you can find in the country! The food is amazing. I would recommend the fish and chips, Reuben, shepherd's pie, and Pot of Gold's. 

Prices are a little bit more expensive than the rest of West Lafayette, but you are paying for quality. It has a big inside Irish pub feel and a back patio for those summer months. They have a good amount of TVs to watch sports too. Service has been adequate for every time I've went. Overall, I love this place!

reviews.text:
Mountain Jack's is still our favorite north-of-Indy, cozy restaurant for prime rib and seafood!
We made an early dinner reservation for two in the bar area on a Saturday. So glad we did -- given social distancing -- as that leaves just two intimate booths available. We enjoyed cocktails, dinner salads, stuffed mushrooms appetizer, prime rib entree (requested a lean cut) and salmon entree served Oscar style. Everything was positively top notch and delicious!!
Our server / bartender, Ryan, was simply delightful -- so friendly and she even gave courtesy chuckles to my hubby's dad jokes! 
Looking forward to dining again at MJ's on our next road trip north!
Forest mushroom chicken was to die for. The lighting is amazing, desserts are delicious. Highly recommend.

Definitely the best steakhouse in the area. The prime rib is king, but the ribeye is a close second. I've always loved this place. Classic, dark, has a lodge sort of feel. Desserts change and they bring you a platter to view before you order, which is classy. Mom-Thurs they have early bird specials which include an entree and side. Check those out from 5-6pm. Hade the rare prime rib special, broccoli and added a salad. Delicious! I love it when I order a rare piece of beef and it actually comes out rare. 

This place is always classy. Seemed a little busy during COVID for us, but they clearly were trying. Will always support this classic spot.

Can I give this place 4+ stars ? Like maybe 4.5 stars. They really pulled through on getting us in on Christmas Eve for our reservation. We had been calling for 3 days and it just kept going to an automatic answer, which you could not leave a voicemail on. We tried calling during their business hours after 5pm and again no answer... same auto answer. We finally went online and tried to put in a reservation. Someone called us back the next day and fit us in. The atmosphere is lovely. Several fireplaces, and I love how it has a coat check next to the entrance. This is Lafayette's finest dining restaurant. It was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the atmosphere was cozy. Our waiter told us the restaurant opened in 1977. This place is a classic.

Most meals come with soup or salad. We got the house salad. They used to make it in front of you. Now, instead, you have to tell them what you want on the salad. You can also add bacon and/or mushrooms. Trust me, add the bacon !  They give you plenty and the flavor is amazing ! It's more like finely chopped ham than bacon. They have several house-made dressings. I got the red wine vinegar creamy dressing. Very yummy ! I got the crab cakes to start off.  They were fresh-made, but I think they used the canned crab with alot of breading. The flavor reminded me of a salmon patty. Decent, but not the lump-crab meat patties that I'm used to. My best friend got the prime rib rare. This is supposedly what they are known for. It comes with an au ju sauce and house-made horseradish cream sauce. I also got the largest prime rib. It was 1.5lbs and bone-in steak. The knife I was given was not sharp and they had to trade it out. I guess these are the same ones from the 70s lol. It was good, but even with the replaced knife I had to work too hard to saw into the meat in order to cut it into pieces. My husband got the Ribeye. He had ordered it medium well, but it came out medium. He liked it fine. Definately get the augratin potatoes as your side !  They are cheesy and delicious !!! Another person in our group got the NY Strip. He had ordered it rare and it came out medium well. He sat for quite a while (We were 1/4 complete with our meal) before the waiter finally checked back and then put in an order to replace his steak. The waiter was a bit of a smarty pants. He kind of had an attitude like, .... well I'll work here if I must. Lol  Supposedly, this place is known for their mud pie, but we didn't have enough room for dessert. Total bill was about $100 for 2 people including wine and an appetizer. This is a nice place to have a romantic evening.

Came in for dinner with my husband. It was great as normal. Service  was great especially our waitress Taylor. She was so nice very attentive our cups never went dry. 
For dinner we had French onion soup,filet mignon  with au gratin potatoes. My husband had prime rib and mash potatoes  with au gratin potatoes  as well. It all was very good we tryed all the shrimp add ons as well my favorite  was the scampi he agreed. For dessert we had apple strudel with ice cream just the right sweetness to end the night. My husband had a samuel Adam's off the tap and it was very yummy also.

Went here this evening for a kid free night in the town. Service was great. Food was excellent. Had the crab cakes for an appetizer, they are amazing. Got the prime rib for my entree. Was seasoned perfectly and cooked to my liking. Glad we chose to splurge a little!
Ask for Jeff or Jerry! They will make sure you're taken care of and have a great experience!
Great food. Great service. The calamari appetizer is worth it all by itself. Will definitely be back for the forest mushroom chicken

I wish that I wore a nicer shirt. ;)

This restaurant was recommended by the front desk staff at a nearby hotel. Overall, I do not have any complaints about my dinner at Mountain Jack's. 

I dropped by for an early dinner and grabbed a seat at the bar to have a nice, 'romantic' dinner alone. *I'm not sure if I really had a choice with my seating.* The steak menu is pretty vast. Since I had steak the night before, I was debating between the Mahi tuna or pork chop. *When I was a kid, I was told to never order fish from a steakhouse, so I went with the pork chop for this visit.* Before starting, I went for the crabcake as my appetizer. The crab cakes were just ok. I think that I would have preferred them without the dill sauce because the sauce seemed to drown out the flavor of the crab cakes. My main course, the sweet and sour porks chop, was pretty fascinating. After dinner, I was presented with a tray of super-rich desserts, however, I was far too full from dinner to order a dessert. Looking back, I wish that I had skipped the crab cakes so I would have had more room for a dessert. 

The bartender, who also served as my waitress since I was at the bar, was very friendly and prompt.

If im back in the Lafayette area, I would give Mountain Jack's a second try. I'll just be sure to wear a nicer shirt for my next visit.

I have dined at Mountain Jacks multiple times, typically when Business Associates come into town. We haves dined with family in the main dining room and on my anniversary in the bar area. Stepping into the bar is like going back in time and experience the 50's and not in a bad way. I have never in 8+ visits had a bad experience. You will pay for it in the pocket book so be prepared; it's worth it.

I will update this post with pictures and update the review when I visit again. In the mean time this is currently the only place I send people for the best steak and experience in Lafayette. That's not to say I don't have another go to; but let's be honest, Texas Roadhouse is nation wide and I never recommend that even though I eat it. 

C'est si bon

I didn't get any pics because I was too busy enjoying my daughter's birthday and the amazing food at Mountain Jacks's! 
We started with a bottle of wine and a sampler platter. We loved everything on the sample platter but especially the sauce the shrimp were in. It was like a spicy kind of buffalo sauce but not buffalo sauce. I can't describe it but it was sooo good!!!
We all got the table salad not only was it yummy it was actually pretty fun having it made at the table. My daughter doesn't eat red meat so she got the Barramundi fish. I tried it. It had great flavor with a very soft texture. My husband got the porterhouse steak and he said it was the best he's ever had. He eats his med rare so, I didn't try it but he definitely doesn't say something is the best if it's not. I got the ribeye. It was tender with amazing flavor and a nice crisp outside. Loved it! I almost don't have words for their delicious homemade bread. I believe it may be a sour dough. Oh my, this could be dangerous for me if we lived closer! 
I've only eaten at two restaurants in Lafayette. One was East End Grill and now Mountain Jack's. I liked East End Grill...especially their truffle fries but there's no comparison to Mountain Jack's. Mountain Jack's is by far the winner! Their prices were very reasonable as well.

I have never dined here until recently on a Saturday evening I tried to make reservations and realize it had to be done through the website and so I submitted it on a Saturday around 1 PM in the afternoon I called after they opened as I had not heard back only to find out that reservations are only taken the day prior luckily I called and was able to secure a reservation
Upon arrival we had a brief wait prior to being seated the waiting area has seating and a huge unused fireplace when we were seated our table was on the edge of a main walking thorough fare as well as 6 feet away from either the kitchen or a busy area where orders are picked up and or dropped off the location of our table I thought would give us great service due to its proximity to the kitchen but I was wrong
We actually sat at the table without water and without anyone greeting us after the hostess had seated us for over eight minutes
Our waitress seemed very nice she did tell us she was bringing us bread but never brought it further she had no specials to share nor any opinion to give us about the menu never asked us if we had a special occasion we were celebrating or if this was our first time visit to the restaurant it was very matter-of-fact
We both ordered the prime rib in two different cuts and both arrived lukewarm and overcooked it is definitely a hearty meal and generous in its portions as well as the size that a company at the pricing is very fair considering the area
We did opt for the peanut butter pie and it ended up being more savory than sweet
I have only heard great things about this place prior to dining here and was definitely disappointed

Mountain Jack's provided a relatively quick, filling meal for me and my family on the way home from a trip to Chicago.

It was A-OK, as my rating denotes.

We were quickly seated in the restaurant, which looks a lot like a forest lodge with dark wood and fireplaces.

I started with the tableside salad bar, intrigued by what exactly that was. This ended up being the waiter rolling a cart up to the table, on top of which was a platter with lots of cups filled with salad mix-ins. 

The tableside salad bar is a nice touch. Everyone can pick and choose what they want without leaving their seats.

Continuing with the items Mountain Jack's seems to be known for, I chose the prime rib. This is listed as being "award winning," herb crusted and slow roasted overnight. 

And it was OK -- not the best and not the worst prime rib I've had. It was a little tougher in parts, but the spices on it worked well.

The rest of my family generally enjoyed their meals. Considering we have a variety of tastes, it was good to find a restaurant we all could find something at. It was also convenient that this restaurant is so close to the interstate.

There are few people in life that are perfectly suited for their job but Eric was awesome at not only patiently entertaining every question we had but also making terrific suggestions tailored to the unique personalities around the table. We spent a few hours at the restaurant huddled in a booth talking about our conference, life in general and enjoying the far more honest than anticipated conversations that the relaxing atmosphere encouraged. We had amazing tableside salads that Eric suggested and prepared for us. Friendly service, great attitude and he was on top of all our orders! The food was great, service was quick and all orders received were exactly as we hoped (medium, medium rare, etc.). Definitely worth a trip during your visit to the area. Within walking distance to the Courtyard Marriott in Lafayette.
Mountain Jack's is THE destination restaurant when traveling to IN. As a regional endurance athlete food quality, extraordinary service, with reservation to protect my time. A 5 Star destination!

Mountain Jack's ROCKS!  We ordered birthday dinner for 5 last Saturday. Everything was absolutely perfect. Very well seasoned and scrumptious. In these tough times, it's good to know that we can count on these restaurant professionals to maintain their normal high standards.  We highly recommend this Lafayette local treasure!

Mountain Jack's was a nice place to celebrate a birthday on a Sunday evening. We called a few hours before for a reservation and when we arrived we were greeted with a friendly face and we were asked I a very kind tone what we were celebrating. We were immediately seated at a table with menus and water. We were then tended to quickly and ordered appetizers and drinks. We ordered the cocktail shrimp and the potato skins. The potato skins were decent, kind of hard to mess up, but also didn't seem to have a ton of flavor. The shrimp was prepared well and were served 6 jumbo shrimps. They were good size. The sauce was not spicy enough for us, so we asked for more horseradish on the side. We are in love with St. Elmo's shrimp cocktail and so we like it hot! I ordered the whiskey glazed salmon with garlic mashed potatoes and onion strings. The entrees also came with a choice of soup or salad. The soup of the day was split pea soup with bacon and also offered French onion. I got the opted for the caesar salad and it was alright. The French onion soup was very much so French ONION soup, as there were tons of onion in the soup. I found the soup very sweet and the salad subpar. The  salmon was flaky and cooked well. It was very very salty and ended up scraping most of the glaze off. The mashed potatoes were alright, again not great but decent. The steaks were cooked well and everyone was impressed with the portion sizes for the price. We were also given a complementary dessert since we were celebrating a birthday. They brought us a huge slice of their mud pie and it was delicious. We also ordered a slice of the chocolate mousse pie as well and everyone seemed to prefer the mud pie. We did have an egg allergy and the desserts did have egg. Overall it was nice for Lafayette/West Lafayette.

I can't get over how affordable this place is. For $25 I was able to get a 10 oz ribeye cooked a perfect medium, with a "Neil style" topping (hollandaise, bacon, blue cheese, sautéed onions, sautéed mushrooms). It came with two sides plus a salad. That's a lot of food for $25. And it was so delicious, far better than the more expensive fare at the numerous chain steakhouses in the area. 

It's a nice decor. Much more intimate and a bit more old fashioned than the nearby competition. Their bar is stocked with several fantastic bourbons, liquors and craft beer bottles. And I haven't even mentioned the great and polite service. All in all a great find that I'll be sure to revisit. And I still can't get over the fantastic price!

9/11/19 Calamari was very good. Long Island iced tea was not bad. Award winning prime rib was excellent. Amazing onion straws and garlic mashed potatoes. Other than incredibly slow service, this was a great experience.
Great service and delicious meal. Menu explanations were very good. Waitress very accommodating and friendly.

reviews.text: We bought take out from here for dinner tonight and it was delicious. We had Pad Ga-Prow (Basil) with extra vegetables and Thai Fried Rice with Chicken. Both were delicious. The quality was as good as any Thai food we have had in this price range anywhere in the US.

We've been trying to do as much curbside pick-ups as possible given the current situation and although not everyone is willing to offer this service, Thai Essence were superb. The staff were all courteous, efficient, and more than happy to take payment over the phone and drop our order in our car. Much appreciated!

I just got their Tom Yung Kung. This is a very yummy seafood soup, lots of flavor, shrimp and mushrooms! I was expecting it to be a little spicier given the chilli sign next to it, but I also do have very high tolerance! I did feel that for the price of $7.95, the portion could be a little bigger.

Would I go back? Yes! 

Keep up the great work and thank you for your service.

Very authentic Thai food. Just enough spice not to burn. Quick service. Enjoyed the take out and very organized. I will definitely come back. 
Highly recommend the drunken noodles.

The Pineapple Curry Stir Fry is delicious. I usually don't like coconut, but it was toasted and add just the right flavor to the dish. 

Their takeout system right now is also so easy! It is obvious they are taking extra precautions during the quarantine, such as grabbing my credit card with a wash cloth and sanitizing all the pens after use. 

Thanks for a great experience :)

I'm torn between an "as good as it gets" 5 star and a "yay!  I'm a fan" 4 star.  I mean, it's Lafayette - it's literally the only Thai restaurant, so it is literally as good as it gets.  That said, it's also delicious, although the menu lacks a couple of items (mainly in the dessert category) that I'd like to see.

I've been a few times - both eating in and taking out.  I'm a consistent Thai diner - I always get pad see ew with tofu (essentially, a thick, floppy noodle with a lot of soy, with tofu), and -- if they have it -- sweet sticky rice with custard.  Because I'm boring like that, my eating experience is consistent, and tasty.  Aside from the lack of sticky rice.

In terms of dining in, it's a perfectly pleasant experience.  That said, the restaurant itself (at least the eating area) is fairly small, so if you're planning on coming on a busy night, you're probably going to feel rather cramped.  I generally get take out on busy nights, and dine in on a casual Tuesday.

I see another review suggesting that the staff was rude, and the portions small.  I haven't had that experience.  The portions are appropriate for one meal - you're not going to walk away hungry, and you're not going to need a box.  It's just right.  The staff seemed a bit harried, but that's pretty typical for a busy restaurant.

Went for dinner, and instead of a nice quiet dining experience, we were yelled at by the chef/owner/manager. He came storming out of the kitchen with a plate of fried rice and proceeded to chew me out for ordering it without onions... the food he just made was going to go to waste  it was my fault, I was inconsiderate, etc. right after ordering, I asked the waiter to hold the onions, but apparently the dish had already been made. I would have been happy to pay for it, but he was too busy chewing me out in front of all the other diners to even hear that fact. We paid for soup and drinks and whatever else and will never return. It is a shame, as we have been dine-In and take-out customers since it opened. Can't support a business that treats customers like dirt. I honestly have never had such a horrible experience dining out.

This place is my most favorite Thai restaurant anywhere and definitely my most favorite restaurant in West Lafayette Indiana. I usually always order a spicy basil fried rice with tofu. They make the best version of this. Pad Kee Mao, Pad Thai, yellow curry and sautéed eggplant are perfect too. I went with people who are on low carb diets and TE accommodated by replacing the rice.
Great service. Pad Thai was delicious and my husband had the cashew chicken meal. Such great depth of flavors with just the right amount of spice.

My daughter brought me here as a treat.  I had never tried Thai food, but always wanted to do so.  

Thai Essence is an immaculate, intimate space, where you are served with care.  The servers are knowledgeable and kind.  You are encouraged to ask questions about the menu, and the food is superb.  Very fresh.  The curry was spicy but not overwhelmingly so.  The spring rolls we had as appetizers were delicate and perfectly done.

I've since returned and ordered the Pad Ram, with a side of rice.  It was very good.  The cabbage was still crisp and the chicken was tender, not tough.  The sauce was exceptional.

Incredible Thai restaurant!  All of their dishes are well done, from the soups and apps to the curries and fried dishes.  

The service is incredible.... the waitstaff is very knowledgeable and friendly.

Was really surprised by how good the thai food is, i moved here from LA where we have decent thai food and this place beats any place i have been to in LA. The food is so good i get the thai fried rice.... just made sure to keep in consideration that they close for lunch at 230pm and reopen for dinner. Dont hesitate to order here

I love Thai Essence to bits. I used to hop and the bus, stop off in front of the Medical Research Center place (the pyramid building), walk across the highway, just to eat there. It and Basil Thai have the same owner, and they have pretty much the same thing. However, Thai Essence's menu is more extensive than Basil Thai. Both do take-out, but no delivery. Additionally, I find portions at Thai Essence are bigger than at Basil Thai.

My favorite by far is that Thai Essence has a section called Hot Plates. More often than not have the Duck Pra Ram or the hot plate that has lychee, but honesty everything is good here. This is the foremost place I take people if they haven't gone there before. It's more upscale, an actual restaurant versus a mom & pop shop.

If you're looking to impress someone, whether it's on a date, an interview, business meeting, alumni, or family, this is the place to go. And IT'S A REALLY GOOD PLACE FOR PEOPLE WHO'VE NEVER EATEN THAI FOOD BEFORE. You're sure to be in for a good experience. The portions are HUGE, especially if you get the curry pineapple fried rice (hugely popular). 

It's a classy place. Seriously, this is the go-to place I recommend and make reservations to for when friends' have family coming over they need to show off to or visiting speakers/trainers for club. I would recommend dinner. Again, more extensive menu. And pretty much any of the desserts.

BUT DON'T BE FOOLED, YOU CAN DRESS CASUAL. It's definitely more upscale, but the prices are pretty much the same and it's good for all occasions. So while you do have business men and women, advisers, counselors, and families coming in and out, you can definitely slum it as a college student and it's just fine. My club was the Bujinkan Yanagi Dojo, a martial arts club. We would sometimes take our speaker/trainer there after seminars, and almost everyone would come in training duds.Staff is cool like that and attentive.

They do reservations, but it tends to be more immediate. As they're more than a bit out of the way, walk-ins are easier with them. However, they're popular enough that if there is some big event going on, reserve early. They don't do 6 months ahead early, but one or two months ahead should suffice. They're REALLY good for large parties. Unlike Basil Thai, they have the room. Aforementioned seminar crowd had about 12 (walk-in) and I took a family of 7 (reservation) there another time. Both times, we fit comfortable in the back.

Thai Essence is a place where we can always enjoy a delicious and beautiful meal served by a friendly staff. They have a nice selection of wine as well. I don't agree that it is pricey. If one wants "cheap" food, it's best to stick with processed burgers and fries and we have plenty of options for that in town. If you enjoy fresh vegetables and herbs and meats, then it's understood that the price will reflect that as well. We love Thai Essence!

Get the seafood dumplings that are only served at lunch

All meals are good though!

Aammaazziinngg!

My new favorite Thai place! I've been craving pad thai lately but the Thai place right on Purdue's campus is rather mediocre. Thankfully I found this place!! Their chicken pad thai was fantastic, and their thai tea was not overwhelmingly sweet. We also got chicken satay as an appetizer and the sauce was delicious. The service was great, and we sat at our table for about an hour after our meal just talking and I didn't feel pressured by staff to leave the way some restaurants kind of rush you out. This was an excellent experience and I will definitely be back!

Food has always been mediocre but acceptable (albeit rather overpriced) but after the owner/manager openly screamed at a diner last night I will certainly not be returning. Any restaurant that treats its patrons with such flagrant disrespect is not worth my money or my time, even if it is the only "Thai" food in town. If you want good Thai food and good service, find another town or learn to cook it yourself. I promise you the experience will be better.

The food here is pretty good, and the response to COVID-19 is the best I've seen yet around town. All employees wear masks, they take your credit card with a sanitized towel, ask you to sign with a pen that you then place in sanitizer, and you pick up the food from a side table. And the space is marked for proper spacing. Well done.

YUM!

Excellent Pad Thai Chicken and Pad Thai Shrimp!  Exceedingly attentive service!

If we lived in West Lafayette, we would be here weekly.

Food is pretty good but VERY PRICY. I would say the food is same quality with Basil at chauncey but at a much higher price point. Moreover, look at the mango sticky rice...its $7.95 and they gave me this..honestly, for $7.95 its pretty pathetic to be getting only 6 small pieces of mango. Overall, pretty disappointing. Rather go to Basil if im being honest.
Love the mango cashew fried rice. Only listed on the dinner menu, but staff gave for lunch when asked. Good portion size for a reasonable price and good atmosphere.

Midwest Seafood Boil is the alter-ego of No. 2 Asian Kitchen... and the sign outside says "Rice Cafe". Identity confusion aside, this is a little treasure of a Chinese takeout place. The Chinese half of the menu has all sorts of unique finds, mixed in with a comprehensive menu of old standby's. The star of the show, though, is the seafood boils. We had the crayfish boil, and it was absolutely delicious. The portions were very generous, and the flavor was amazing. We asked for spicy, and they delivered! It's only been around for a couple of months. We're hoping that they can stick around for the long haul! Great addition to the Purdue area restaurant scene.

reviews.text:
Whenever I'm in the Lafayette area, I HAVE to go here to get the Duane Purvis burger and root beer. Its so good!! I wish they would open a location in Indy!!

The Duane Purvis burger is a burger with peanut butter. Do not be closed minded about this and just TRY it if you think it sounds gross. It is the best, and they load the peanut butter on there!! Wanna make it even better? Be like me and add an egg on there. It will make your soul and tastebuds happy. Don't forget the root beer- always have to buy a six pack from them as well!

The inside of the restaurant is pretty small and cramped, but they have added outside seating tents for COVID. So if you like having a little elbow room, maybe try sitting outside. Never had bad service here either!

I will give Triple X four stars because it's an iconic member of the Purdue landscape, a diners & drive in feature and a place with special memories.  The building is special because if
It's location, styling and age.  It's noting special.  Actually a lot of the memorabilia that was on the walls is now gone.

Non-breakfast items are interesting as many are named after famous Purdue alumni meal preferences.  I personally recommend the Duane Purvis - hamburger with peanut butter.  Sounds gross but it's delicious!!

On this occasion we went for breakfast.  My wife ordered the veggie omelet.  She was impressed with how many veggies were inside.  She said the hash browns were the best she has ever had.  She also ordered Triple X jam...a hand made jelly with a root beer taste...very unique!!

I ordered the ham and egg sandwich.  This sandwich featured real ham...no pieces of Canadian ham.  The sandwich was okay...nothing really special.  I also ordered the biscuits and gravy.  The biscuits are purchased but still soft and tasty.  The gravy is a bit thin without a distinctive taste.  The gravy does have a decent amount of sausage - about some in every forkful.  I put a decent amount of pepper on it to jack it up more...it just doesn't have a distinctive taste.

Triple X now takes credit cards. That is a positive change.  

They have made several covid changes.  They have plexiglass around the countertops.  QR code's are how you get your menu.  They installed outdoor tent seating and require two seats between cust Owens at the counter.

On the down side...they still require you to stand in line to pay inside the building.  There is no room to social distance here.  The cashier takes phone orders which backs up the customers trying to pay.  I was also disappointed that the waitress didn't wipe down the condiments and salt & pepper shakers after we were finished.

I can't believe I've been going here for 4 years without ever writing a review. With the Covid we had to sit outside this time. Because of that they are now taking credit card!  Usually cash only. I had the Boilermaker Pete this time. A triple cheese burger with onions. The wrapper was so soaked in grease, you could see the burger through the paper. That's a really good drive in burger. Had fries and a root beer with it.   If they served fried with the burger I would have given them 5 stars, but since the burger cost $10 without, they are getting only 4. 

A solid 4 bellies on my 5 belly scale.

Five in our party and here is what we ordered: bbq sandwich and fries, Albuquerque omelet, two orders of french toast, some pancake breakfast (I don't remember the name of) that consisted of two HUGE pancakes, two eggs, and bacon and two root beers. Bill was a very reasonably inexpensive $44.14 before tip for a truckload of food at a sit down establishment that is an icon. With two adults, two teenagers, and a preteen, we could spend close to that at a fast food chain. Food was great, especially the omelet, and the service was fast. Would definitely come here again. As out-of-towners, we were also very pleased with the parking situation. Only complaint was that the bbq sandwich seemed slightly on the small side.

I found Triple XXX by signing up for an Indiana tourism email with a link for 20 Destination Restaurants in Indiana. Also, Guy Fieri has visited Triple XXX on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. There was plenty of intrigue.

The building is black and orange and the name very eye-catching if your mind is in the gutter. The name refers to the highest quality of root beer at what was once a thirst station found around the country in the early 20th century. Triple XXX is the last one standing and located very close to Purdue.

I ordered something unusual for me...a root beer! But I felt like I had to order one from here and it didn't disappoint. I have hated root beer most of my life but it has grown on me with this being the best I have had.  It just seemed to have a more fresh flavor.  I also went with the root beer float thar contained real ice cream for a solid win.

Besides root beer, Triple XXX is known for their burgers. Guy Fieri ate the Purvis which has peanut butter on it. That's not for me.  I went with Flash Gordon that had bacon, grilled onions, jalepenos, American cheese, jalepeno ketchup, and 4 sirloin patties!  The patties looked like McDonald's patties but they had a better quality of taste to them.  The menu states they put the meat in flour before cooking.  Curly fries were the perfect accompaniment. 

One destination restaurant down in Indiana and more to go!
Amazing local Student diner with the best meat/burger. The best Root Beer as it is old school made by pure Sugar cane.

YUMMM!! This is the local greasy spoon for sure with local drive-in flare. Their sides are alright but the burgers and ROOT BEER are where it's at! Seriously, their root beer is a game-changer. Soooo delicious! There are indoor and outdoor seats available. I'd recommend going during the day when it isn't too crowded. Staff are so nice. The location also sells some swag in addition to food.

A West Lafayette tradition, I brought my friend since it's clearly "an experience". The staff was really accommodating and I appreciated the great service. Food was great and I'll be sure to come back to cross other burgers off my list!
Really good, highly recommend the omelets. They have some outdoor seating in personal tents that are fun and private.
The burgers were really good and the fries were nicely salted. The root beer was pretty good too and you can't beat it for the price! We will be back.

Decent food, and an iconic location on campus. They're a bit of a tourist trap in my opinion, because of all of the fame and recognition they have (especially with the iconic Dine Ins episode with Fieri himself). But it's a place you definitely have to eat at once you're on campus.

Having to update, not fun! I want to recommend TripleXXX to everyone as THE option for easy going filling in the area. However it isn't worthy of the TV hype. Yes, might be just me: I bet what annoys me brings in the customers. But the breakfasts? Cracker Barrel minus value, an average mess of over processed ingredients just like the college kids make. I have noticed the chili is fantastic. Root beer? It's good. Service? It'll do. The burgers and experience are what get me hot under the snooty Purdue alumni collar. I should have a better undergrad diner! Nearly $10 for a burger with a lil cache of fries? Cash only? No rewards program? Cramped noisy space? 5 Guys right up the hill giving me way more food for my $10 with more space, modern payment options, excellent rewards app, this cannot just be me. I tried an off menu burger with pineapple on it. Fat slice of Hawaiian goodness is magic on beef no matter what you haters say about it also working on pizza. Months later, I still can't believe it was canned pineapple. Watery, mushy, so sad for a restaurant that showed off itself on TV to make Guy cry. OK I know, All Hail Purdue and Boilernation but really, this is my little opinion and ya'll (obviously) are gonna run past me and love this place for all its backwards charm. Allow me a rant because I want a worthy campus burger joint! Well we have it folks: The Tap right up on top of the hill is literally on top of XXX in every way, fantastic atmosphere, wonderful selection of brews (sorry kids 21+), beautiful burgers, pizzas, it's all there just like I dreamed XXX would be. Also Teay's River, best burger and draft selection in the area, take the whole family there, plenty of room. I wonder how long Triple XXX can last like this? Cash, no rewards app, cramped interior, bathroom for 1 mouse, ingredients better served at the Golden M right south, and not the value a diner should be - all these first world problems up against Teays, The Tap, Bru Burger, D.T. Kirbys, Wolfies, Big Woods, AJ's, Town & Gown, Christos, Harry's, Dog n Suds, and even Wendys. Most of those offer all the goods: rewards program, pay with plastic, plenty of space in a modern open atmosphere, superb menu of tasty original foods, and value.

Was excited to try this place after seeing it was featured on food network, however I was super disappointed. I ordered a grilled cheese, and was surprised it ended up on a bun with minimal cheese. My husband ordered a burger, it was okay but super thin. We split curly fries and they were okay. My hash browns were supposed to come with sausage gravy, but they ended up "throwing out the rest" because they were closing in 15 minutes... 
overall not impressed. The place smelt like cleaning products and we felt rushed out.

Stopped in Lafayette to visit our son at Purdue.  We were told it had a 30-minute wait however time passed quickly and we were not disappointed with their burgers and offerings It's a must stop when you're in Purdue.

This was my first visit to Triple XXX after hearing about it many years ago on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives! I would be lying if I told you that wasn't the main reason I stopped in while I was in the area. 

Overall the service was really good - I did have to wait a long time for my food (everyone around me arrived after me and was served well before me) - but that is the only drawback in terms of service! The menu has many options, however, if you are a vegetarian like me there are few choices - either a grilled cheese or something off of the breakfast menu. I ordered the veggie omelette with potatoes and toast. It was good, and I would order it again. The burgers (one of the things they are known for!) sounded amazing and smelled so good - I would recommend these to any of my non-vegetarian friends! 

The ambiance is very comfortable and the restaurant itself is very unique, but a diner feel that is hard to find these days. This restaurant is worth a visit; I will be back to try the rootbeer!

I am a big burger guy, so I was excited for the chance to try this during a quick visit to West Lafayette after seeing it on lots of Indy best burger lists and DDD. With the high expectations, I was honestly fairly disappointed. I will say I kept it with the original and did not get any of their specialty burgers, so that might have been where I went wrong. My cheese wasn't even barely melted. The sandwich was fairly small. The fries were just okay. I felt like I could've just went to McDonald's next door for a similar burger and probably cheaper. The staff was nice, but they were all cleaning and closing things up long before the restaurant actually closed, so that was disappointing, as well.

Walked in here on a weeknight And not much is changed here in over three decades which is great. Please note this is a cash only place and there are limited car parking spots as well for the drive up.

This place is straightforward no nonsense classic menu for a diner that knows what it does right and it doesn't change a thing. It is great to see healthy mix of high school and college students constantly working here year-round.

This is a landmark in the community and he must stop. It was also featured on a Food Network TV show due to its popularity and high levels of loyalty from the students and the community.

If you're ever in West Lafayette you must go to Triple XXX! Look up on the hill off of 52 and Salisbury and you will see a bright orange and black striped building that's been around for 90 years! What a place to last 90 years and counting. It's not far from the Purdue campus either. They have a 90th Anniversary Celebration going on and the next drawing will be June 29th. September 29th & December 29th are the next drawings. One of the prizes is a $90 Triple XXX gift card! They were also featured on Diners, Drive-In's, and Dives! 

We were lucky and it wasn't crowded. They have counters with stools. No booths. If it's too crowded they have quite a few picnic tables outside. The service was prompt, fast, and friendly! The coffee came in a Triple XXX mug and was piping hot. The biscuits and gravy were excellent. Good prices and good food you can't beat that.

Great quick diner - staff friendly - root beer super good as were the biscuits and bacon.  Corned beef from a can :(, coffee was weak, waffle was good not great :+ country gravy is solid but chic fried steak was midline. - will go back but not tomorrow

We went and sat down for dinner at a full service table and spent over a half hour waiting to be served. We went to talk to the waitstaff who said would serve us soon, and never came. I would have loved to try their food, but due to the service I will never be back.

reviews.text: Ordered delivery today, was early and still hot! The food was very good and they always have really good options. American Chinese food as well as authentic Chinese food. Plus they have a great location right downtown!
My new fav, Covid safe, take out restaurant! Great meat options and even better veggie options! I'd recommend the braised bak Choi with shiitake mushrooms, the flavors are delicious!

Over this whole COVID-19 period, we've done multiple deliveries/curbside pick-ups from Sichuan House. I haven't had a chance to try out many other Chinese food places in Lafayette/West Lafayette, except for Peppercorns Kitchen, so I don't have a lot to compare with locally. 

Their service is prompt and only on one occasion did they get our order wrong. Portions are good sized and prices are reasonable. Unfortunately, most of their takeaway dishes come in plastic containers. Hope they'll make changes to that soon.

Food is good. The reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is because certain dishes have turned out differently to what I'm used to. For example, on two occasions the kung pao chicken had been deep fried. Traditionally (correct me if I'm wrong), kung pao chicken is not a deep fried dish. 
Their vegetarian mapo tofu is really yum - I'd definitely recommend that. 

My other major concern with their food is that they use a LOT of oil. I usually end up scooping out multiple tablespoons of oil before eating. Please, please cut back on how much oil you guys use. It's pretty nasty.
Ordered the chicken pepper dish and tasted like I was eating chicken dipped into candy.   Come on, you call this Chinese food??

I've been here  a few times but thought it would be a good idea for dinner.
Tonight was a bad decision.
Wonton soup: no flavor and the wonton over cooked and flavorless 

Salt and pepper shrimp: bland
Fried rice: just over soaked in soy sauce 
Pork egg rolls was spoiled. 

ProTip go to Taco Bell
Always great and  authentic food. Quick service. Best hot and sour soup in town.  I also recommend the moo sho pork.

Very impressed. I've eaten at all the "real" Chinese places in town and this is possibly the best when it comes to flavors. Also had great quality ingredients. Portions were ok. Could be a lucky order, but damn, that was a delicious lunch.

This is a pretty decent Chinese restaurant with a very large selection of genuine Chinese food and more American styled Chinese food items. I adores their shrimp mai fun - it is not greasy in my opinion. My bf usually gets the general tsao's which is good and can be too spicy if you're not careful. They can over do it on the chili oil is the only major complaint in things like the wonton soup or Dan Dan noodles.
The other thing is the crab Rangoon is overcooked. The shell is always super hard. These are the biggest issues. If they could address these items they'd pretty much be perfect.

My favorite authentic Chinese food in town. Every bite I took, I couldn't believe how good the food was. Everything was delicious but I think the potstickers were my favorite. 

This is a tough one to beat. I'll definitely keep going back.

Had never eaten here before but thought we'd try something new; used Grubhub for delivery. 

Pros: The food we ordered was delicious! Their eggplant Szechwan is amazing and the hot & sour soup was possibly the best I've ever had. Normally that kind of soup is mainly just spicy, but this was full of all kinds of flavor too. The garlic sauce is light, not the "American Chinese" brown sauce kind, so be prepared if you're expecting that; it's very different, though good! The food had a much more authentic Chinese flavor in my opinion.

Cons: They got our order wrong so we had to refund/reorder, but they fixed the second batch very quickly. The crab rangoon was ok; it's not as good as some. Probably won't order it again only because everything else was so good by comparison. They also sent no soy sauce, but that might be because I didn't request the driver to get any. 

It's such good food that we would definitely order from there again; I know mistakes happen. Very happy to have tried them!
OMG! The food was amazing! Best Chinese food I've ever had. I can't get over how good the food was! Definitely a place I will be visiting again.

Sichuan House is previously Ichiban I believe.

They remodeled everything and the restaurant decor is really nice now.

I only tried one dish (Twice cooked pork) so this isn't a though review, but my first impression is that I would go back again. Overall I would give the quality of the dish 9/10. It was almost perfect but some of the veggies were not thoroughly cooked so there was a bit of raw vegetable taste (mainly in the onion, I think they threw in the peppers and onions at the same time but onions take longer to cook).

It was a little pricy at $13, but that was reflected in the quality of the ingredients (Fresh vegetables and good quality pork). They gave me a random 10% discount, but charge 18% tip reguardless.

Clean, great food, fast, friendly, and good for social gathering. Mapo tofu is really good as well. My recommendation is walnut shrimp. I went here two friends and they really liked the taste of food. It has good combination of oil, meats, sauce and veggies. I don't usually give four starts, but this is amazing place.

Delicious. A delightful setting in which to discover new flavors and combinations with traditional Sichuan roots. Absolutely going back soon!

For the less adventurous among you, there is an "American Chinese" menu section which includes many dishes typical of your standby takeout place.

My friend and I went there when when first arrived in Lafayette. The crusines are very authentic. I felt like they were the dishes I would get in China. We had a big meal including Ma'po Tofu, Boiled Pork Belly and etc. We are all very full and consent. Since it was Easter break, there were only one waitor there. Thus, I could understand that the service is kinda slow. Overall, great experience in Sichuan House!
Excellent atmosphere and setting. Kinda hidden on St. Marks but it's pretty authentic! Great for date night. Be prepared to wait at least half an hour tho

Went for my mother's birthday. Dad is sichuanese and ordered for us. Food was tasty but according to my parents, not the authentic taste they are used to. The dishes were pleasantly mouthnumbing and well seasoned but the heat factor wasn't there. They brought us our entrees before the appetizers, and brought our rice last - which was weird. They also forgot one of our dishes but still charged us for it. We ended up taking it home. TL;DR: tasty food, not necessarily authentic Sichuan flavors but definitely pleasing to the Chinese palate. Disorganized service.

This place is wonderful.  We went on a super snowy night and the manager was serving all the tables.  He told us all his servers were out that evening.  He hustled and it didnt look like any tables service suffered.  He was VERY friendly and had great recommendations based on what my partner and I like.   

We ordered spicy dumplings and pot stickers for an appetizer.  The spicy dumplings were great and in a very nice sauce.
For a main dish, we got some kind of spicy peppered beef.  This was phenomenal.  It was a low level, dry heat.  None of the "spicy" items were very challenging, in my opinion.  
Not to be understated, but the rice was incredible.  It was perfectly steamed and sticky.  

Out food was so good, we got an order of Pork in Garlic sauce to take home.  

Overall, the service was warm and helpful, proportions were generous and food was delicious.  I will DEFINITELY be going back!

Authentic Chinese food! And server said "please recommend to your friends".  I will ! They deserve!  We ordered spicy beef tendon, sour and spicy potato, fired spicy pig kidney and crab flavored tofu  soup. I LOVE it!

Place is legit. Really fair price too. I went on a weekday and there was no wait time. Only downfall is limited parking but if you want authentic Chinese food, this place is your best bet in West Lafayette.
