reviews.text:
Firstly - they do curbside pick up and are very courteous which we really appreciate.

Food - a little oily but very yummy. We tried:
1) Diced chicken in spicy sauce - has a kick but nothing crazy. Chicken is fried well. 
2) Fried chicken wings - it doesn't have a sauce or marinade but it was still really good! 
3) Mapo tofu - yum! If you are not a fan of szechuan peppercorns I would advise against getting this dish. 

Good sized portions and prices are reasonable.

Fabulous food. They always try to accommodate us for our vegetarian diet. I have only ever done takeout and been impressed every time. Their serving size is very good too. We usually get 2 meals out of an order.

So I went back one time and have had delivery a few times. Flavor is not what I remember from my original visit. Everything is either good or ok. Some dishes are crazy bland, which is weird from an authentic Chinese place. And they often get orders slightly wrong - say ordering ginger spinach and receiving a very spicy version instead or getting an entirely wrong order. 

Sichuan House and Peppercorn are more consistent with better flavors.

The Peking Duck was so so and it would be enough for three people. The duck was a little bit too greasy, though. The spring rolls were okay, not fantastic, but they were worth trying. 

Also, there were many people ordering and the waiting time was pretty long, so be sure to place an order ASAP. Expecting waiting time to be like 40 minutes +.

Our first time back to this location. Brand new restaurant and no more grocery store. Try the spicy beef and chicken dishes. They are fantastic--especially during those long Indiana winters.

We started with the Mr. and Mrs Smith chewy beef appetizer and then moved on to the Chef Szechuan Chili Beef and the crispy friend chicken with chilis. All were great dishes.

We will definitely be back. Recommended for two or more, since the portions are large and meant for sharing.

Taste, located in the old CT Market building, is a restaurant we've quickly become regulars at. It's a very spacious location that they've renovated, and it looks very modern and open inside now. 

There are two options when it comes to Taste - hot pot or just regular food. We have yet to try hot pot, but I will update my review when we do. The regular menu is fantastic, however.

We've tried many dishes here, including a lot of the dumplings, mapo tofu, fried rice, various beef and chicken dishes, and more. I can definitely say my favorite is the beef with scallions; absolutely delicious. The beef is tender, and I love onions/scallions, so it's a homerun for me. The dishes come with rice upon request, and I definitely recommend it. Some of the dishes are definitely on the spicy side, so make sure to ask about that if it's a concern. 

Service here can be a on the longer side at times, but for the most part, our food has arrived on time. Service staff is very friendly.

The prices are reasonable, but just be aware that they charge an 18% service charge at dinner, so make sure to note that. (Though if you tip regularly like myself, this shouldn't be a big deal, as it takes the place of the tip.)

Overall, definitely give it a try!

This used to be the old CT Market, which used to have a restaurant quietly tucked in the back, but I'm guessing they didn't want to compete with the New World Market right across the street, so there's an entire restaurant here instead now.

Went here with a friend who doesn't speak Chinese and we got the Peking Duck meal set, Szechuan Wontons, and Snow Pea Leaves. The Peking Duck meal set costs around $40 and comes with either a soup option or a stir-fried option for the excess meat of the duck that doesn't go into the actual Peking Duck. I would say this is among the best Peking Duck I've had in the Midwest, including the likes of Chicago's Lao Sze Chuan, and easily the best in the Lafayette area (much better than the nearby Peppercorn Kitchen and Szechuan Garden). The presentation is wonderful, the meat is rich but thin, and the skin is nice and crispy. The garnishes and sauce are flavorful without being too strong. We got the soup option, which was also nice and hearty, but not quite as spectacular as the main event. The Szechuan Wontons were also some of the best dumplings I've had in a while, with a subtle sweet and peppercorn flavor; my friend was also especially impressed with the dumplings. 

There are two potential downsides that I can see someone experiencing here. First, the items are pricey, especially after the mandatory 18% service charge. I think the food quality was very "authentic" and worth the price for the dishes that we ordered and I had the fortune of being able to communicate with the staff in their native language. Unlike a lot of places with foreign staff, they were pretty cheerful and polite and provided decent service. However, this also brings me to my second potential concern. They clearly preferred to converse in their native language, which was somewhat exclusive to my non-speaking friend, so I'm not sure what experience an entire group of non-speakers would have.

This place is THE BEST Chinese restaurant in West Lafayette  if you want an ensured great dining experience this is the move. Their orange chicken is amazing and they have yummy fried noodles which are basically lo mein :) their portion sizes are generous too. tell a friend!

The best Chinese restaurant! Clean and bright lobby, good service and tasty food. Especially for the hot pot, it is my favorite!  The base is so rich and delicious. Als will definitely go there again.

The restaurant was totally renovated from the past grocery store/restaurant. 
We were not sure how much the menu had changed but we still could find our favorites. Everything we ordered tasted great! Even from the old time, we've never tried their hotpot so we will try that next time.
The best hotpot in West Lafayette. It's quality over quantity, but the quality is there.

Great food and great environment. It offers a lot of choice and come out new dishes every week. I would recommend for people who just want to have a quick bite and also who wants an authentic taste cuisine.
Amazing! We decided to try somewhere new and will definitely be back. Friendly staff and unique foods. Everything we had was delicious!

Food was decent but the service was extremely chaotic and the atmosphere of the place is confusing, the menu cryptic if you don't speak Chinese.

We ordered something described as "Pork Garlic Bolt" in the menu, yet on the check we got after 3 seconds it showed up as "Twice cooked pork with green peppers". We asked our server about this but she said it's the same thing. I still don't quite believe that, but even if it is true, why does the same dish appear on the menu more than once? Also, the dish we ordered was not supposed to be spicy, but what we got was covered in red and green chillis.

We were also served by 3 different people who all had to look at the check on our table multiple times to figure out what part of our order was still missing. Despite that,  all three dishes we ordered were served separately, the rice to go with them only came after we reminded them about that and the Appetizer arrived dead last, when we were already pretty much done with the mains.

I usually don't mind patchy service all that much, because after all if I'm not happy with it I can always give a slightly lower tip than usual. But here, an 18% tip is automatically included in the bill. I hate that because it leads to terrible service.

The place itself is very posh but there was very loud pop music in the background, which was a bit strange.

The menu is very extensive but it doesn't really describe the dishes, it contains items like "Beef - 12.95". 

All of this is a shame because the food itself was not bad.
Super spicy dishes. Great authentic flavor. My noodle dish on my first visit was a little oily, but still delicious. The cumin beef is one of my favorites on the menu. Great experience.

I went with my friends one time and it was a great experience! However, the second time that I went here with my two aunts and mom was terrible. The waiters sat us down with our menus and then they went to the front desk and started chatting with one another. We ordered 6 dishes. After the dishes came, we asked for one dish to be taken back and remade as it was wayyy too salty. But there was no difference and it seemed as though they didn't even make a new dish. The service was definitely not worth a 18% tip. I hope this place takes my constructive criticism as the other dishes were pretty well made and the inside is very nicely decorated with plenty of space for people of big parties.

Visit here 2 months ago and had the worst dinning experience. Not only the service is very poor and slow (waited 30 minutes for them to set up a hotpot). They charge a mandatory 20% tip for two people because we dine in after 8pm, what kind of restaurant does that? If u want a 20%, please provide worthy service.

The service in this restaurant is slow and unattended. The 18% service charge is outrageously unfair on top of the generally overpriced menu items. The restaurant overall is dirty and poorly managed. The food quality is just mediocre. Not recommended.

'Zero' star if there's an option. The most horrible Chinese restaurant in West Lafayette. If you like to be cheated, try this restaurant. Mandates a 18% tipping even when there's just 2 of us. Poor service, food is only mediocre.
The food is absolutely amazing. The prices are very reasonable for the portions you get. The staff has always been nice and respectful. It's one of my favorite places to eat. It's so so so SO good!

reviews.text:
This is a good go-to for "fancy delivery" during COVID, without "fancy" price tags. The food is delicious. My favorite is the farfalle with almond crusted chicken, delicious and it feeds me for multiple meals when I'm watching my portions. I also highly recommend the bacon wrapped shrimp, sadly I forgot to take a photo before I devoured them. 

Check out their menu for an eclectic collection of delicious food sure to please anyone in your household.

This restaurant has the most delicious food! I have tried so many of their appetizers (they have half-priced appetizer specials!) and they've all been incredible. Their martinis (especially the berry one) are also fabulous. They have great service and treated our dog to ice water when we had her with us on the patio, so sweet!
We both had pasta dishes and they were wonderful. The outdoor seating was convenient and covered. There was a DJ playing but not too loud. The service was wonderful.

Back in Town!  This time, I ate here on two consecutive nights.  The first night, the salmon.  The second, i had their almond/parm chicken. 

In both cases, the preparation was well executed AND offered plenty of interest to my palate and eyes.  More so with the salmon IMHO.  The chicken dish was a lot of food.  

I especially enjoyed eating outside, in the waning days of Autumn.

Loved this restaurant! Great atmosphere and friendly workers. There's a reason why this place is always busy! We took some friends here for dinner and drinks. The menu was great and catered to everyone's food preferences. Highly recommend!
RedSeven is perfect for lunch and dinner! They have great food, great service, and I highly recommend everyone go and try them!

Dinner menu is great. Lunch menu is nothing special. 

Staff is good and respectful, but I always get the impression management is very strict. The staff doesn't have much personality. 

Decor is also sort of weird. It gives and early 2000's las Vegas vibe. 

Good place to grab a great dinner meal. Not the best place to hang out at the bar.

Was very disappointed that they are not following through with what they state they do with precautions for COVID. 6 foot distance was not enforced. Waiter was not wearing gloves. Customers walking around with no masks. I saw a waiter clean off a table...I think sanitized the top of the table but did not clean seats. Sucks. I thought I had a place I could go to.  :(

Great atmosphere and ambiance. This is a nice spot for a date night. The restaurant was not very packed, so it was easy to have a socially distant meal. We ordered the chips and queso and fettucini alfredo with chicken. The queso was delicious! The queso had a perfect blend of all the right flavors. There was even a hint of bacon in the queso. I thoroughly enjoyed the chips and dip. The dinner rolls were super fluffy, buttery, and moist. The pasta was delicious but very greasy. The greasiness of the pasta was pretty off putting. Also, we waited a really long time to get our food despite how few people were in the restaurant. Overall, the food was great and I highly recommend.

It was my first visit at Red Seven getting dinner and drinks with a friend and I was really pleased with the experience! We both ordered drinks to start; I ordered the blueberry lavender mojito. It ended up being too strong and I asked our waiter to add a splash of lemonade, which made it so much better! We then ordered the chips and queso appetizers share and WOW! It was AMAZING!!!! The chips are homemade and came out so hot and fresh. I highly recommend this appetizer to everyone who dines here. My friend ordered the fettuccine alfredo pasta and I ordered the asian chicken lettuce cups. We both liked our food! I kind of expected my lettuce cups to be assembled already, but it came as a spread that I assembled myself. This was fine as well, just a little messy to eat! The peanut sauce that comes with it is the perfect flavor for this dish! The only problem overall was the ceiling slowly dripping on my friend throughout our meal... We think this was because of how hot and humid it was outside. Otherwise, it was a great experience! Our waiter was very kind and attentive!

Excellent place!! Never been to Lafayette been to west side. So we ordered an Old Fashioned and split the grilled chicken sandwich with avocado. The seasoning was perfect and the chicken was juicy too!! We both ordered side salads. I choose the mango champagne dressing (house) and my husband ordered the vinaigrette. The mango was a nice touch of sweet but not too sweet. Definitely will come back

Red Seven is a really great place to enjoy food and drinks. The menu has a lot of good options for a lot of different types of eaters. 

We got the shrimp and feta pasta, risotto, salmon, and truffle Mac & cheese. They all came with salads, which came with a great mango chardonnay dressing. We were served complimentary bread & butter before our meal. The shrimp & feta pasta was my favorite, it was a great twist to the different cheesy pasta options, and it had little tender chunks of pork belly in it as well! The risotto was the most disappointing, but we still ate most of it. Truffle Mac and cheese came with lots of lobster, which was pretty delicious! The salmon was flaky in a good way, and it came with crispy potato medallions in a pool of guacamole. 

Overall? A great restaurant to enjoy good food with good company.

Five stars.  This is not the ultimate in Michelin starred cuisine, but it is quite good and very reasonably priced.  Quality to price ratio gets five stars in my view.  Five of us shared the chipotle queso with homemade chips. . . those evaporated in seconds.  The strawberry mojito drink, recommended by our server, was cruise ship fare, not really the best cocktail, and the weak point of the meal.  All 5 of us had different entrees,all excellent.  I had the thick-cut pork chop, it was a touch dry, but made up for with excellent glaze and delicious mashed potatoes, chunky applesauce and perfect broccolini.  Others had shrimp stir fry, a delicious creamy farfalle pasta, the balsamic chicken dish was really outstanding, and the fifth was a delicious salmon.   Really, quite nice.
My fave restaurant in town. Whether it's date night, lunch with a friend or a small employee holiday party, I've always had an amazing meal here. I love the lighting and ambience too. 10 stars!

I really enjoyed the Pecan Chicken Rollup.  Not too filling for a lunch time meal and the taste was excellent.  The chicken tenders were breaded in crushed pecans, deep fried, and then wrapped in tortillas with a Honey-lime sauce, tomato, & lettuce for a great combo taste of sweet & savory with a bit of crunch.  

I chose fries to go with the wraps and they were a bit disappointing.  There were plenty of the shoestring variety, but they were cool and chewy like you get when they sit out under a heat lamp.  I don't know for sure, just that they reminded me of those disappointing ones.  

The place has a really nice ambiance and I was served promptly, but it was a little weird sitting at the bar for lunch and then the bartender disappeared for the entirety of my meal.  My service was picked up by a waiter, but it felt really odd being the only one seated there and nobody on the other side of the counter.  Made it seem like I wasn't getting noticed since my waiter was only in the bar area sparingly.  Still, he did a good job of getting the food out and bringing my check.  Just would have been nice to have him check on whether I liked my food or needed a refill on my water before I was finished.

But the entree was excellent, so I will let that skew my rating higher than I might have otherwise given.

Review #1534

Easily one of the best dinner spots in the Laffayette area! Everything from the decor to the food to the service is impeccable. The interior reminds me of a classy, old school dinner-date restaurant that really makes for a nice fancy-ish ambiance. The server I had was very attentive with drink refills, orders, and check ups. The food was amazing too! I had the shrimp risotto that a very unique creole style with pork belly and mushroom flavors folded into the creamy risotto and shrimp. My date had the shrimp fettuccini which she also really enjoyed. The price per person is about 30-35 with drinks which is on par with the quality of the service and food. Certainly will be coming back in the future!
Ordered the stir-fry and added grilled chicken. Veggies were soggy and sauce had no flavor.

I'm so glad we stopped at Red Seven today while banking across the street. The food had an international flair and everything was delicious. We had the potstickers and the chicken lettuce wraps along with filet mignon sliders. We shared all the dishes and topped it off with sticky toffee pudding on their sunny patio. You should definitely check it out!

So Ms Music Funkette has left the city were engineers and astronauts make big a$$ bass drums and agri-business is Boilered-up. Yet, the Very Delectable Mrs Funk and I find ourselves here on a Friday eve for a Greyhound pickup of Ms Baseball Funkette away from her Wrigleyville Party Barn for a Sunday Indy event.

As is our way, where Funksters meet, dinner is near. And Red Seven was as close as a crosswalk.

Tall smokey glass outside windows, wooden paneled, sectioned off booths to one side. Shiney-glassed mirrored bar back with hightop fours behind the bar seating. At 8P in a Big 10 town, the joint is... empty! Ah, it is spring break. We chose a Hightop and service was prompt. How could it be anything but.

Signature cocktails Gin and Sin Martini, Cool as a Cucumber chiller and a Grayson Pinot Noir, all at $8 per, start the conversation. A southwestern grilled chicken salad $10, chorizo stuffed empanadas $8 and asian veggie egg rolls $8, round out the shareable evening nosh. Before you can say March Madness, plates of fresh prepared groceries are delivered to the tall table. Delicious satisfaction followed...along with a repeat of the conversation starter.

In my usual close, would we return? Well with a nod to 1960 and Mr Elmer Bernstein one might say this was the Theme to the Pretty Darn Good Red Seven.... know what i mean?
We love Red Seven! Great food and atmosphere.  Red Sevenn is a favorite destination for date night!

reviews.text: The highest rated restaurant in the area for good reason. A strong cultured dining experience and huge menu combined with the very friendly service makes this a go to spot in the county for unique and super tasty food. We had a small sampling of the falafel and shawarma which was tons of food! We went for a takeout thinking it would not have a lot of space for distancing but wish we would have dined in upon noticing how much room is here. Our food was perfectly flavored and went down just like the ideal classic Mediterranean fare of other places I really enjoy like Kebab-G in Peoria, IL. My parents enjoyed some leftovers, quite sure I convinced them without having to say anything!

I went for a dinner date with my husband and we LOVED the place. The decoration is beautiful. It feels like you're traveling. Service was super nice and helped us ordering because we had multiple questions. I ordered a sautee ghallaba that was delicious. It came with 2 sides. The lentil soup was my favorite. Also, it was basmati rice that we all know is quite good. My husband had the falafel sandwich and he couldn't finish it because it was pretty big. 
The portions were very generous so we had enough to take home. Do try their Baklava. It's just amazing. 
Also! Everybody had face masks and gloves. Antibacterial gel was available everywhere for us. 

Strongly recommended. :)

Best Mediterranean food in Lafayette, hands down.  Flavors are amazing, staff is great. Exceptionally clean. The entire experience was pleasant and enjoyable. We got baclava and a smoothie to go, amazing, I'll definitely be stopping in for takeout smoothies by the quart often.  Can't wait to try everything on the menu.

So wonderful. Kebabs, sandwiches, sides are all on point. We've catered their kebab feasts for a couple of important guests and they've impressed us each time. This spot has taken over as my favorite middle eastern food in town.

So confused by the glowing reviews on this place. This was our second time eating there. This time takeout, last time pre-pandemic dine in. Both times we felt the food was lacking. 

The chicken shawarma sandwich was extremely dry and no noticeable garlic flavor. The cucumber salad is more like yogurt with a garnish of cucumber. The spinach pies looked amazing, but were greasy and the cheese to spinach ratio was way off. Needed more cheese for sure. 

Hummus was fine. Be warned, there is a choice of classic or spicy hummus. The CLASSIC comes covered in jalapeños. So ask to skip them if you have an aversion to spice. 

The sautéed mushrooms was the best dish we had. Nice mix of spices and very flavorful. But in two visits, that's the only thing we'd order again. 

Was also disappointed in the level of customer service. When I called to place the order, the person just answered the phone w hello. I had to ask if this was Almadina. Then, at pickup, two server/hostess front of house staff not wearing masks. One was talking to three guests who were leaving, and two of the three guests were not wearing masks. One of the guests had to call the hostess's attention to my presence. When she turned around and saw me, she put a mask on. They must have been friends/family. But you expect a place to follow the signs it has posted on its own doors. And if that's how things are handled front of house, what is happening in the kitchen?

I had carryout once since my original review and I still cannot come to terms with the sky high rating for this restaurant. It's not bad, but it's not *nearly* the best restaurant in Lafayette. Really it's not even in the top 20. It makes no sense. Maybe the low level of seasoning is more aligned with the average midwestern palate? Maybe they're juicing their reviews? I don't know, but I don't get it at all.

We were on our way back home from a Yellowstone vacation, and I was growing weary of restaurant food and was yearning for something from home. It didn't matter. I realized, even in my burned out state, how absolutely great this restaurant is.

We ordered the Shawarma plate for two. Oh my lord it could have fed four. And every single piece of meat on that plate is perfectly juicy and tender. The hummus that we ordered with it was smooth and tasty. I loved this meal. 

My son went with the chicken sandwich. I had a bite and was blown away by the flavor of that one. If you are into sandwiches, I would go with this one.

They accidentally brought us fries instead of rice. This was quickly remedied but I'm so glad they made the mistake. I tried the fries and they are awesome! I mean, I like rice with the Shawarma plate, but if you're into fries, I'd give it a go. 

This has to be one of the top restaurants in Lafayette. If you're driving through like we were, definitely make the stop. If you live nearby, plan to visit weekly. It is that good. One of the best Mediterranean restaurants I've ever been to. This one is an absolute gem.

My wife and I stopped here on the way home from an out-of-state trip. We decided to grab a quick bite and Mediterranean sounded perfect. This The building has tons of room, though when we arrived it was entirely empty, due to the lockdown, which has only started to get more lax.

We sat and looked over the menu, ordered a sample platter of hummus, baba ganoush, and tabouli, which were brought out shortly with some complementary fresh rolls and a creamy garlic sauce. The rolls were so warm and so fresh, and with the garlic sauce, were truly remarkable. Simple ingredients, but done so well. It was exquisite.

The hummus was the creamiest hummus I've ever eaten, truly delivious, as was the baba ganoush. I'm not much of a fan of tabouli, more something for my wife, but it wasn't bad either. We ordered our entrees, but I started to think I might not be hungry enough to eat much, once I finished with the amazing bread and dips we already had.

I was already thinking "five-star for sure" after the appetizer and garlic sauce, as our entrees were brought out. Unfortunately, that's where the quality diverged.

I ordered a lamb shawarma wrap that sounded right up my alley, with lettuca, tomato, onions, and a tahini sauce that made my mouth water. Once I took my first bite, though, the magic was gone. The tahini was bland; not the usual bursting-with-flavor-sauce I was expecting. The portion I tried only had veggies, which were fine, but just a little plain without the strength of the sauce.

I took a bite with lamb this time, hoping it would save the wrap, but it made it worse. The lamb chunks were ENORMOUS. In a wrap, where I won't be using a fork, they should surely be cut into bite-size pieces, but they were at least two or three times that. It wouldn't be the end of the world, but when I attempted to cut them with my teeth, as one would do with a wrap, the meat was SO chewy. I ended up making a mess, having to drag the chunk of meat out of the wrap and pull it apart with my teeth and hands just so I could get a piece small enough to manage.

The wrap was a disappointment, probably a 2-star, maybe even 1, because the lamb was also rather unseasoned. The appetizer and complementary garlic sauce/bread was 5-star, though, and I believe it's possible some other entrees here are better than what I had, but if the lamb is any indication of meat in other dishes, I'd be concerned.

Portions were decent for the price, but certainly not my favorite meal I've ever had.

GO HERE NOW. 

Al madina is quickly becoming a top three restaurant for us. All the food is very well cooked, perfectly seasoned and delicious. We have not gotten one thing on the menu we didn't thoroughly enjoy. Favorite dishes include hummus, grape leaves, shish and chicken kafta, kabob, and shawarma. Everything is very reasonably priced also. 

If you are not dining here or carrying out on a weekly basis, you are doing yourself a disservice.

In a desert of culinary monochrome, Almadina is a refreshing, authentic oasis of Levantine cuisine. The menu offers common Mediterranean staples complemented by some more particular options. Prices are very reasonable, service was polite and prompt, and the food was delightful. 
It is important to support local business in times of COVID, and this restaurant merits that support.
Excellent place for the family and community eating. My family and friends go here occasionally and will share our platters of food with each other.

Al Madina Restaurant is an amazing place for a couple to have a quiet dinner or a large group to hold a big dinner. With ample seating enough to fit many, you can find a corner that best suites your liking. The outside of the building has a fresh coat of paint which does not in any means give way to the beautiful middle eastern vibe on the inside. The inside of the restaurant is lightly decorated with decorative rugs, pictures from the Middle East, mosaic sconces, and beautiful mosaic lighting as well. The ambiance on the inside is quite and pretty. It is the new hidden gem on the block! 

At a first glance of the menu, it seems a bit much, there are many options to choose from, and there are lots of different styles of kebabs. So what does one get? Well, my wife and I tried their "Shish Combo for 2" in the combo and party trays section of the menu. This was recommended by one of the waiters. Let me tell you, this will NOT disappoint! It was such good tasting food, with big portion sizes for such a good price! At just $30, this tray had 7 pieces of kebab, we chose our two sides of rice and hummus, and we were brought complimentary bread with garlic butter. 

Moving from New Jersey/ New York to Lafayette Indiana, I had to be the judge of this restaurant. I went in expecting the food to not be as good as back from the east coast, BUT the food blew my mind. I was VERY impressed with the "juicyness" of the chicken, the tenderness of the meat, and the overall taste of the entire meal. From the complimentary bread, to a flavorful plate of whipped hummus, straight to the main entree, the food was delicious. You were able to tell that the bread, hummus, kebabs, and everything was made FRESH to order. I am one who always finishes my meals at a restaurant, but I had to request a box to go for some leftovers. 

The food was amazing, and what about the staff you ask?  The staff is very friendly, and humbled. The waiters that waited on us were actually part owners of the restaurant. The chef had a bit of down time and stopped by our table to see how everything was as well. You definitely receive the vibe of open arms and welcome from the team of people who run this restaurant. 

Now, this review would not be complete without me pointing out some of the flaws. The first thing I would want to see is a bit more friendly entrance on the exterior of the building. Maybe some flower pots, or some more color. The inside of the place is beautiful, and some of that culture needs to be brought to the outside as well. Secondly, I wish the music was more in the field of "middle eastern" there was casual American songs playing in the speakers, but it just did not fit. Maybe a little middle easter music would complete the restaurant. Other than that, no complaints on the food or the service. 

I encourage everyone to go with a friend or your significant other and definitely, definitely try out the "shish combo for two!"

*** This review was not sponsored by the restaurant, and I have no affiliations with any member of this restaurant***
The food here has never dissapointed. Their bread and garlic sauce is wonderful. Thank you.

I'm so glad a restaurant is in this space! And I hope this one stays. Split a platter with hummus and tabouleh salad - all of it was delicious and the wait for the food was not long. Finished off the meal with kanafeh and Turkish coffee. The kanafeh was an experience - I thought very good, and the cheese gave the syrup and dough a salty hit. Looking forward to coming back!

Me and my wife got the starter combo and I also ordered a chicken shwarma sandwich cuz I'm a big boy ;) The food was excellent and the portion sizes were great for the prize. Will definitely stop by again if we are in the area :)

Under new ownership and the food is amazing. The customer service is unmatched and the menu has lots of variety and options. Try the kabob and any type of chicken and your mouth will water. Go check them out and I promise you won't regret it!

Had lunch with the family, great food across the board.  Had multiple appetizers and mains, all thought what they had was delicious.  All high quality ingredients, nothing disappointed.  Social distancing and every employee wore a mask, felt comfortable.  Will definitely be back!

We stumbled on this gem. We had the shawarma (chicken and meat). It was fantastic with the rice. We also had spicy hummus, which was a little bitter to our taste but still enjoyable. The greek salads were good also. The atmosphere is unique, but very clean. The staff was very friendly. Overall, it was a great dinner!

Our Sunday lunch was nothing short of perfection. From the scrumptious little rolls with garlic sauce, to the naan with the smoothest, tastiest hummus, to the tender, flavorful chicken...perfection. What a treat from start to finish. Highly recommend!

Fantastic Mediterranean food! From the outside you wouldn't expect the quality of food or decor in side. Everything came out quickly and tasted fresh. 

Both vegan and vegetarian friendly which is difficult to find in Lafayette. 

There was a communication problem between the waitress and kitchen which was rectified quickly and we ended up with more delicious food than we ordered. 

10/10 would recommend you go here or order via grub hub.

reviews.text:
If you're looking for some good pho on campus, this is the place to go. I'm a pho maniac, so I definitely wanted to check this place out. It didn't disappoint. I had the beef pho, and it was delicious! They have some other options on the menu, but most of the entrees have some sort of noodle in it. If you dig noodles, this is definitely the place for you!

Pros
- The name says it all. They've got ramen, pho, mei fun, udon, lo mein and more!
- Just order at the counter, and they bring it out to your table.
- Reasonable prices - $8.99 for a big bowl o' pho!
- Delivery and takeout available
- Quiet and intimate, great for a date or a place to catch up with a friend.
- Quick and friendly service
- FREE WATER!!!!!! :D

Cons
- Not good for groups because it's a pretty small place.
- There aren't servers, just one lady at the register who brings your food.
- Parking is basically non-existent. We parked in the Chauncey Mall parking lot and walked over.

Today I was in West Lafayette picking-up my son for Thanksgiving break.  I was hungry and had some time to kill.  I thought Asian Noodles would be a good lunch option as I go hurtling belly-first into the food frenzy of the coming days.  

Be careful, Noodles & I is 1/2 block from Noodles & Company (is the name just a coincidence?).  Don't get hung up on a name, this is a mom and pop shop, and the food crushes the nearby chain.  

I ordered the Chicken Ho Fun.  It was very good.  Service was fast and friendly and you can't beat the price: $9.99 for a generous portion.  The restaurant is clean with plenty of seating.  

If you want Asian Noodles, skip the chain and dine here.  You will be glad you did.

Around Purdue University campus, I ordered the beef congee for $7.59.  The bowl was large but mostly comprised of water, some green onions, a little beef, and a strange texture of the rice.  I knew that it was hot, but the food should not be super heated that I have to wait a very long time before eating; I am feeling the effects of a burned mouth.  So overpriced and too hot.

The staff was knowledgeable, very friendly, and patient.

My favorite place for a bowl of noodles.  I love their pho here! Much better than other restaurants in the area.  You order and pay up front, then the server brings the food out to you and boy are they quick!! This will definitely be my go-to spot near campus for a nice bowl of noodle soup.  I highly recommend!
Nice and clean, perfect stop for hot spicy noodle soup.  I love their fried dough stick oh mine, I was surprised how good they were and so affordable.

I really liked both the spring rolls and sesame balls. Everything served blazing hot, so take your time.

The spicy beef soup was very tasty. Large bowl, reasonable amount of meat, small amount of bok choy and a tremendous amount of noodles. Hey, the place is called Noodles & I, so what should you expect?

The Vietnamese Pho was excellent. As someone else stated, way better than Greenleaf. Richer texture broth with actual seasoning made all the difference.

Only knocks on this place are that it's pretty small and expensive. Food was great.

3.5 stars. Simple noodle shop. 

The Experience:

Nice casual noodle spot. Service was friendly and prompt. 

The Food:

Potstickers: simple fried potstickers. Tasty, well cooked and fresh. 

Spring rolls: small fresh and tasty. 

DanDan- noodles were great. The sauce was rich, peanuty, and maybe even a little greasy, they had this lovely peppery condiment on the table that helped spice it up.

Beef noodles- rich beefy broth, noodles cooked perfectly and lots of beef. 

Over all this was good. Well probably go back.

Our first visit to Noodles & I was okay. The service wasn't great... we had to refill our own waters the whole time. The boys loved the braised beef noodle soup with James claiming it was "the best soup ever!" The gyoza and spring rolls were yummy too. I was pretty disappointed in the Dan-Dan noodles. They were really basic and one dimensional and had an unfortunate texture from using peanut butter in the sauce. We went with a large group, and I think others liked their noodle dishes- pad Thai and lo mein got decent reviews from friends.

** 3.5 stars!! **
I usually go here for pho and spring rolls. It's definitely tasty, but sort of has the feel of having been thrown together out of its basic ingredients; i.e. it is no greater than the sum of its parts. That isn't to say it isn't good food, but I do wish there was something more to it. That being said, it is my go-to spot for when I'm craving pho and the location is very cute.

This place is a fairly new addition to West Lafayette, and I'm glad I tried it out before I leave to graduate! I got the spicy beef noodle soup, and it was pretty good. I think they have the best beef noodles on campus, but the soup does get a bit oily. My friend got the Vietnamese Pho and that was actually a lot better than Green Leaf! It was surprising because last year when she went she said the pho wasn't good so she wanted to give it a try here again, and she's glad she did. I'm definitely getting the Vietnamese pho next time I come here!!!

A favorite among our friends when we want something hot, hearty, and fast. Food comes out quick and in decently sized portions. The braised beef, pho, and korean fatty beef are all good and are great recovery foods after a long night. While the food is good, it is a bit on the pricier side for what you get hence the 4 stars.

A convient little shop about 2 blocks from the Purdue student union.  My wife, oldest daughter and I were visiting Purdue before we send Lauren off this fall.  It was a chilly night and some piping hot pho sounded perfect. It was a Sunday and the place was packed!  Plenty of students kept pouring in looking for good food at a fair price.  We had the beef pho, chicken pho and pad Thai.
The menu has authentic Chinese dishes from top to bottom. Very homey soups on a cold day. Fast and efficient service.

This place was super cute and convenient. It's located where Maru Sushi was before it moved across the street, and though the look may have completely changed, Noodles & I managed to keep the initiate, tucked away, almost cafe-like vibe. It's now a lot lighter and has a clean aesthetic to it.

Solid Asian noodle place with Japanese, Chinese (Cantonese, Beijing Sichuan), Taiwanese, Korean, Thai, and Singapore flavors. A+++ on variety! Completely different from Noodle and Company, and I feel like the flavor profiles are so different that there's no competition (there is). Service was quick, place has a very clean feel to it. Excellent for date night, friends night out, the aftermath of breakfast club, and late night study sessions. Especially because it's just around the corner from study spots like Vienna and Greyhouse. REALLY good for winter nights or when you're getting a quick, sit-down lunch between classes or work (and Maru Sushi is too full). Won't lie, this isn't the best place for vegetarians or vegans. Most of the dishes have some sort of meat. There are definitely more options if you're a pescetarian, as there's a good number of seafood options. However, it's first rate from anyone lactose-intolerant or allergic to milk.

My first time, I came here with my club's treasurer for a late dinner on Monday (Maru Sushi was closed). It was definitely steered more towards an Asian crowd. While I excited at all the options like the fried udon, roast duck noodle, and the Dan Dan noodles, my friend (I'd only introduced him to Panda Express, Yummy Time, Maru Sushi, and Basil Thai by that point) was very confused. I ended up ordering the Singapore Mee Fu and he got the Braised Beef Noodle. I was REALLY happy with my Singapore Mee Fun, as it had been the year after I'd lived and worked for a couple of months in Singapore. After my time there, I missed the unique flavors from there and this made me really happy. However, my friend was really confused because Taiwanese Braised Beef Noodle soup apparently doesn't taste anything like American beef noodle soup. The way the beef was cooked confused him, the noodles confused him, and he kept asking why they put a whole egg in it. Overall though, he didn't hate. So just heads up for if you or a friend you want to bring are not as familiar with Asian cuisine. I encourage anyone to visit if they have time!

By far best ramen place I've found thus far in the Purdue area. Authentic, quick, spicy (amazingly spicy), and addicting ramen. The potstickers are also great. Have returned many times and will continue to come back.

This is one of those places that has good food, but you really have to know what to order. Their noodle soups are, for the most part, good, but their congee and dan dan noodles are terrible (the former is decidedly flavorless, and the latter is intolerably salty), while their jajangmyeon is just meh. The restaurant is always full of flies, which makes me wonder about the hygiene. However, the service is quick and polite, which is a definite plus.
Okay pho. Not extremely flavorful and only a few slices of meat. But it hit the spot. My teenage son got fried udon noodles with shrimp and ate it all.

This place was really good! Authentic, good food that is hard to come by. It's a smaller place but that's another reason why I like it. It's not going to be crowded with the typical loud golden coral loving type of people. (Not shaming.. but come on, we've all seen those people). Price wise it was good too. Good size servings. Will def go back!

I feel like the name of this place might throw people off (especially since it is across from Noodles & Company). There's definitely a lot of flavor in these dishes in respect to that OTHER noodle place. For my first time visit I got the Vietnamese Pho with beef. There's a handful of pho options, but you gotta go with the Vietnamese one right. My bowl of pho was a large, expected size, but very easy to consume for a lunch. It came out quickly, piping hot. It was a little on the salty side, but all in all, that's some good lunchtime pho. PHO-NOMENAL!

My friend got the pad thai, and he was also pleased with his meal. I will be coming back to try other dishes for sure. Places like this need the business. Plus it's got a nice sit-down restaurant feel, but you just order and pay up front and then leave when you're done. That's bonus convenience worth expressing.

Noodle & I? More like Noodles & I Want Some More of Those Delish Noods

Wonderful selection of noodle and congee dishes, I'm working my way through the menu and have loved everything so far. I was especially excited by the Pho, which is by far the best in town. Such a delicious, flavorful broth! Be warned it gets very busy mid week at lunchtime because of the students, but it's worth the wait!

reviews.text: Incredibly COVID safe. Got veggie croquettes, katsu curry, and salmon/tuna sushi and it was super tasty. The veggie croquettes were perfectly crisp and sweet! The katsu curry was a little too spicy for me at level 2. The sushi rice was well flavored!

The tables are way too close together.  I felt uncomfortably close to the people next to me.  

We ordered the spicy fried chicken and spicy miso ramen. I ordered the 1 for the spice level and my boyfriend ordered 2. 

It took over 40 minutes for us to get our food. The fried chicken lacked breading.  It was flavorful, but definitely not what we were expecting.  It really tasted like seasoned chicken, not fried chicken. When the ramen came out, we were disappointed.  It looked like one had more hot sauce/oil in than the other so my boyfriend and I switched, assuming his was the one with more sauce/oil.  The server failed to mention which was which. She seemed confused. 

The pork was rubbery - I wish that it was grilled a little more.  The broth was okay, a little bland.  I noticed other tables got different seasonings to add, but we were only given pepper. 

Overall, I don't think i'll be returning.  While, it's closer to campus, I do favor the other ramen restaurant more.

A much cuter place than I was expecting with terrific ramen and a homemade broth with extremely rich depth of flavor. I was impressed by this place since it is quite close to Purdue University's campus but it doesn't feel like a cheap college restaurant. There's a substantial amount of seating, and the place was fairly busy on a Friday night when my friend and I went, but we were seated instantly. 

They have eight ramen options, but all are pork-based and the only meat option is pork belly. I don't normally like pork belly, but it was homemade here and it was fantastic! Of the eight ramen options, four are not-spicy, and the other four are the same as the first four, just with the option of 3 levels of spicy. Both my friend and I went with the spicy tonkotsu shoyu ramen, level 2 spicy. The ramen was served with noodles, fish cakes, a hard-boiled egg, pork belly, seaweed, scallions, and mushrooms with ramen pepper at the table. It seemed like the spicy factor came from the amount of chili oil they added to the ramen, which is a bit like a ripoff since the spicy ramen costs a dollar more than the regular ramen for just a bit of spicy oil ($11 for regular, $12 for spicy). While it didn't feel worth the extra dollar, I think the spicy factor was a great addition to the meal. 

Please note that they don't have a license for alcohol yet, so your options are water, soda, and tea. They also have a list of appetizers/meals like edamame, tempura veggies, and chicken katsu on their menu. Overall, a great place to warm up and eat some great ramen!

I was excited when I found out there was a new Ramen place, especially one near campus. The first time I went there on a Sunday evening, they told me there was a 40 minute wait. I wasn't going to wait that long, so I came back on a very late evening on a weekday, around 8 ish. It was empty, but yet I had the slowest service ever. There was only one person working at the cashier and also serving everyone in the restaurant....so I was ignored for the longest time because she was so occupied at the cashier.

20 minutes later, got the food and oh dear....

The shio ramen was so bland. The broth was almost tasteless and there was only one very thin slice of meat....it was a really sad experience. It's like they watered down the broth until it's completely tasteless.

If you get the spicy one for a dollar extra, they dump some chilli oil in it and call it spicy...you can literally see the pool of oil on the top of the broth (also only on one side of the bowl)

We also tried the "fried" chicken....it doesn't even have any breading on it...and the spicy version is just drenched in oil. Nowhere close to what a proper karaage should be like...

Overall, absolutely not worth the money for the quality of food and be prepared to wait forever to get your food.

Had the homemade pork belly noodles broth etc.....very good...great decor.....waitress was quick and thoughtful helping me pick. Service quick and prick reasonable.
I will return
Service is very good. I ordered the ramen and didn't finish it. The staff boxes for me and separated the soup and noodles.

Not sure what constitutes authentic ramen or not as I've only had it a few times. However, good food is good food, and this is good food. The broth is flavorful to me with a good noodle to broth ratio. I have also had excellent service; my server has always been polite and friendly.

Look forward to eating here many more times when the weather gets cold!

Lovely little mom and pop Ramen shop. Atmosphere and decor are very charming, the kitchen is open which is fun to watch and there's other dishes to choose if you don't want Ramen. The Ramen is good, but limited in variety. There's another Ramen shop downtown which I think I like better for noodles, but where Denju really gets me is their Curry Katsu and their rice bowls. Their curry is so good, and really hits the spot on a cooler day. Rice bowls are very hearty and filling with a good spread of options. The Chicken Karaage is delicious too. The chunks of chicken are very juicy and don't get dried out and bland when fried, and the fry coating is very tasty (spritz some of the lemon juice from the lemon garnish). They claim to make their broths from scratch, which I can believe as there's a little variance from the bowls I've had at different times. Which I kind of like, makes it feel less process and manufactured. 

I've seen a few reviews about service, which I think are pretty unfair. Every time I've been, it's been the same staff. And I'm just speculating, but it looks like a family run place, with 1 server. Looks like mom and pop in the kitchen and the daughter running front of house. Could be way off base, but I've never had a disgustingly long wait (typically in and out in 40min), and they're beyond nice. They're all very sweet and smile brightly when you leave and say thank you, even when it's busy. Something to be said about a staff that treats you as a human instead of a dollar sign.

If you want an authentically fast Ramen shop, try Yata across the river. If you want a nice place to have a conversation, enjoy the atmosphere, and have some warm comfort food that was lovingly handmade, give this place a shot.
Ate here while in town for an admitted student day.  Excellent dumplings and very good fried chicken.  Service was prompt and very polite.  Food was delivered quickly and was very delicious.

Been here twice. First time it was on a weekday and everthing went fine. However second time i went here during dinner time on Sunday and I have waited for 40 minutes. Shame. Ramen restaurants should be fast-serving, like Japanese style fast food. I've been to Japan and have never seen such slow preparation. Unacceptable, though the ramen itself tastes fine. 

NOT RECOMMENDED during weekends or busy hours . If you stop by on weekdays, then it won't hurt giving it a try.
The ramen was delicious & our waiter was super helpful. Not a lot of frills, but it was a great place to grab dinner after an event across the river in downtown Lafayette.
Amazing ramen shop with delicious appetizers.  Small but gorgeous in the inside.  Perfect place for a nice lunch.

Their noodles were perfectly al dente and the spicy soy broth was delicious. The pork belly was yummy especially if you're less of crispy meat kind of person. I really liked their take on karaage (fried chicken) without the breading. The flavor was great and the mayo dipping sauce was quite refreshing. Ryland our server was really sweet as well! My one stipulation is the spiciness comes only from chili oil which was disappointing. Overall had a great visit and will be back!
So good, I come here at least once every 2 weeks.  Fills you up and they wear traditional outfits. Food is made fresh when you order it. Prices are reasonable.

No doubt, this will be my go to place for ramen before I finish my master degree. Truly an amazing ramen shop. The service was great! And the owner was extremely kind. And the best part is the ramen. I had Miso ramen. Bamboo was cut from fresh, and the chashu was extremely flavorful. The pricing was very reasonable.
Nice environment. The chicken and Ramen taste good but require very long waits (around 30 minutes). Would be great if it can be made faster.
Portion size was small, but in general the food was pretty good. One small bowl of food, as elegant as it looks, will not be enough to call a meal.

Amazing tempura.  Very light and fresh. Gyiza was very good too.  Because these appetizers were 5 stars, we had our expectations up very high for ramen.  I had shoyu tonkotsu while others in our group had miso tonkotsu.  We all agreed these items lacked flavor and weren't served hot enough.  Wait was slightly above normal but we had appetizers so it did t bother us.  Yatagarasu nearby wins the competition but I'd definitely come back here for awesome tempura.
Best ramen in Indiana certainly. Japanese owned. Probably the only authentic and Japanese owned ramen ya in the whole Indiana state. JFK is amazing. Tonkazu is also good
Very bad experience , we have been waiting for like 45 mins for the noodle and appetizer!! Also restaurant Cold as f:/

reviews.text:
Visited here from out of town and loved the food!  I ordered the cranberry turkey club, and it was very delicious and filling.  The fries that were included were hands down one of the best fries I've ever had especially with the sauce they provided. Really liked how the portion sizes were big too.

There was indoor dining, but everything was clean, the tables were far apart from each other, and the servers were really nice.

They usually have a big waitlist but luckily I was able to just walk in and get a table on a Friday night!

They only serve beer, which makes sense considering their name is "tap", which I don't really prefer, over cocktails but that's fine. They have an amazing variety of beer on tap. 

THEIR FOOD IS SOO GOOD. I may not come here again for drinks, but will 100% go for food. We ordered a 6 cheese pizza, sweet Thai chili chicken wings and the tap fries. Everything was so fresh, hot & bursting with flavors!

Fantastic campus vibe without the old fashioned run down walls or tacky interior, all new here! The Tap offers outdoor seating, generous and well thought out inside, a meager yet smart menu, local brews, and a solid friendly staff. Be prepared, there are 70 on tap drips! Easy to get confused! Needs a better way to organized, hopefully there's easier ways to figure out what to order online soon! Will definitely be back and try more things, everyone in our group enjoyed their meals except some had minor niggles more for their own tastes I thought than actual issues. The Black & Blue burger is amazing. Tatter tots appetizer rocks socks. An easy option for adult campus dining, glad to see the first floor of Rise put to good use.

This is one of my new favorite spots at Purdue. I actually like that they have a restriction for 21+ years old only since it is a tap restaurant. It's like a nice place for upperclassmen at Purdue to gather while still having a great place to bring your parents when they come to visit.

I have had a different variety of their menu since they've opened and I've loved every item, even the salads (which sometimes aren't the best at other grill and burger places). You really need to try the truffle parmesan dip for your fries as it's the best dipping sauce I've had.

The customer service is great and they always have a beer to recommend when you are trying to figure out what to try. It's even better that they have free sample sizes so you aren't stuck with a whole beer that you don't enjoy! The only problem I've run into here is the music is excessively loud. It's hard to hear your friends or family that are sitting right across from you.

I was here on a Friday evening with friends. I ordered a flight of beer, tap fries and firecracker shrimp. 
The have a huge beer menu and a lot of different beers for you to choose from. The fire cracker shrimp was very tasty.

The ambience is great and staff are friendly. 
There is street parking available near by. 

Will definitely go back here again.

Overall our experience was great.  The appetizer fiesty feta dip was fantastic.   Great flavor but not too spicy.  The tots were a good choice too.  The other 2 in my party loved their firecracker shrimp tacos.  I ordered the grilled cheese burnt ends.  The fries were good but they didn't grill my grilled cheese.  I should have said something but opted not to make a fuss.  The burnt ends in the sandwich lacked flavor.

We all ordered something different and really loved it. We ordered the flatbread pizza, the thunder chicken tacos as well as a salad and they're all amazing. I got the tater tot's with my Thunder chicken and they were amazing. The tater tot's kind of remind me of the Indiana version of poutine. I would also highly recommend the nefarious nectar draft or the brew crunch draft.

First,  I cannot believe I haven't reviewed The Tap yet. 
Second,  get The Tap fries- really,  you will be immersed in the savory dips &fries and want them every day.  (Can't wait for the fall seasonal fries again this year! )
Okay, I took my parents from out of town to The Tap on a Tuesday around 1130am. We were the only people in there for a while and then two other parties showed up in the end.  The service was awesome and we really enjoyed the food. 
We got The Tap fries (must-have!), Indiana Tenderloin (the reason we went to the Tap), BBQ sandwich and Fried Green Tomatoe BLT.
My only negatives are that The Tap Seltzer tasted like vinegar and that we weren't given silverware&had to request a knife and were still only brought one set. 
Overall, the food was delicious,  service was great & we had a good time.

Great place. Great environment. Our server was a very nice girl with blonde hair (I did Jt catch her name) and she was amazing at introducing me to beers I've never trie before! I was able to tell her what type of beers I liked and she brought me multiple samples until I found one I loved.

Ask for the blueberry beer if you enjoy fruity, fresh, crisp and into the wheat blonde type of beers. The blueberry beer was amazing and had actual blueberries floating around. I'm glad this place has opened back up!!!! I will be back :)

Yum! I've only done their carry-out food a few times at this point but I've enjoyed my meals from here. This location is very convenient for me and the staff are really nice. The line to get in is usually pretty long and the place is way too packed with students for me (social distancing!), so I haven't had a meal inside yet. However, the carry-out meals are nice and fresh. Moreover, you don't have to bother with the long line if you are just there to pick up food. I recommend their sandwiches and the wings for sure!

The service and the food was great! The shrimp tacos had a kick to them, but they weren't too spicy. I also recommend substituting the chips and salsa for fries. The pretzel stick appetizer (not pictured) were perfect and the beer cheese dip had a tonnn of flavor. Beer flights are reasonably priced, but you are only able to choose from the list of Tap beers on draft.

COVID-19 update to my previous reviews. Called the Tap today and ordered two freshly filled crowlers. The friendly customer service dude told me I could come in to pay (which sort of surprised me, because I thought businesses were only doing curbside right now). I explained to him that I am OLD af, so he said he would bring it out to the car. 

Ten minutes later, I pulled up, showed him my ID, signed the CC receipt and he loaded the beer into my car. I wasn't thrilled about having to sign the CC receipt, sort of wish they would try to figure out a way to not make people sign during this virus thing. He told me they had been cleaning the pens between each transaction though.

The beer (Bionic Dragon Blood Orange) was delicious and super fresh. Looking forward to the pandemic fading away and enjoying beers (and food) at the Tap again soon. In the meantime, curbside is the way to go.
How much better can you get than great beer and fantastic food?!? We've tried multiples of their house beers and their guest taps are always rotating too.

I don't recommend this place. Wife went in to order a salad for lunch and upon inspection/eating the salad noticed either dirt or rotting spinach. Took it back in to the manager to get something else. Thinking there would have been some sort of sympathy from the manager but she showed no major concern or even slightly concerned. Charged her full price without any apology. BEWARE! Dirt salads!

Had dinner with three friends this week.  Let me begin by saying I've been to other Tap locations and this is the best of them, WOW. The layout is great and the live music is  worth making the trip. Grace was our server, her recommendations were on point and she was so charming! Definitely will be back.

The Tap menu features something so useful, so simple, and so utilitarian that I simply can't believe that this is the first time that I've come across it. With two pages of beers brewed in-house, determining what to order could prove confusing if you had to go off of names and descriptions alone. Obviously, the types of brews are listed as well, which helps, but there is also a small Cartesian graph with Sweet/Bitter on the X axis and Dark/Light on the Y with the type of beer plotted. This is GENIUS! 
Between the striking number of quality-sounding beers listed and my appreciation for their menu ingenuity, I'm already feeling very favorable toward The Tap. 

I mentioned the large selection of beers, both their own and many others on tap as well as some 1700 in bottles or cans. There are also ciders and a few other brews, but there is limited wine and no liquor, so don't come in looking for cocktails. You'll be able to find something that you'll enjoy if you even marginally like beer.

Or good food. I didn't mention the food yet, which is excellent! Appetizers, entrees, desserts? Got it all and everything has great flavor!

Service was also amazing! Our server was a former bartender who knew the answer to everything we asked as well as being quick and friendly. 

The space is large, with lots of pub tables, booths in the back and a long, winding bar that sits below a small stage for live acts that looks over the two rooms. TVs are present, but not overwhelming, thankfully. Rather, the many paintings of sports or the foot traffic outside seen through the two walls of windows distract the eye more than anything. 

If you enjoy beer and good food, I highly recommend The Tap!

My FAVORITE restaurant in Bloomington. The salad and sandwiches were good, but the stand out was the warm pretzel with cheese sauce.  Pair it with any beer they have on tap and you won't regret.  The beer cheese dip was worth every calorie!

I've been coming in here for the last few months because it feels safe.  What I found today is that it was safe because of WHEN I came in. During off hours, hardly anyone comes in. Today it is packed and I am disheartened to say they are not enforcing masks on the way in the building and while people are walking around. It doesn't feel safe at all to me. If you care about your health, only come in on week days. I've seen zero management in the last two hours, the staff can't keep up, and they are not enforcing masks. I'm typing this on my way out the door. I'll come back when they follow the rules.

I would love to rate it higher as it has a lot of chatter in Bloomington, but it just doesn't go above and beyond other places.  The service was not great as you could just see the waiters all standing around talking to each other rather than coming by to refill water.  The beer cheese pretzels were delicious though!

My friends and I love The Tap! Our favorite thing is the Firecracker Shrimp appetizer. I'd also highly recommend the Nefarious Nectar, it's a great beer. 

They recently reopened in accordance with local and state social distancing requirements. The staff was extremely helpful with navigating the new setup and processes. 

You can even pay for your meal from your phone!

reviews.text:
I cannot get enough of this restaurant. From the outside, it's an unassuming hole-in-the-wall kind of place on the corner of Main and 6th downtown, but hold your judgment and be prepared to be wowed. They've opened during the past year when between-table barriers became standard. So I don't know if they were planning originally to make the section dividers that they've ended up with or if they were a response to Covid, but either way, they're tasteful and artsy. In fact, the entire place has an artistic flair that combines original Japanese culture with a modern Japanese pop approach to style. From the low stools (which are great and much more comfy than they look), to the artwork on the walls, to even the decor and design of the bathrooms, someone has put a lot of thought into the overall vibe and it shows. A fantastic atmosphere.

Now for the best part...the food. My top recommendations are:
1. I canNOT get enough of they're spicy miso ramen. If you're not a fan of heat, just get the regular miso ramen. It has all of the flavor without the kick. The meat is my favorite part, but the eggs are a close second. I have no idea how they pack this much taste into one bowl. It's unreal.
2. The gyoza. It's like a chicken-pork pot sticker. VERY delicious and a fantastic appetizer!
3. The mochi ice cream. It's like ice cream with a soft chewy outside. Hard to describe, easy to eat. I've had the strawberry, and it's worth it.

Overall, a very solid lunch or dinner location. It's informal enough to meet here for a lunch with a friend but would be just as well suited to a Friday night date spot!

I absolutely love this spot. The ramen was divine and the customer service was exceptional.

Due to COVID-19, it may have been a little slower, but the quality was not impacted whatsoever. Highly recommend!'
This is such a good place to eat out. Even with the Covid conditions, it's delicious and the presentation was astonishing. I got pork ramen and the flavor was great. Definitely recommend!

I have come to this restaurant at least once a week for the last 3 months. I was removed from the restaurant today for asking someone in their tiny lobby to use a mask. If you are worried about your safety do not go here. I am sad to say I will never go here again.

Got spicy veggie ramen and it was delicious! It was one of the most savory vegan dishes I've had. The first time I got this the noodles were green in the veggie ramen and I didn't like the taste or texture very much. Last time I went I asked for the regular noodles and it was fantastic.
Always love this place. I've never been disappointed here and love bringing people that are visiting from out of town. This is the perfect place to bring ramen first timers!

A gem among downtown Lafayette's restaurants. It has a relaxed atmosphere and a truly welcoming feel. Plenty of options to choose from, including choices for those who are vegan and gluten free. The saké list is impressive and all choices are delicious. My favorite ramen is the volcano ramen with added chili oil. The menu has many options to choose from and are all delicious and authentic. If you haven't eaten here, it is for sure worth the stop!

Truly a great find while you were camping at a nearby state park! Fair prices and tons of food. All of our children loved it -Which I should let you know that they have some thing for everyone-and our kids vary in age from 7-12! The mini bottles of sake were a really nice touch and the Decor  makes for a really nice dining experience. If we're ever in the area again we will definitely eat here!
Been here a lot since it has gotten cold. Best ramen place in the Greater Lafayette Area. I've been everywhere for ramen on the west coast. Yatagarasu is on my top 5 list of best ramen.

One of the best places to go eat ramen in Lafayette. I love all the options they have for their different types of ramen. The only thing that has consistently happened that I am not a fan of is when I ask for a certain ingredient be taken out, it still comes in the food. This has happened multiple times, but other than that, the food is really delicious and I really enjoy it. I also love the atmosphere of the restaurant and how it's laid out.

Great atmosphere, get eat service, great food! Definitely a place to check out if you're looking for something new to try or live ramen. Flavors were complex and delicious. The amount of food for the price is also great. I'll definitely be going back!

Fantastic. My son and I stopped in after a quick run up to West Lafayette without the wife so we could try new stuff. Man did I enjoy. I had the Miso Spicy Ramen. Just enough heat but not too much. My son had the Paitan Spicy Ramen. A little more heat than mine but I personally liked the flavor more. 
Definitely recommend this place. Good service from a friendly staff.

The food was alright. Honestly though them chairs are weak asl. I do not suggest going and eating inside the restaurant. You are more likely to be comfortable if you walk 100 feet to the nearest park bench near the restaurant.

A friend told that Lafeyette had great Ramen and I made it a point to drop by to test it out if I ever passed by. I did and my friend was right! Yatagarasu has Ramen that can compete with the big cities.

Ramen 5/5 -  Black Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth were excellent with the intense garlic kick infused into the deep, creamy and smoky flavors from the long hours of extracting it from the bones. 

Interior 5/5 - Love the chic brick and timber interior, very rustic and raw feel.

Staff 5/5 - Quick efficient service with a smile. 

Price 4/5 - A little dear for the Ramen, but the lunch meal with a drink and side dish for $15 redeems it a little.

Parking 5/5 - plenty of free parkings outside. Rather pay for food not parking!
Been here twice! I've really enjoyed how they prep their take out! The spicy Miso is delicious! :)
Fantastic!!! The Best Ramen I've had around the region. Good portion, amazing taste, and the owner and servers are very nice!!! Will definitely come back again!!

I cannot explain to you how good this place is, but I'll try. I just moved here a couple months ago from Virginia and though I'm from the Midwest originally, three years in the south has made me weak to these winters again. Cold Novembers mean solid ramen is a must and Yatagarasu did NOT disappoint.

My brother and I had the Fried Calamari and Chicken Karaage (not pictured because we got too excited). The seasoning in the breading was impeccable and the sauce for the karaage had such a nice zest to it. The crunch was so solid that it tasted good even to the ears.

We both got the chicken ramen as our main bowl. My brother asked for "some tofu" but our server, Bailey, heard "sub tofu" (my brother's mistake, not Bailey's). Bailey was quick to get the original helping of chicken for the ramen and was so sincere about the miscommunication even though it totally wasn't his fault!
I opted to get a bunch of extras because I'm a man who needs spice, and the chili oil and paste did not disappoint. The broth mixed with the chili was unbelievable. I felt so warm you'd think it was summer. Excellent flavor in the veggies, noodles had the perfect chew, and the chicken was so tender. If it isn't obvious to you yet, this was the best ramen I've ever had. (My brother, though Yelp-less, also agrees.)

We thought we were done, but the allure of strawberry mochi was too much to resist, so we caved. I didn't expect to enjoy such a cold treat in November but after all of the savory flavors in the ramen, the chilled sweetness was extremely refreshing. 15/10 mochi. Might even have to go back tomorrow for it.

Bailey, if you're reading this, you're the man. Also, to all the kitchen staff at Yatagarasu, thank you. Seriously. This meal was a gift.

It was decent. Atmosphere was cool... service was eh. My daughter didn't like it and tried maybe a bite... needless to say it probably should have been discounted but wasn't even offered, hence there is your tip...

We love ramen. Every time we travel new cities, we always stop by ramen place. This is a hidden gem in Lafayette area. We were so surprised the fact that we haven't come this place for the last two years. We just underestimated for some reason. However, this place got us! We planned to try all the manus this Summer! One thing to improve is the cutting direction of lemon in fried calamari in my picture. This cutting direction makes us harder to squeeze properly. You can find easily from Google search.

I've been here about five times now, and I've got to say, it's so nice to have some authentic ramen in Lafayette. I first started to really get into ramen this summer while I was living in Dallas, Texas and ramen places were a dime a dozen. Lafayette, however, doesn't have as many options. Luckily, Yatagarasu is a solid choice. 

My go-to order is the miso ramen. Simple, but delicious. It's savory and hearty while not overbearing. The pork is tender and moist, and I just wish there was more of it. I love the inclusion of a soft boiled egg. It adds to the depth of flavor. 

The other stand-outs here are the small plates. We usually order 2-3 of them as appetizers. The star, for me, are the crispy Brussels sprouts. They're, as the name implies, crispy, with a nice sprinkling of salt and other seasoning. 

Prices are pretty decent here. Ramen runs around $13, but it's a generous serving. 

Service is good, and there have only been a couple occasions where the food seemed to take a while. 

Overall, if you're a ramen fan, and you're in the Purdue/Lafayette area, I have no problems recommending this location.
