reviews.text: Easy spot for my favorite bar in lafayette, exquisite drink options and local brews, fantastic menu with value and original items, large indoor and outdoor area with simple atmosphere making good times easy. My buddy and I enjoyed the chicken strips and their original totchos - nachos but using tater tots instead of fries, a supreme idea! Major props for thinking outside the box and looking for a quality sour . I love a good sour and have a difficult time finding good ones anywhere. The Mad Dog apricot sour on tap was too good for words. The only issue we had was quite unique being a random locally produced video shown on three of the TV screens so we could not avoid it period it was extremely violent and brutally bloody, no ideal for keeping the appetite or making for an enjoyable dining experience. Both of us were rather distracted and put off our food by the horror. I personally am not a sports fan but I have never wished so much to see sports on the TVs! Hopefully when I come back on Fridays for the poutine it will be a more usual bar time which is exactly what this place should be and easily can be.

I'm an old Boilermaker so I remember slumming across the river to mix with the locals with a Pabst Blue Ribbon.  Now it carries a hip throw back Texan vibe with enough distance from Purdue that it's not ordinary. Margaritas are on tap delivering a suitable punch of flavor and buzz. The vegetarian tacos with beer battered avocados offered a healthy dose of crunchy and smooth. The basic burger is double stacked and buttered for a great point of difference. Enjoyed the spiced fries cooled by a wonderful screened in breeze.  All good for a slightly off-campus-diagonal-from-the-laundromat break from the norm. The staff hustles and that makes my German blood happy..

My husband really enjoyed their chips and queso that he had 2 orders. We also had their salsa, it had a real kick to it and tasted great. I had the steak tacos, they were ok. My husband had the cheeseburger and fries. The burger was nothing extraordinary but he really like their fries.

Traditionally I enjoy a good "dive bar" and this one fits the bill. It is just a few notches below a sports bar due to the taxidermies on the wall.
We stopped in on a Monday afternoon, around lunch time, specifically for the "in honor of the Kooler Keg" tenderloin. Man, was I woefully disappointed. The breading was not cracker crumb, but cornmeal. My tenderloin had hot spots in it, as it it was been cooked in oil after an order of jalapeño poppers. 
I had upgraded to onion rings but they were burnt. 
Sadly this was not the tenderloin I as searching for; a replacement for my beloved Kooler Keg.

Came here on 11/18 in the late evening with my father, who has a service dog (vest, license, tag, the whole nine yards). As he was walking to a table, an employee (red shirt white dude) who was obviously intoxicated walked up from behind, put his arm around him, and asked why he needed a service dog. We informed him it was not legal to ask this question, asked him to maintain social distancing, and walked away to a table. About 3 minutes later, a blonde female employee (not visibly drunk) and a man claiming to be the manager who was incredibly drunk came up (again not social distancing) and asked again why my father needed a service dog. Again, we informed them it was illegal to ask. The manager said it can't be illegal because he likes dogs and would not stop asking. After some back and forth, including both employees attempting to pet and interact with my fathers service dog, they moved on. There was apparently a drag show trivia night, during which dancers were not social distancing and repeatedly danced up to our table dispute us asking her not to. After the third time, when the dancer approached the service dog, my father left the building and we stayed to pay our tab for the three beers we were unable to drink. A fight (verbal, but escalated because of alcohol) broke out between a table of 20 something drunk women who did not like service animals and a table of kind middle aged onlookers telling them to knock it off. We flagged down three employees, including the manager, and asked for our bill. The manager, who was so drunk he was not able to make eye contact, informed us he could not hear us and asked to follow us outside. Outside, he demanded to know why my father needed a service dog. We informed him it was illegal to ask and said we would like to pay our bill and leave. He again said that it was okay because he likes dogs, demanded to know what my father's disability is, all the while yelling and invading our (two women) personal space. We asked him to please back away and to calm down, and in reply he moved closer and again demanded to know my fathers disabilities. Feeling threatened and not being permitted to pay our tab despite pleading to, we walked away. Very disappointed in the staff and general attitudes. I love(d) this establishment and was a pre-Covid regular, but will no longer be returning. I recommend you do the same.

The best part about Lafayette Indiana is the Sixth Street Dive. 

Sure there's Purdue, college sports, and other things around town. But THIS DIVE Y'ALL. This dive is the place to be. 

Aside from having all the beers and spirits you could want, the food is out of this world. I'm talking Mexican and TexMex food that would have you think you're miles away from the border. 

Pork Rinds so fresh and crispy, you'll wonder how you even ate the stuff in a bag. 

Poutine flavors so unique and flavorful, you'll be stalking the Dive's Facebook page to see what the next poutine combo will be. 

Brunch so bomb, you'll wake up on a Sunday to mosey in over to nosh on some Chilaquiles while sipping a delightful Bloody Mary. 

Run, don't walk, and get yourself the meal you deserve at Sixth Street Dive today! 

PRO TIP: if you like spicy, you want to try the house sauce ON EVERYTHING!

I cannot wait to work my way through this whole menu. Honestly, as a Texan living in Indiana, I love this place. It's so nice to find such delicious food that reminds me of home. Andrew was a great server and we had a great time. The fried avocado was phenomenal. Since it's a local place and not far from me, I anticipate being there with some regularity.

Four stars because of the wings!

Dropped by at somewhat of an odd lunch hour one Monday. We got their $12 wings (10 pieces) with Dive sauce and blue cheese as a side sauce. We also tried out their chicken burrito.

Now, the burrito was very disappointing. Just bland, and all the chicken seemed to have ended up on one side of the burrito. Will not be getting this again.

However, the wings were divine. In fact, a week later we went back to get more. The sauce has a unique taste (and you can get extra on the side). Very juicy. $12 is a little hefty for an appetizer but there's a good portion of wings and it can easily be shared between two. 

Try the wings :)

I was visiting my best friend from college and her family (December 2019). She wanted to do brunch here with her, her husband and me. I had never had it before so I was looking forward to trying it. We got seated as soon as we walked in. We got the Beignets and asked for all 3 sauces so I could try it since it was my first time. Apparently her daughter really likes the beignets, so they ordered an extra order to go for her to share with her mom. Then for my meal, I got the Chilaquiles. The staff were friendly. It wasn't very busy while we were there. The food was okay. I'm glad I experienced it since my friend and her daughter like their food, but I would probably want to go somewhere else next time I visit and we go out to eat.

I'll begin by saying that my wife and I argued over this review when I told her that I was hardly impressed after leaving here. Sure, the food was OK, but getting it (and drinks) was like an act of Congress. If I had my way, this place would barely get two stars. But, my wife made some points that were important for her, and she's also a tough customer. So here it goes...

There's a certain irony about this place naming and patterning itself after a Texas landmark -- the lack of service here.  Texas' motto is 'friendship,' and the word 'friendly' is derived from the same word (friend).  Service here on our visit was anything but friendly. In fact, our server barely came around ... and when she did, she quickly darted to the adjacent table (who had questions about a beer) in the middle of my father giving his order. It got to the point that the manager had to step in and take care of our table. Back to that in a minute...

This place is definitely divey, but not in a Sixth Street (Austin) type of way.  If you've been to Sixth Street, you know that the divey places are just that. But this place is more 'Disney' divey. No biggie. 

The food here is actually pretty good. The salsa was surprisingly Texas, as was the queso.  Though fried pork loin (the reason I came here) is hardly a Texas thing (we're a fried beef state), it was good ... served hot and fresh. But if you're looking for sweet tea -- also a Texas staple -- it ain't happening here. And if you get the same waitress we had the misfortune of having, she'll let you know that in a curt tone -- as if she's heard the question a thousand times and is tired of answering it.    

Want any salad dressing here other than ranch or bleu cheese? Forget it. The manager himself told us "We used to have other dressings but they didn't sell." So apparently, a couple of bucks worth of Italian or Thousand Island is too much for these folks.

Should you come here at least once? Perhaps. But don't expect good service ... even if you're a student who's looking to get his drunk on. That said, I'm willing to bet that there are other superior joints in West Lafayette, for food, drink and good times.  And the whole Texas thing here? Don't buy it. We're better than that.

I came here on a Sunday afternoon for a late lunch. Parking could be better, but luckily we found a spot around the corner. 

The menu looks pretty great I definitely want to come back and try more things because I couldn't decide what to get! Ultimately, I went with the fish n chips and my boyfriend got the fried chicken sandwich with tater tots. Both were delicious! I loved their homemade tarter sauce and their fries were better than average in my opinion! 

The only thing I had a problem with was the fact that my water tasted kind of sweet like fruit punch. I don't think my mason jar was fully clean. 

Other than that, I had a great time here! I like that it's 21+ and maybe I'll have a drink next time too.

Long time Dive fan. Great Texican food and they can explain the difference between Mexican and Texican. So it's like dinner and an education.  They  had a tamale special the other day. If you like tamales give them a try. Really good but I've got so many favorites on the menu it's tough to work into my rotation.

I suppose that Valentine's Day wasn't the best time to come to a place that calls itself a dive bar, but our experience was uneven this round. First the good - the beers on tap are exceptional. The "totchos" were a creative touch (think nachos, but with tater tots), and the wings were great (tasty, but advertised as "really hot", and actually quite mild). On the negative side, we ordered blackened chicken 'n chips, and got breaded instead. They were gracious about putting in another order for what we ordered immediately, and left the breaded chicken strips "to snack on" while they redid the order. Both were very tasty.

We didn't expect, and didn't appreciate, the abundance of naked women on the TV screens. The big bearded guy at the sound table in the fishnet stockings and a skirt was also kinda hard to ignore. The entertainment hadn't started when we left, so he may have been quite entertaining. But all around, the whole experience didn't make for a very relaxing, enjoyable evening (for us, at least), and we'll think twice about coming next time.
Once again, met and exceeded expectations.  Best burritos within 300 miles. Green sauce is bueno

I was sad but now I'm happy. I don't know if any place would fill the void that the chicken wings at Spurlocks created when they closed down, but the wings at 6th St dive come the closest; especially with their dive sauce. I've been here many times but never had the wings. Highly recommend!!

I've go here for take out food sometimes since it's in walking distance from my place. Many of the reviews rave about the great food here, but if says the food is just alright. I really like the fish from the fish and chips and their burgers and chicken sandwiches are ok for the price and speed. The tacos are not my favorite. My biggest complaint though is that the fries suck.  Never hot, kind of chewy and bland. They also host drag shows sometimes which is really not my scene. The building is spacious inside though and comfortable. It's a decent place to go for a late night hang out and drinks.

My latest obsession.  TRY.the.TENDERLOIN!  It's the best in Tippecanoe!  Period.  --Or rather,  EXCLAMATION!

This one takes the cake.  

The food emerging from this kitchen is fantastic.  Their steak tacos remind me of Mexico...  Love them!

There is nothing Dive-y about this place!!

Update:  a year later and this is still the best tenderloin I can find in this town! Keep it up folks!
Always love a dinner at this little gem, but decided to go for brunch... and YUM! so trendy & delish!
My fave fish and chips in town! Yummy tacos and good beers on tap too! I love meeting friends here, always a good time!

Went out for live music last night and decided to check it out here.   We used to come here all the time for live music at Clubhouse/Squirrel Cage. 

I can honestly say I can't remember the last time I was here on a Saturday night, 9pm-ish. 

The bar war was. There were lots of large groups out and this is before the music.  It was a good mix of people but there were a lot of 20-somethings.  

I'm not sure who the band was but it was just a guitar player and drummer.  I'm always a fan of bands being set up and soundchecking prior to when they are supposed to start, but this band didn't and that's for another review.  When we arrived, we couldn't tell if they were still having live music because there was nothing set up anywhere. The band could use a better PA system that is more conducive to being able to make out the words he is singing.  

We found seats against the back wall (where the TV for playing video games used to be) and were served promptly.  We ordered food and it was fantastic.  My wife got some stuffed avocado thing and I got a 'Hand-Spanked' burger with tots.   The burger was truly fantastic.  Very reminiscent of the ClubHouse and the portion of tots was more than I ended up eating.  

They always have a good beer selection and post the draft beer list on the back chalkboard.  I like to just see the taps with the handles to make a list but I know it is easier the way they do it.  

Only 'complaint' is that the Men's restroom could use some help.  One of the urinals was out of order and you can tell that it appears they don't put alot of effort into the restroom.  It could use some sprucing up to return it to how cool it was when they first remodeled it.  

I am interested in going back for more live music to see if the sound system other band's bring is any better.  May be a decent, but pricey, investment for The Dive to put their own system in.

reviews.text:
Okay. Here's the low down. This is probably THE BEST BURGER SPOT in ALL of Lafayette. The quality of service, the variety of options, the location, the venue itself, the price, all of it. You just have to go there to get the full effect. But here's my breakdown.

The good. 
- Bru Burger is located in downtown Lafayette right next to the train station and foot bridge into West Lafayette. It's an easy walk here after going to the Farmer's market downtown or if you're touring Purdue and want to walk over.
- It's easy on your wallet. You get what you pay for. Good food isn't (usually) cheap and cheap food isn't (usually) good. So yes, it's more expensive than McDonalds. That being said, you can get an artisan burger for $11-14. It's not going to break the bank like many other restaurants of the same caliber might.

The better.
- The service is good. Very good. Employees seem to enjoy their work, and are super friendly. They keep finding quality employees. The management doesn't seem very involved in a visible role (no one comes around asking how everything is, etc.), but your waiter or waitress takes such good care of you that it doesn't matter. And I'm sure management is doing their job well, albeit behind the scenes.
- The venue. It's trendy, modern, and fun. Their side patio is ideal for outdoor dining. The screen walls come down in the winter and its heated to provide excellent outdoor dining even in the cold. And nothing beats eating a Bru burger outside in the warm spring breeze.

The best.
- Yup. I saved the best for last: the food. 
- WOWZA. The burgers are delicious, and I've had nearly all of them (not at the same time). Not that hungry? Build your own starting with a "burger snack" base for the perfect miniature burger.
-The fries. Dining with a friend? Get the appetizer fries. It's like twice the cost as a side of fries for about 4 times the amount. Plus, it's served with their homemade black pepper mayo. I repeat for the people in the back...GET THE BLACK PEPPER MAYO.
- Get. The. Nachos. You'll thank me later. Especially if you're getting a takeout order, the pork nachos are the best thing on the menu. The queso, the pickled jalapeños, the pico, the seasoned pork, all of it. It'll blow your mind.

They have some locations in Indy which are also good, but the one here in Lafayette is my favorite. You won't be sorry you came here.

I ordered a Bru Hot Chicken and a garlic three cheese veggie burger from Bru yesterday. The food was hot and fresh and super delicious! We picked up the burgers and the take out was seamless with the staff wearing masks. Would definitely order again! Loved it!

We happened on this place 6 weeks ago when things were still very very quiet in Lafayette. Enjoyed our burger and beer so much that, coming through here again, I made a reservation for outside seating on a Saturday night. When we arrived it was MUCH busier - including a "packed" (by our new Covid parameters) indoors. The servers were so busy that at first I worried we would be forgotten. This was completely not the case! Though our server did take a few minutes to get to us (again because he was busy with others), our drink order came out VERY quickly and our food followed shortly. The fries were so crisp I had a hard time not eating them all immediately. Our two burgers (Mexicali and Greek Lamb) were done exactly as ordered and we got to sample 4 different beers including some local Indiana brews. I was so impressed with how the operation was run this night that I asked to speak to the manager to give my compliments. Since we are now driving between Atlanta and Minneapolis instead of flying, I anticipate that we will be in Lafayette again and when we are, I will look forward to another Burger & Beer meal!

Seriously the best burger you will have period.

This place is usually really busy (for good reason), so try to get a reservation beforehand. They employ a ton of staff so they keep up with the volume once you're in. The burgers are obviously the go to here and you really can't go wrong with any choice. I had the Patty Melt, which may seem a little underwhelming, but boy did it pack a ton of flavor. They cook your burger exactly how you want it too which is nice. The only flack is that the side portions of fries (while delicious) are a little small.

Nothing to see here.  
 Trying too hard to be different and forgot to pay attention to the basics. 

Onion rings overly breaded and too tough. 
Burger selection was inventive but missed the mark totally.  

Beer selection is good and staff is nice.

We stopped in to have lunch. Love all of the great burger combos, served with fries and housemade ketchup, which is super yummy  we sat in the enclosed patio which was surprisingly warm, as it was only 7 degrees outside  service was fast & friendly. We will be back

My first time here. Couldn't eat in because of the China Wuhan virus. Food was great. Order on the phone and they bring it to the car. Easy. Had a spicy chicken sandwich. All our orders were correct and the portions generous. Will come back when Covid19 is dead and gone. 

4.5 Bellies!  Great food.

It pains me to write this review, because I like this restaurant, but I had a very bad experience on my last visit. Let me preface this by saying that the food was ok. We tried something different with the impossible Hiki'ole (which tasted like a meat burger and was pretty good) and the black bean burger (which I really didn't like). 

As in my previous review, I've touted Bru Burger to be one of the best places to eat at/ take out food from during COVID. For that reason, we have been getting curbside pickup here regularly. On my last order, as usual, we called to put in the order for curbside pickup, at which point we checked that they would do curbside pickup, to which the person over the phone said yes. When it was time to make the pickup, after I drove up to the restaurant and gave them a call, the staff member that answered the phone was very rude. They told me that I need to come into the restaurant and that they don't do curbside pickup on he weekend (because they do the open air dining on weekends). Upon telling them that I checked about curbside pickup just 15 minutes prior (when I put in the order), I was told that maybe the person who took the order wasn't aware of what they claimed. When I said that I've gotten curbside pickup before, I was told that if I'm not going to come in and get the food, they don't know what else they can do for me. Since I wasn't going into the restaurant (for personal reasons) and stated so, the staff member finally gave in and brought the food out to me. At this point, they made a fuss about me having to sign the bill, which I've never had to do here before. They've always brought the food out to my car and left it in the trunk. The staff member wouldn't give me the food till I signed the check. I signed the check, but I was very disappointed with this experience.

I love BRU Burger and generally visit the Indy location - I was so happy to see the same standards of customer service and food quality were present here. This visit in particular was to celebrate my graduation from Purdue. 

We had the triple dip & each had a burger w/fries or onion rings. I do wish more bread was served with the dip, but they quickly brought us extra. We also had a bowl of chili - new to me and definitely something I'd order again. Hands down, the BRU Onion Rings are THE BEST I've ever had. The burgers were also good - the only potential drawback was they weren't exactly cooked as requested. 

Thanks for a great celebration!

Went for the first time on a Friday night and sat outside. They have heating lamps for when it gets cold and it was nice and cozy. Our waitress, Abbie, was so nice and attentive! I had the fried chicken sandwich and my boyfriend had the Bru burger. I loved the sandwich and the fries are amazing. He really enjoyed the burger, it was fairly messy and wet but overall had great flavor!

I have been to most of the Indiana Cunningham Restaurants, so while headed home, I stopped for dinner in Lafayette.  I was lucky and found some free street parking on the next block and walked over.  I noticed there were a lot of customers seated on the patio having dinner already, but fortunately, I was able to grab a spot at the bar.

Inside, the room is very tastefully decorated with lots of dark wood.  The noise level was pleasant, not too loud.

I was greeted by the bartender with a menu and water.  I wanted to get a burger, but wasn't hungry enough for one of their half pounders, so I asked about a smaller version.  They have a basic burger for a lower price and you can add the toppings of their specialty burgers for an extra $2.  So, I went with the smaller version of the Honey Chipotle BBQ Burger.  This was another one of those BMB (Big Mouth Burgers), but I was able to squeeze it down to manage.  The flavor was really good.  I liked the bacon with the BBQ and burger flavors.  

I also had a Gorgonberry Pecan Salad.  I ordered the small (and was only charged for a small) but the thing nearly covered a large plate.  Wow!  I love this salad and get one almost every time I dine at one of the BRU restaurants.

Wait times were minimal and the bartender did a good job of checking in to make sure I was being taken care of.  

Very good flavor with a nice setting.  Really like the ability to not have to over order.

Review #3048

Note: according to staff, the "veggie burger" and the "black bean burger" are not vegan. Previous review was from opening week and the information I got was wrong. They still have the portabello mushroom sandwich and impossible burger which are vegan. My first time around, the waitress told me all I had to do was sub out the mayo to make the garbanzo and mushroom patty vegan. It'd be really nice for the menu to specify exactly why something isn't vegan, so that people that don't want to eat any animal products don't have to rely on the staff to know the difference. 

I'd say I'm much less excited about the place now that I know that my only choices are the portabello and the impossible if it's in stock.

OLD review:

I'm really happy with this burger joint! It's a regional chain with restaurants in Ohio, Kentucky, and (of course) Indiana. 

The menu is very clearly marked to show which items are vegan or vegetarian. For vegans, the menu is pretty skimpy on the appetizer sides. It looks like it may be onion rings or the soft pretzel without the pub cheese (ask first if the pretzel has any butter). We skipped straight ahead to the salad.  

We tried the quinoa salad (spring mix, crispy quinoa, edamame hummus, cucumber, portobello, peppadew pepper jam, and white balsamic-orange vinaigrette). Not at all what I was expecting - the quinoa is mashed into a ball and fried. The rest of the salad comes kind of decomposed, with long slices of portobello. It was delicious. 

And...there are THREE vegetarian burgers:
+ Impossible burger - we ordered medium well, and comes with vegan cheese, vegan mayo mustard, house ketchup, greens
+ Garbanzo and mushroom patty (vegetarian)- it comes with mayo, we substituted for vegan mayo. Comes on an oat bun
+ Black bean burger (vegetarian) - I'm not entirely sure what makes this one vegetarian and not vegan (did not try). 

Few other details: Staff was very friendly, and we were seated quickly. They have have a large selection of rotating local and regional beers, and a good number of wines by the glass on the menu. But no vegan desserts. 

Quite impressive to have this many vegan and vegetarian options, I'm sure we'll be back here next time we're in town.

Went here a few weeks back and it was good. Just a solid burger place that does what they have well. They have a very extensive local beer list and the server we had was very knowledgeable on the menu.

I've eaten here multiple times and have tried several different burgers. The burgers are good but nothing to write home about, and they're pretty pricey. Their fries are great, so I wish they would step up their burger game a bit. 
The atmosphere is nice though and the restaurant is pretty big. It's refreshing to go to a place with indoor dining.

Bru Burger Lafayette-  updated review, heard the salads were good, had the Valencia Salad with Blackened Salmon.  Salad was very good, would highly recommend.  However, don't bother with the salmon, it's high quality but extremely bland.  They should try Legacy Pub's Blackened Salmon to get an idea of what a seasoned salmon filet tastes like.  Literally tasted like a plain filet cooked on a flattop.  Was visually blackened, just no flavor.  I'll try the grilled chicken on the Valencia next time to see if there's improvement, the salad it's self was that good.

Since we aren't going out much during these COVID times, we have enjoyed weekly carry out nights. bru Burger is one of our favorites!  Online ordering is super easy. Burgers come assembled and packaged with care. We order the onion rings "extra crispy " and they indeed stay that way during the drive home. Although we look forward to the days of going out to eat with our family without masks, Bru Burger makes it easy to have a great meal at home.

Having walked past BRU, it looked like a decent place to try.  The outdoor area sold me!

I brought two co-workers, but didn't want sit chummy with them since we're from different parts of the country.  The staff accommodated my request, and we got things going. 

One got a burger (not an adventurous diner), and the other got the BBQ.  I, on the other hand, got the gorgonberry salad w/salmon.  Since I'd been in a hot/humid factory all day, the LAST thing i needed was a gut-buster meal.  I highly recommend this salad.  With the salmon, it had all sorts of flavors & textures to keep me from focusing TOO much on Mr BBQ's onion rings.  They looked GOOD, I have to say. 

Great service from Abby!

We had wanted to try the one in Indy, but never had the opportunity, so when a BRU opened up here in Lafayette, we knew we had to try it out!

We went for lunch a week after it opened( it was busy, but we were able to get one of the last available tables. Our server, Nick, was fantastic! He made me feel way less weird about my...unpopular...meat preferences.

We didn't try any apps or desserts; I'm not really sure how anyone would have room (however, I will say that I may end up making a special trip for the whiskey fudge brownie, which sounds and looks delicious)! My husband ordered The Beginning Burger and fries, and I had the Honey-Chipotle BBQ burger. We both really enjoyed our burgers (mine was particularly massive); the fries were pretty good too (I  tried one, and they were pretty potato-y, which is the only way I like fries).

As for my burger specifically, it could be a bit messy to eat (mostly because pulled pork falls out easily), but the crunch from the onion ring adds great texture. It does have a bit of a kick (as the name implies), but it's not overbearing.

The decor is modern and streamlined, though conversations seem to carry throughout the room. The carpeted area with tables seems like it might be a bit cramped; navigating your way through to get to the bathroom can be a challenge.

All in all, we had an excellent experience, and we'll definitely be back!

Update: We came back and brought our kids. The kids menu offers options that will appeal to most kids (burgers, nuggets, mac and cheese, popcorn shrimp, and grilled cheese), and the kids entrees come with a side and a drink. They're pretty competitively priced to comparable restaurants. My kids had the cheeseburger with onion rings and the mac and cheese with fruit. I thought the mac and cheese didn't have a lot of flavor, but my kids both loved their food.

My husband got the Beginning Burger and fries again, and I tried the Memphis BBQ Melt, which I highly recommend!
Great food and great service! So many unique burger options! There is something for everyone! Even my 10 year old son said he would give Bru Burger 10 Stars!! Yum!!
Anna the server was great nice and helpful also made recommendations. The bartender made me a very good Hendricks Negroni I would come back

reviews.text:
I order from here a lot. Partially because it's close to Pay Less but also because I like that I can use their own online system and not give away money to third party delivery services.

The sushi is quite creative. They have a large variety of rolls and options and I think we almost always get maybe 4-5 small rolls and a noodle dish and a starter for a family of four adults. The special rolls are significantly larger in size (usually 6 pieces) while the smaller rolls are 8 pieces and bite sized.

They also sell Beijing duck at this restaurant that you have to order in advance. It's not truly authentic because the skin is not crispy, but it's still good roasted duck.

I ordered the udon with beef a couple times mostly to make it a fuller meal but it is one of their weaker dishes.

Stopped in for a quick lunch. The restaurant is very clean and sanitized with good distancing. Everyone was wearing a mask. I chose the 3 roll lunch which includes soup or salad. The miso soup was hot and flavorful. Green onions evident. I had spicy tuna, Boston and shrimp tempura rolls. All were great. Very fresh ingredients and delivered rapidly for a busy dining room. Good value for a nice, not fast food lunch. The menu is extensive. Will certainly want to try it again.

I love getting delivery from this place. I've never been disappointed when trying new items from the menu: sushi, ramen, you name it! This is my go-to place for delivery or pick up and I'm a huge fan. I've been working my way through the ramen menu as you can see from the photos, so far I like them all!

Called ahead and placed an order for pick-up. Unfortunately you do have to go inside as they do not at present offer curbside pick up.

I spoke to Janet/Jeanette over the phone who was a bit curt and seemed to be in a big rush to end the call.
We tried the following:
1) shrimp sumai - this was pretty good albeit a little soggier than I'm used to.
2) aged tofu - nice big pieces of tofu with yummy sauce on the side
3) spider roll - I asked how many pieces are in an order of their regular rolls and was told 6, however only got 5 spider rolls. They were not well packed and two of the rolls had come apart (see photos).
4) spicy girl roll - you get 8 pieces. Very yummy.
5) Tokyo Chicken - comes with a side of rice and either soup or salad. To be honest, this dish tasted like it had been made a while ago... very soggy and not crispy at all. You are probably better off ordering this if eating in person rather than delivery/pick-up. Good portion! The miso soup was good.

Total cost - approx $50

Overall the packaging and service was not the greatest but the food is good.
I would give them another go!
This place is delicious. Pork tonkatsu ramen & sweetheart roll are on point. I eat here at least once a week.
Great sushi and sake choices. Service is fast and dependable. One of the few places in town that allows dine-in at this time, which is nice and refreshing.

This place is amazing! If you haven't been here it's a MUST TRY! everything is as good as it looks! Super fresh, perfectly cooked! Certainly will return!!!! This is our new go to place! The service was friendly and great

I was very happy with this place. They offer indoor  dining and have a very large sushi menu. I recommend their spicy garlic edamame. I saw they have a great lunch menu so I plan to try that out soon!

Grabbed the kids during Christmas break to meet the Mrs for lunch. For starters don't expect friendly servers, if you can deal with that it's a decent experience. Not as good as Sushi Don.

Almost everything was prepared as described but a little on the bland side. Luckily there is chili pepper seasoning on every table. It was the perfect compliment if you like to dial in your spice level and saltiness. 

My wife wasn't terribly impressed with the lunch sushi (spicy tuna & tempura chicken rolls) she said she had had better sushi from a gas station. Now that's sketchy. The chicken karaage were tiny bits of fried chicken that were over done and very dry. On the menu it looks like small fried chicken wings. Once I spiced up my ramen dish it was pretty good. Loaded with too many noodles and shy on broth. To taste the noodles alone, one would not humm with delight. What I mean is it's obvious they are pre boiled in bland water and tossed in at service. I wish the smaller places would take time to bring the noodles back to life within the broth. If anyone can steer me to a place not in Chicago that makes fresh noodles and prepares them properly I would be in your debt.

I gave this a 2.8 out of 5.
The sweetheart roll was awesome. Service is good.  Very reasonable prices. The seating was not social distances but clean properly. The shrimp hibachi was tasty as well.

The service was ok. Our waiter seemed busy with otuer tables a lot but the waitress at the table across from us was super nice and helpful.  The food was amazing we will 100% be returning.  We also ordered the Mochi but my kid's ate it before we for a picture.  They were very professional and kept things super clean .

Modern setting in a strip mall on a good busy street on the west side of town.  Parking is easy too.

Came at 5pm on a weeknight and were the first customers here.

Menu is expansive with fancy innovative sushi rolls.  This first trip had a dinner bento and teppanyaki beef.  Service was quick direct and food was fast too.  Everything was quite tasty and we would come back.  Def want to try the ramen in the future.

Nothing fancy about the place but I don't need that.  There were a lot of takeout orders being picked up too.

Didn't have room for dessert.  One sushi roll two teas and the entrees totaled $52 with tax and tip.  Not bad for a casual week dinner.

A good experience about sums up what you can expect here as a dining experience -- not bad, but not excellent. The interior of the restaurant is pleasant, emulating a modernised/neon-ified Tokyo restaurant, black-stained wood and lacquer off-setting the colourful, glammy lights. The menu has a wide array of sushis, from the simple to the popular Americana rolls you can find in most sushi parlours across the country (Dragon roll, California roll, CC roll, etc.), as well as some other, cooked Japanese fare for those who might not be fans of raw fish, such as a small selection of udon, ramen, bento boxes, and so forth. 

I had a fried California roll with a stir-fried chicken yaki udon, and both were nice, though not the best versions I have ever tasted. I also had the "hot tea" (ostensibly green tea), and I was a little put-out to find that, however else they prepare the tea, they finish it off by blasting it in a microwave, given that the cup is far too hot to hold at first when they serve you it (which doesn't happen if the tea was heated or boiled on its own, then poured into the cup to be served). The service was a little bit chilly as well -- not rude, just sort of absent-minded or apathetic. So there are a few edges that could be smoothed out a little as far as the food quality and service goes, but, again, it is not bad, and I will definitely return.

Best vegetarian roll ever!
The sweet potato roll graced my tastebuds today and it changed my life. This is my second time here and I love this place--always super friendly and quick. Plus the restaurant looks really cool inside! Prices are great for college students.
Overall this is one of my favorite places in West Lafayette.
10/10 even for vegetarians.

Love this place. Onion soup is awesome. Here's my favorite list!

Fantasy 
Godzilla
Dynamite 
Ginza 
Lava
Green River 
Crazy grill 
America dream 
Katana

Service is awesome. They also do a great job with carry put orders.
Great sushi at affordable price. Got 6 rolls, soup, and a lunch box for under $35. Service was good  and overall great lunch/experience

I went here for lunch with a bunch of coworkers the other day.  Located in a strip mall, it's an unassuming looking place from the outside.  Inside the ambiance is much better and you can forget you're sitting in a strip mall.  We got one of the private booths with the bead curtains which made for a cozy little spot.

From sushi to ramen, the menu has a great variety.  I ordered the ramen and it did not disappoint.  If I had to make a complaint it would be that the egg in the ramen was a cut hard boiled egg rather than the usual soft boiled egg found in ramen, but it was delicious regardless.  Very large portion.  I couldn't finish it all.

I definitely look forward to returning and trying more of the menu.

If I could give it 4.5 I would add a half star.

The sushi was fresh, delicious and the rice had a nice balanced flavor. Tuna was very fresh, delicious and the avocado was perfect!

We did an order for pickup because hubby had a very short window for eating lunch.

They included a hot appetizer for crab Rangoon for free when we picked up our order. I don't know if this was a special, she really didn't say why, just that we were getting a free appetizer. It was six pieces and they were good, a little on the sweeter side but good.

We didn't get to try any ramen but based on the sushi order I will return to try more menu items.

Of special note on the service, which was excellent and prompt. As I mentioned earlier hubby had a short window, and it started at 11:30. They open at 11:00 and it's 15 minutes away. So I called the night before, they graciously took my order when I explained the timing problem and were so helpful. And when my son and I arrived at 11:10 everything was ready to go even though we were 5 minutes early. This allowed us to have a nice, unhurried lunch where his meetings were held.

I will definitely be dining at Katana again.

I order food from here all the time and i love it so much.

My favorites are the dynamite roll and sweet mango roll. Fried calamari and vegetable tempura are also great.

They also have amazing bubble tea... i always get the taro with tapioca pearl and it's amazing

Went here on a Tuesday night with a group of about 12 people. The location is great considering that it shares the parking lot with Payless and other businesses in the area. The restaurant is much bigger than I expected with ample seating space. It wasn't very busy. I had made reservations for this place since I had a big group and they offered us the private room in the back, which is also their karaoke room. I was a bit concerned about a karaoke room in a restaurant, but they assured me that it won't disturb  the other customers. The private room was a big booth, essentially with a TV, speakers, mics and disco lights which doubled up as a private eating space. 

The service was nice. As soon as I entered the room (I was the first person there), the manager came by to introduce himself and give me a lay of the land. He also offered to help me with any requests that I had. Service was prompt.

I got the spicy miso soup with pork. Usually, I gravitate to good sushi and try to stay away from the pork dishes, but I had heard good things about their ramen and wanted to give it a shot. I was very impressed with their ramen. The spiciness was just the right amount of spicy, and the ramen was very flavorful. The meat was cooked beautifully and the egg was made to perfection. A couple of my friends got the same dish and it seemed that the dish was consistent across the board. Prices were decent. For Lafayette, I was very impressed with the whole package. I will definitely be back and maybe next time, try out the karaoke. 

Verdict: Get their ramen.

reviews.text:
Sadly, Kibu Cafe is now gone. Kibu was my favorite place in town for Korean dishes and I miss the sweet little lady who always took our orders... It was bittersweet to hear that this new Korean restaurant opened up in the exact same location, but I'm glad I tried this place out anyways because everything was SO DELICIOUS. I was the only customer there because Purdue was on winter break, but I'm curious to know how busy this place is going to be during the school year. (Let's hope they do reservations)

Ordered the Dol Sot Bibimbap (rice, meat, veggie & egg in a stone bowl) and LA Galbi (beef short rib with bones), and they were both perfect. And yes, they serve Banchan (medley of tiny side dishes). Their seaweed soup was also very flavorful and delicious.

Can't wait to come back and try the Hae Mul Pa Jeon (seafood savory pancake), Bul Go Gi (marinated beef) and grilled pork belly because those are also staples! The interior was also remodeled and has that cozy-yet-chic farmhouse feel. The servers were very polite and attentive, and I enjoyed listening to K-Pop while I basically inhaled my meal. SO GOOD.
The food was great! There wasn't too many choices though. Worth to try. Will definitely go agai
So tasty!! I think this is my favorite korean place in town. I got the beef fried rice and the beef + onion combo was so flavorful! The beef was also the thinner, fattier type which I LOVE.
Damso is the best Korean restaurant in campus. I loved Galbitang, jeyukbokkeum, and  jju kkumi bokkeum. It was very tasty. When I visit the campus I always  go here for korean food.

Came here thinking it was still Kibu. Surprised that this business has not changed their sign outside.  Ordered the sulung tang and kalbi tang.  The kalbitang was ok.  The sulung tang had little to no meat.  My friend politely complained about his two tablespoons of meat.  The server told the owner.  The owner sent the server back with this reply. " I put enough meat in the soup, tell him to fish around for the meat".  My friend then FISHES out all the meat and shows there is only two tablespoons worth.  I've never heard a reply like that before.  The two soups were 15 dollars each.  Not a good value.  Will not be coming back. If you do go, don't order the sulung tang.  Maybe ask to see the owner and be nice? Hope this helps.

reviews.text:
Stopped here for lunch today. Very friendly staff and wonderful Bahn Mi sandwiches!!! I'm not normally a tea drinker, but their unsweetened iced tea has me rethinking that. Their jasmine tea is brewed perfectly. 
Stop in for great food, great service, and support a deserving locally owned business.
You can still dine in with social distancing, this is one of the best restaurants on the east side, their fried rice is flavorful and fresh. Their bubble milk tea was delicious as well

I couldn't pass up stopping here for lunch, being the sucker for sandwiches that I am.
Due to COVID 19 the shop uses their front window for placing and picking up orders which is pretty convenient. I ordered Thai iced tea, a side of fried tofu, and a tofu sandwich with mayo. 
Once my order was placed I waited outside for about 15 minutes - next time I'll order through the YELP app so I dont have to wait. They have a black bench to sit on but no outdoor seating to eat at.
My takeout food came in a nice little brown paper bag and the thai tea had a boba tea lid which made carrying everything so much easier. 
The thai tea was not very sweet. However, what it lacked in sweetness it made up for in creaminess - over all, very yummy. 
The sandwich was soooo good! It's a big sandwich for $7! The bread was toasted, tofu crispy, cilantro gave it a burst of flavor and freshness, and the pickled vegetables brought it all home with just enough acidity to rock your socks off. 
And last but not least was the fried tofu side. So perfectly crispy and the sauce gave it a wonderful tangy flavor. 
Overall I highly recommend this place. Order ahead so you dont have to wait, but even if you have to wait its really worth it.

Like this place so much! Their pho soup is the best around Purdue. The location is little bit far for students, but a descent driving distance. The use Yelp to take out making it more convenient during this pandemic.
Friendly staff and excellent food. Ingredients taste fresh and have lots of flavor. Orders have always been on time.

The atmosphere is nice & clean. 

I ordered the classic and, although I was the only customer, waited 10+ minutes. The taste reminded me of Vietnamese but did not contain the depth of flavor and freshness I've had before. I was disappointed.
Update: their pho is phenomenal!!! I love ordering it with their bahn mi sandwiches! This is my new favorite spot for pho.

I'm from the SF Bay Area and grew up eating yummy pho and banh mi from restaurants out there. I definitely miss it since I don't live there anymore and was so glad to see Lafayette had a place that serves up both. This was my first time ordering here. I got the marinated pork sandwich for pick up. I loved it right away. The first bite alone was full of flavor! 

I think I'd give it five stars if the meat was just a little more savory, there was a little more filling, and if the bread was fresher (felt a little stale). 

All in all, a super satisfying 7 dollar sandwich! I'm definitely coming back to order pho and more sandwiches!

This building has been empty for a long time, and I was so excited when I saw that this restaurant was going in. I finally stopped by and ordered a couple banh mi's to go. I got the classic for my son, and the marinated pork for me. The sandwiches were larger than I thought they would be (very filling), and a great value for the price. There was plenty of meat and vegetables on them, and the baguette was perfect. The marinated pork was so good, the flavor reminded me of my favorite noodle bowl I get at Green Leaf (their sister restaurant).

The interior is very clean and modern, and larger that it looks on the outside. The parking lot is small, but there is plenty of street parking on Owen Street.
This is one of my favorite spots in Lafayette. Food is delicious and fresh. Ordering is quick and easy.
Food is really really good!  I love trying new things here, no actual disappointments yet!  Had some delivered to work.... everything was correct and was a fun change for my coworkers and i!!!
Best vietnamese food I've ever had. The marinated pork banh mi is incredible and so are all of the phos. Fast good service, well priced, and delicious.

We're vegetarians so we got the tofu sandwich and tofu with rice. We also got some veggie dumplings as an appetizer. Everything was delicious. There aren't many places here in town that can get this crispy tofu texture right. The rice had so much flavor on its own but is also delicious when topped with this spectacular sauce it's served with. We'll definitely go back again.
Amazing service great food. I'm a college student and it's just affordable and delicious and filling 10/10

Everything is so deliciously fresh here. I got the crispy tofu rice noodles yesterday and had to get it again today. This, the tofu banh mi, and tofu dumplings are all vegetarian (not sure 'bout vegan). The banh mi is also great and if you get it to go make sure to get a side of hoison sauce. Try the yogurt for dessert!

Ordered an assortment of sandwiches and a rice bowl to go.  Friendly, fast service and the food is amazing!  This place is a true hidden gem!
The marinated pork sandwich was my family's favorite, followed by the chicken.

I had been waiting for Lafayette to have a Banh Mi shop and my wish has finally been granted. 

I've been here twice now, and I have tried the classic and the chicken banh mi. Both of them were delicious. A little Sriracha went a long way to add flavor. I will definitely keep visiting!

This review is mostly for the banh mi, because that was the only item I ordered personally, but I have to comment on the nuoc cham because I tried some! Got the classic /dac biet combo banh mi. I didn't try the meats individually (should have!), but I liked the savoriness and how they tasted. Pickled carrots and radish were a little on the sweet side, but I liked how they were cut (not too thick nor thin), liked how they gave a generous portion of the pickles, and that they used English cucumbers for an actual crunch, and that jalapenos were not omitted! I really enjoyed the shattering and flaky crust on the bread, and that it wasn't TOO crusty or hard to cut the soft palette or to be semi-compressed (in order to eat all components in one bite). My friend got the fried tofu, which she loved, but I tried some of her nuoc cham with some of the tomatoes/cucumbers that came with it, and encouraged her to try some on her rice! She didn't like the nuoc cham, and I was disappointed that it was overwhelmingly fishy and sweet, almost like it was missing the lime juice to balance it out, because I have fond memories of almost drowning my broken rice in nuoc cham. Most definitely will be back for the banh mi, but would wait to order any rice dish because of the off-putting nuoc cham!

The above review was written 3 months ago, after my first visit to BMEatery. 
My 4 star rating that I posted on google is now docked to a 3.5 (but I will round to 4)- had the combo banh mi again today, but also tried the marinated pork to see how their version tastes. It was so sweet that I actually dribbled fish sauce on the pork every 2-3 bites to balance out the sweetness. I could mostly only taste the sugar, and a tiny bit of lemongrass when I bit into a minced piece. Would not recommend the marinated pork for this reason, and also would hesitate further due to the small amount, because the pork didn't appear until several bites of just bread+pickled carrots+radish. 
I noticed that this time they used non-English cucumbers, and all 3 of our sandwiches only had one piece of cucumber about 4 inches long and about 1/2 inch wide :(
Classic sandwich is one of the best I've had and at a really good price ($6!). The Signature Pho was also great.

I've heard a lot of good things about banh mi and living here haven't had a chance to see what all the fuss was about. Thankfully Banh Mi now exists and wow, they are delicious. Even better than the hype. I shared a marinated pork and a classic sandwich. Good meats, fresh toppings, daikon, jalapeno, cilantro..just tons of flavor.

Small menu, Sandwiches are $6, sides are a few bucks. Several tea-like drinks on menu. 

The restaurant is on 4th st away from downtown. Pretty odd place for a restaurant like this. Clean and trendy and bright on the inside. Parking lot is terrible so park on the street if you can...or back in. Otherwise you could be waiting a while to get out of the lot.

reviews.text: Located just down the hill from the Purdue campus, this is quite simply the place everyone goes before and after games. Locally owned, Bruno's is a beloved and iconic pizza place for those who live nearby as well as those who have driven many miles to return to campus. Everything on the menu is good and the service is excellent, even when the place is completely full. They make the pizzas behind a glass window right next to the front door as you enter. Parking can be an issue, but there is a constant turn over. Be patient for a few minutes and someone will be leaving shortly. You can call ahead to reserve a table and of course, there is carry out as well.

Bruno's is absolutely delicious! And I love their family atmosphere and how friendly the entire staff is. It's very much a family business and they care about their customers. I've gone here pre-COVID-19, but this review is in regards to their current take-out. The quality and service did not falter by any means. The pizza was ready and hot to take home and everything was nicely packed. There were many people on staff and everything seemed working like a machine, organized and quick. So many moving hands knowing what to do, working diligently and fast. They were very happy to see us and grateful for our loyalty. Their pizza was fresh, super filling, and extra cheese? Yeah, it really means extra cheese and we were very thankful for it!

I've been coming to Bruno's for the majority of my life as a Purdue fan and now as a student. It is the best pizza in West Lafayette, and I don't think it's a close competition. Bruno's is a true family business, and the standards have never once changed. While I have never tried any of their pasta dishes, I have no reason to believe they aren't fantastic. The pizzas are always great. Even with COVID-19 limiting the business to carry-out only, I have never had a bad pizza from Bruno's. The inside of the restaurant is a must-see for Purdue fans. Big O's collection of Purdue memorabilia is truly special. I look forward to the day when I can dine-in again!

Got a pizza to go... although I didn't get a chance to eat in, I did go in and check out the inside bit, and I have to say - this is a really cute restaurant! It was packed on a Friday night, and I loved the dim lighting and casual feel of the place. The gentleman who served us was very friendly and polite, despite the rush hour.

In terms of the pizza... I got the Bruno's veggie with jalapeños as extra topping (14 inch, came to approx $20). To be honest, I was quite disappointed. They definitely like their cheese, which I'm a big fan of, but it looked like the cheese had been poured over the toppings, so the toppings were quite soggy under all of that melted goo. The crust and base were not impressive and were a little harder than I'd like. 

I might go back to try a non-veg pizza, but if you're a vegetarian looking for a good veggie pizza, I can't recommend Bruno's.

Bruno's is a West Lafayette institution, famous for scissor-cut pizza, Big O's sports memorabilia, and fried dough balls covered in garlic butter and Parmesan. Generations of Boilermaker faithful love this place, and I suspect generations more will too, but not me. I've had enough. 

The pizza ingredients are good, but I prefer mine fully baked, thank you. There's not a square inch of browned cheese in sight at Bruno's. Melted, yes, for the most part. Browned? Ah, no. The restaurant has a very loud sports-themed dining room, covered in sports memorabilia. At full capacity, this room is a claustrophobic cacophony of screaming kids, ESPN, and birthday parties. The Swiss room plays homage to the original Bruno location across State Street, which had a Swiss chalet feel. Chalk that location up to progress and new roads. There's a bar room in the back. 

The best thing on the menu - an antipasto meat and cheese plate - is no more. The final straw was when we were refused a take out cup for WATER. Classic. We got the Heisman on grandma's request for a cup of water for the road. Two pizzas, two sodas, all for $45, mediocre service for free. Sorry Boiler Nation, I won't return to Bruno's. Overrated and overpriced.

Heart eyes all around!! My in-laws treated my husband and I to pizza and Bruno dough on our most recent excursion to Lafayette. I've heard about this place for so long and was not disappointed once I got tri it! From the crispy fried Bruno dough to their loaded pizzas, we left with full tummies and full hearts. 

Be sure to check out all their extensive Purdue memorabilia- it pays homage to all the best Boliermakers.

Drew Brees No Cheese! More meat than a cattle ranch. 

Our server was super friendly. The dough balls are a must too.

If you like Drew Brees like I do, there is a ginormous bobble head Brees to take a photo with. Lots of TVs for football. Enough Purdue memorabilia to be a museum. 

Must stop while in town.

Too bad Brunos felt the need to go to a new model of private events.  We used to hit Brunos every time we were in Lafayette.  Can't do that anymore.  They are open only to private parties.  I live too far away to do a takeout.  Maybe they'll have a change of heart and open up the dining rooms eventually.
Absolutely fantastic. Cannot come back to Lafayette without going to Bruno's. I was great to see Orlando, Bruno and they're fantastic staff.

GO NEXT DOOR TO PUCCINO'S YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED !!!!!

You won't get the history that Bruno's has but will get a much better Pizza

Worst experience I've had here and will not be coming back.

Got the crustless pizza and was cheese only, no more than 8oz of cheese and some  sauce, $14.95 which is more than a large cheese pizza with crust and twice as much cheese and sauce WOW!!!! 

I don't mind paying but Unbelievable that they feel comfortable charging this much for just cheese and sauce.
Get the Bruno dough, you will not regret it. Bruno's is excellent pizza, great service if you choose to dine-in, it's an excellent place to enjoy pizza and watch Purdue play.

Boiler Up! This place is fun and full of Purdue school spirit. We took the fam here for a Friday night trip to town and we loved it. My wife and I used to eat here when we were at Purdue and it just gets better with time. Must get Bruno Dough!! Pick a pizza any pizza and grab a beer. Enjoy!

This was a favorite restaurant of my husband during his time at Purdue several years ago. After a few visits on our own, and now with kiddos, it is one of my favorites as well! At first glance one could think their menu is what you'd expect to see at a standard pizza joint - but upon closer glance you'll find some really unique menu items: Apple butter & PB dipping sauce for the Bruno Dough on the kids menu, chicken livers on the spaghetti a la caruso, and even a cheese and peanut butter pizza!

My favorite bits about Bruno's:
-Memorabilia everywhere - all signed with the owner, Orlando's name! It is clear that he is well-loved. And, my toddler LOVES to explore the restaurant to check it all out. 
-The bruno dough - basically donuts made of pizza dough (8 per order). We get it with the meat sauce, which is also the same meat sauce used in the pasta dishes. It is outstanding.
-They're kid friendly - meaning they've got a kids menu with decent portions of real food, they serve milk, they provide crayons and paper, and they have slings and booster seats available.
-The house salad reminds me of the mixed vegetable salads from my time studying in Germany. It comes with radishes, egg, chopped beets, shredded carrots, and more. Yum. :)

My only beef with Bruno's is that the tap water tastes a little bit off. I don't know any other way to put it, but if you're between a water and a beer, get a beer. ;)
Service was nice. Pizza was undercooked but the more I saw other pizzas and photos, maybe that is how they cook their crust. Sauce lacked flavor. No decent wine options.

The pizza is nothing to go crazy about. It's cut really weird so it's hard to eat. The service wasn't bad. Although my side salad looked like it was from an 80's diner, was not good at all. It's just one of those famous purdue sports puds. The atmosphere was cool but other than that it was nothing to rave about.

The cliche family spot for the Purdue student for all the right reasons. Tasty variety of pizzas, nice assorted salads and pastas, and perhaps best of all for the family needs a welcoming and accommodating staff able and eager to handle large groups. For you bored types, the classic peanut butter pizza is a must try. I love about three pieces of it then never think of it again til next time here. Bruno's is the classic dinner joint for making memories and has dished out top service since my first pizza here back in their old building. Five stars for sure!

Another wonderful visit to Bruno's. This is the real deal when it comes to great pizza. We visited here tonight and had our regular order. We had a large pizza with mushroom and pepperoni, Bruno dough, side salads, coffee.  Just amazing tasting meal. This is a neighborhood gem.  Busy place with quality service. Friendly place that has many more menu choices. Brimming with Purdue memorabilia. Television tuned to sports games. Always a festive atmosphere. Bruno's always does it right. Can never wait to return again. Thanks management and staff.

Delicious pizza in a friendly place. I would suggest the bruno doigh as an appetizer. 

 Jeffver and he was friendly and very efficient. 

We'll be back!

After our service tonight, I don't care if I ever visit thus restaurant again.  The pizza we ordered was mixed up for another pizza at our table & when the waiter took our other pizza back because it was missing ONIONS, the kitchen staff (pizza maker) simply threw a hand full of RAW ONIONS on the pizza & then sent it back to our table.  What's wrong with this is so many things... 1) it took about 10 minutes & by the time the waiter returned, the pizza wasn't even close to being warm...let alone, hot. 2) as stated before, they simply threw a bunch of RAW ONIONS on it & sent it back out to us. 3) when I tried to explain to the waiter/kitchen pizza maker person, he was totally rude about it & 4) the dough wasn't cooked through.  

I have to say, that I realize in a college town, my lonely review is probably the least of their concern, but...they need to STOP & think that they need to try a little harder and mak e the dining experience for people who drove 45 minutes to get there a little better.
Good pizza, neat old sports decor. I've only had pizza. Try the apple butter pizza! Also, Bruno dough is a must try!!!

reviews.text: We enjoyed a wonderful takeout dining experience this evening and will look forward to dining in once restaurants are once again open. The chef competed on masterchef and the food is most certainly evidence of why he was selected as a competitor. Incredibly well balanced flavors, creative construction, and well executed food made for a fantastic dining experience. The portions are extremely generous given the quality and intensity of flavor. Highly highly recommended!
This place is available on Chowbus as "Master Chef" making a large range of foods, from paella to katsudon. They also serve the best Una dish around campus.

I have traveled a lot for work on expense accounts and I haven't been able to find many restaurants worth going to around here, so I generally don't eat out. I was really impressed with Bowen Bistro's quality of ingredients for the price.

I know there are some not great reviews, but I think when you go, you need to take your server's recommendations. We ordered an appetizer and asked her if it was good, and she said it was ok. She was right, it was just ok. However, we ordered her two favorite dishes, the crispy skin salmon and the aged NY strip, and they were DELICIOUS. You would pay about 30% more for the same quality of ingredients elsewhere. The crispy skin salmon is one of the best things I have eaten at any restaurant ever including restaurants in Chicago, San Francisco, NYC, New Orleans, etc. The mashed potatoes are so good we ordered an extra side.

We will definitely be back. Oh my goodness, and the bourbon cake and tiramisu are incredible. I was surprised they were handmade. I can't wait to go back and try the duck, and of course, get the perfect crispy salmon again!

My partner and I went to Bowen's for lunch and had a GREAT experience. It was a creative, fun lunch menu that pokes into high-end cuisine. We started with an appetizer of the Ahi Poke, which was a really flavorful bite before digging into our main dishes. For our mains, I had the Unadon, which was really tasty, but also really beautifully prepared as you can see in the photo. My partner had the Wagyu Gyudon which was a really warm, comforting dish. 

One of the best moments of our experience was Bowen's pleas to try the marble soda. I had never heard of it, so I was kind of reluctant to try it. But Bowen was so excited and proud about serving the "good stuff" and brought out a bottle to kind of show us what it was all about. We got a bottle and it was certainly worth it. If you go, you really do have to try it. 

At the end of the day, you can really feel Bowen's heart in the food and the experience. It was the highlight of our day.

I was so hungry I forgot to take a photo before I began! Amazing food, best scallops I've ever had, and a unique experience. Bowen is an amazing chef and this is one of a kind menu. This was their 28 day dried New York Strip!

Identity crisis. 

Bowen Bistro has a bit of an identify crisis. I get the Asian fusion thing, but there are also standouts on the menu that seem way out of place (New Orleans salmon, Spaghetti and meatballs). 

Upon entering, there is a marquee that says "Fine Dining"; however places that are actually fine dining, don't need to announce it. On the table, the salt and pepper are cradled in a kitschy chef character. Not a problem, but not fine dining.  

There is a section called crepe omelets, I asked what makes them crepe and the server said, they are just omelets. No problem, but why include "crepe" in the name. 

I had the wagyu omelet ($16), it was really tasty. Their dishes are stand alone, which I am fine with, but there are no al a carte sides that you can order. 

Bowen (the chef/owner) came out to greet us, which is a nice touch. He's a young guy and really nice! I hope he can lose the seriousness of the restaurant and just make it young and fun like him! Lean into the kitsch!
Loved the food!  It really was amazing.  The only issue was that it still looks so much like Starbucks.  The interior really needs a makeover to get rid of that feel.  Nice job on the food!

Food quality very good
Ambience very good soft jazz...lighting...decor a 10
Service superb
Price....too high for area and portions
Dessert was not up to par....looked like store bought...not made there.

Very disappointed! For a restaurant that has a "Chef" who doesn't even know how to cook for people with food allergies! He doesn't even know what his ingredients contain! This place will send someone to the hospital soon enough. I'm just very shocked and disappointed.

Bowen, it was a pleasure last night when we ate dinner at Bowen Bistro. My kids were so excited to meet you and dine at your place, especially after watching you and cheering you on as a local celebrity chef. With much anticipation, you did not disappoint!  We ate the Surf and Turf with Filet Mignon and Shrimp, Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes with Multi Vegetable Purée that looked like a rainbow on our plates.  In addition, the desserts are sumptuous and not to be missed either; we each ordered a different one!  I'm also looking forward to you having your liquor license next week so I can have a glass of wine with dinner. We look forward to many future visits!

The best fine dining fusion restaurant ! The NY strip was cooked perfectly medium rare and the desserts are the bomb! I felt lucky to meet celebrity chef Bowen at the end! Definitely gonna come back! Highly recommend!!!!!

The apps were really good, but it seemed a little weird that each app came out individually, as we shared them it wasn't a problem. But then there was a 30 minute wait until the entrees came. And again, each came out individually. My son was done his meal before mine came out, and then I was almost finished before the next 2 meals came out. And some of the food was cold while others were hot. The food was actually good, but the kitchen needs a lot of work to run smoothly. Not an enjoyable experience.

I have been to Bowen Bistro twice (one lunch and one dinner). The food was very good both times. The Hawaiian Avocado Tartare was creative and refreshing;  the Sukiyaki Wagyu Gyudon was an ultimate comfort food on a cold day; the Truffle Four-Cheese Ravioli was creamy and tasty. The service was okay, but some things remain to be worked out. Don't tell a table you can't do something "because you expect so many more people to come" (they never did show up).  Unfortunately, it is right now not a restaurant I plan to take visitors to (given the prices, it needs Purdue visitor business). The setup with two unprotected doors that let cold air in, the lighted billboard over the bar,  windows all around with most of them looking at a gas station and people pressing their noses against the glass, make the environment uninviting. Some of these issues can be addressed and hopefully they will.

I love their dessert soooooooooooooooo
 Much.
The service is sooooooooo good!
The environment of the restaurant is sooooooo good!

I dined at Bowen Bistro today for lunch and my experience was considerably better than these other reviews. I had the sukiyaki wagyu dish which had amazing flavors and presentation. We shared the truffle waffle fries with garlic aioli appetizer and all members of my family loved it. My daughter had the chicken Marsala. She loved it; it came with a delicious side of buttermilk mashed potatoes and puréed cauliflower (which he made on one of the Master Chef episodes last year as well). My wife had a zucchini pasta dish that was light and tasty. We all shared two of the desserts ( Black Truffle Hazelnut Mousse Cake and Red Velvet Mousse Cake) which were very good but less amazing than the entrees. Reasonably priced for the high quality.

We ate there last night with another couple. The experience was great the food was outstanding and I highly recommend giving them a try. The only downside was the wine selection was a little bit small but it was made up with the quality of food. The pricing was great and again the overall experience was outstanding

This is very cool and upscale fine dining restaurant! We ordered the filet mignon and shrimp ceviche it was more than amazing! If you are looking for a new experience Bowen bistro will be your first choice! The celebrity chef Bowen is a very creative and nice guy! We will be back!

Just had dinner here tonight -- the waitresses did a good job and were very nice; however, the food and wait time was unsatisfactory. The Gyoza was good; but, when it came to our entrees, there was a lot left to be desired. The chicken in the omelette and wrap tasted extremely processed (like McDonald's consistency). The salmon and the shrimp that accompanied it, were both undercooked and under-seasoned. Additionally, the dishes were served one at a time with a 20-minute lag between the first and last dish -- resulting in the initial dishes being cold. Dishes were overpriced given the quality of food. We had high expectations; hopefully they can turn things around quickly.

This is a new, locally owned restaurant started by a young, but very talented chef. I had the truffle ravioli and lobster bisque and both were fantastic. Came here with a big group and we all loved the dishes we ordered. Some aspects, like the decor would make me question if I would consider it fine dining, but the food lived up to it. The service was fantastic. The chef came out and introduced himself and shared his remarkable story. He makes you want to see this place succeed. I would highly recommend!!

This restaurant needs some time to get up and running. It took 40 min just to get our appetizers. After waiting longer we finally asked about when our main courses would be ready. They had not even started them yet! They also can't serve alcohol yet. I may try the place again in a few months. But, right now I would not go back.
