reviews.text: My daughter and I had Brunch here for the first time. Seated quickly.  Seats were well spaced.Very nice atmosphere.  Noted that someone was consistently cleaning and spraying tables and seats. Daughter ordered French toast with strawberries on the side, . I ordered big breakfast included scrambled eggs , hash browns, bacon, toast. We cross shared our orders. I ordered coffee it was strong but I did enjoy it. Just what I needed to wake up.The waitress saw we were sharing and brought extra plates. She went above and beyond. Will definitely eat here again.

One of the best West Lafayette dining options serving all day breakfast on a huge menu, wonderful value, enticing options with Mediterranean flair and popular American grill eats, friendly staff, and classically modern atmosphere. Us eight hungry guys dropped in a bit late, were reminded we needed to order as they closed at 9:00, still managed a great time with all of our picks finding the pasta almost hilariously piled high, burgers actually two hands, and I went for the hero quesadilla appetizer thinking my two tacos would be the usual tiny amount of food. But happily my two shells were stuffed full of Chipotle sauce ripe for a filling meal. These local family restaurants can easily be overlooked due to popular chains offering predictable menus but I am very thankful to recommend Christos as well and above all the usual national restaurants in the area for value, variety, and an overall excellent time despite an early closing time.

Not the best wine selection in town, but absolutely the best gyros in all the land!

This is a full service restaurant, but I only have eyes for the gyros.

Ambiance is cool & chic; the gyros will keep you from having to run back to Chicago every time the craving strikes.

Worth a trip! I recommend you see what else they have besides gyros, but as for me, I have an addiction to feed...

I've been here several times over the years. Christos is never a first choice destination for me, but if someone else suggests it, I'm fine going along. At three stars, "A-OK" is a positive and acceptable rating. So go visit for any meal of the day and enjoy, chances are highly likely you'll have good food and catch good vibes from the pies and ambiance. Christos has a "we're a small restaurant group but we're not really a chain" independent feel.

I think it's annoyingly loud in this restaurant, depending on where you are seated. I was in a booth near the back last time and it was fine, until others were seated around us. At that point it felt like we were inside of a megaphone. So is it bad acoustics or do I just get seated near loud talkers all the time, or do I have sensory overload disorder? Not sure. The service was good. My gluten-free friend really enjoyed the bunless burger, which was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. I found the fish tacos OK but not stellar. The fries were done but were almost colorless; another 30-60 seconds in the fryer would've crisped them up.

I've been here several times so I won't rate Christos on today's visit only.  Christos has a large facility that moves a lot of customers quickly.  The staff is always professional and friendly.  The facilities are clean while bring a bit dated.

Christos has a large menu which gives all you discriminating diners choices.  That's one of their assets.  All items are good.  Breakfast is a good choice.

Today I had the Ranchers Breakfast.  The eggs were eggs while the bacon was slightly crisp and soft.  Both are typically of breakfast diners.  My choice came with sausage gravy and biscuits.  The biscuit was served as a whole biscuit - most serve cut in half.  The gravy was poured over the top so you really couldn't the biscuit open.  The biscuit was slightly dry.  The gravy was salty and had very little sausage accent.  Overall the gravy was rather bland.

I've done take out and dined in.  

Did a take out in the weekend for lunch and cake in for breakfast on the weekend as well.

This place is always busy and packed with people and I now know why.

Portions are generous service is fast the pace is clean and the building is conveniently located on sagamore.

I will continue to come back and try more of the menu and those delish pies!

The ambiance is classic diner nothing fancy or over the top but this location is fairly new and the condition o the furniture and flooring etc is good.

Christos is a great choice when everyone wants to eat something different. They have a good variety of menu items, and breakfast is available all day.

I almost always order the Gyro Breakfast Skillet. It's basically a deconstructed gyro on a bed of potatoes and topped with two eggs. It's a very filling meal and great any time of the day! My son tried out their Chorizo Burger. It was so large that he had a hard time fitting it into his mouth. He ordered chicken noodle soup as his side, and the rest of the table wished they had ordered some.

Our server was very friendly and upbeat, stopping by many times to make sure we had everything we needed. 

They have a tempting selection of desserts in the front case, but we are always too full to try any. 

Christos is always a solid choice, anytime of the day.

What a great restaurant. Had the gyro quesadilla which was so delicious, we considered ordering another one before the meal. BBQ chicken salad and chicken souvlaki were outstanding. Had carrot cake and cheesecake which were both melt in your mouth delicious. Definitely recommend. Ask for Manolli....he is super friendly.

Been here an hour still no food .... this is a false wait because tables were open  so apparently someone didn't staff apparently I was told that the kitchen was backed up so guess what We can see you are under staffed  or didn't plan .

We come to this family-owned place often because customer service is best in town as well as the food.  Their weekend menu offers a bbq pork skillet i quite like, 4 dollar mimosas, and excellent potatoes and french toast.  We have a baby and they always help us with that, which we really appreciate.

I have been going here for many years. Always good food and service.  My favorite has to be the breakfast food.  I like the Tex Mex omelette. Hash browns are crispy and good as well.  However, their menu is very diverse and has lots of options.  I would recommend going early on the weekends as it does get very busy.

This is hands down my favorite, go-to restaurant in West Lafayette. I lived nearby for years before finally trying it once and now I go there pretty much weekly. It's got a great casual but nice atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff, and is always clean and efficiently run. It's great at any time of day and they serve breakfast all day. Favorites include the rancher's breakfast, triple double, the turkey club, their fries and their mashed potatoes. Taco salad ("broken taco") is also pretty excellent. Give it a chance and Christos can be your Sunday "I woke up at noon" brunch spot, your Monday "I'm too tired to cook" spot, and more. Last but not least, try the pie.

Bacon smelled and tasted terrible, blueberry pancakes were gross, and the hashbrowns were the absolute fucking worst... greasy and had a nasty buttery taste but everything was bland overall! So disappointed. Won't be back here again.

What the heck!  The food was cold.  When we mentioned it, they took it back and microwaved it.  I have never been to any restaurant where all of the food came cold.  Then microwaving.....  We could have made better food at home.  I just couldn't believe it!  I felt responsible for everyone's poor meal, too, since I was the one that suggested the restaurant.

Christos never disappoints. It's nice to have a family owned establishment that updates its menu and appreciates their customers.  Enjoyed the  mimosas with our French Double Double and Freddy the Butcher brunch last weekend. Thank you!

I visit this restaurant (either the one in Lafayette or West Lafayette) every couple of months. It has such a diverse menu there's always something for everyone's flavor. The service and food are always consistently good. I don't think I've really ever had a meal I haven't liked. I would definitely recommend it - for couples, families, or large groups.

I love this place!!! This is my first time going and the pancakes are phenomenal. I also am a huge fan of oatmeal and tend to be harsh in my judgings of it but the oatmeal here was so good that I got a container for my left over oatmeal. With that in mind I do think that it needs to have different sizes for its oatmeal. This is with added milk, cinnamon and sugar, and cranberries. It had a nice consistency and it didn't feel as though it was over or undercooked. You could also choose to add pecans but I left those out. So I definitely recommend this place if not for their pancakes, for their Oatmeal

Checked this place out for dinner based on the positive reviews. We had great service - thank you Emma - and the food was very good. We had the chicken fried chicken and the pork grilled cheese. Perfectly cooked chicken, great waffle fries. Will definitely go again!

The West Side Christos has become one of my favorite restaurants in the Greater Lafayette area.  I'd visited both Christos a few times in the past and thought they were OK, but the last several months I've been really digging this place.  Clean restaurant, fast and friendly service, a diverse menu and generous portions at a fair price.  Pretty much everything I've tried has been solid, but their burgers are my favorite in the area; flame-grilled, big and juicy.  Their gyros are also top notch.  Their Thursday special chimichanga is tasty and a lot of food.  This might be one to share or save the other half for dinner.  I look forward to trying the rest of the menu!
Came in this evening and Kennedy was our sever! Amazing food and service!! Thank you for a great meal out. Full bellies all around.

reviews.text: Man, I dig it.  I used to eat at Sushi Boss in the PMU, but they shut down, which left me longing for custom sushi.  Poke Hibachi hits the spot to me, because really, the sushi wrap is just a container for all the good stuff inside.  They have lots of options (really, the only thing I like that they don't have is cream cheese, but that would probably be weird for a poke bowl, so I'm okay with BYO on that piece). They're quick, COVID-concious, and my tummy is happy.

Located near the Chauncey mall area. Decided to check it out on a lunch break with a coworker. The space decoration of the restaurant is super inviting. However due to covid restrictions they are only taking take out orders. I ordered a medium size bowl which came with 4 proteins. It was plenty of food & even had leftovers. The spicy salmon was definitely my favorite. Check them out !

Easiest to order ahead of time during Covid!

Staff was not inviting or friendly as I ordered from the door. Not sure if concerns with covid have made them hyper or they're typically unwelcoming. When I asked for suggestions, the staff just repeated to "look at the menu". The menu was posted on the door so each time I had a question, I needed to step outside before returning to the doorway to keep ordering. AwkeaI got a medium bowl with poke tuna. It was good, not excellent. $13 seemed pricey for the size.
Deliver was pretty fast and the food was good! Just a bit small portion wise for the price. But overall pretty good!!

A solid spot for poke! The service was fast and nice and I feel like I got exactly what i would expect. The spicy tuna was a bit too spicy for me (needed to drink milk) so I think next time I'm going to go for ahi tuna instead. Very clean restaurant and very good about social distancing

I love poke!  And I really appreciate that this restaurant opened at 10 a.m. so that I could grab a bite to eat at 10:30 without having to kill time waiting around. 

I have had poke at several places around Indy, so I was pleasantly surprised when the regular size bowl was about 2 cups instead of the massive bowls I've had elsewhere.  I had a lot of things to do and didn't need to feel stuffed!  

I didn't see any "pre-conceived" options on the menu board behind the counter, so I just followed the order and direction from the server on building my bowl.  Size then rice type (brown) were followed by protein choice (Ahi Tuna).  After that, they have a no limit choice of add ins and some that were an additional $.50 per selection (avocado and pineapple).  You also get a choice of sauce (Eel) and a couple toppers (lobster salad and shrimp).  I declined adding more toppers since by bowl was already overflowing.

The only negative I see is that when the bowl is filled, it is hard to stir it all up to get a blending of flavors until some of the bowl is consumed.

I also don't know why there have been so many comments about the expense.  If you want fresh food, hand prepared, it will cost more than a burger joint.  And frankly, I found the regular size perfectly fine for lunch (and I had just walked four miles followed by another six that afternoon.)

I really enjoyed my meal and highly recommend it to anyone who wants a healthy and fresh alternative for lunch.

Review #1134

I love love poke! I like that you can choose whatever toppings you like, but I really think it's a hit or miss with which employee you get and how large your portion will be.  Some of the ingredients don't taste as fresh, such as the vegetables or even tuna/salmon, so that's why I give it three stars instead.  It's not terrible, but it's not the best I've had! It definitely fulfills my poke cravings!

I love poke. This place isn't the best but it gets the job done. I got a large bowl with salmon, edamame, cucumbers, seaweed salad, ponzu and spicy mayo, scallions, and tempura topping. 

My first complaint is the rice. It's dry and a little hard. Pretty low quality rice. There was a lot of salmon which is awesome but it had very little texture and flavor. Everything else was generally fine but as those were the main components of my dish, I was a little disappointed. 

I think one of their strong points is that they give a lot of toppings. Because  I did not want too many things on my poke, they actually gave me double scoops of my toppings which I really appreciated.

I was at Purdue for a conference, and stopped in for a quick weekday lunch at Poke Hibachi.  The service is indeed quick -- fast casual, order at the counter style. It's very small inside, so you may not find seating if they're busy. 

My friend and I split a large poke bowl (around $13 including tax and a 50 cent up-charge for adding avocado), and it was enough food for a decent meal for two people, which was a great value.  They sell hibachi (cooked proteins -- mostly meat or fish -- with veggies and rice), as well. You can choose from a variety of raw and cooked seafood proteins, and there's a tofu option for vegans/vegetarians.  The food was fresh and tasted good -- standard tasty poke bowl fare, with lots of good options for sauces and toppings.

The portion was almost too generous for the size of the bowl I had -- I asked for a mix of brown rice and greens as a base, and was given so many greens that the bowl was basically impossible to mix: you need to eat all the good toppings off first, and are then left with plain rice and lettuce at the bottom. I'm not complaining about big portions; it was very generous. But it might be better in a larger bowl.

Speaking of bowls: there's no recycling container (at least as far as I could see), in spite of the fact that all of the bowls used are plastic and presumably recyclable. 

Bonus, though: the chopsticks are smooth and rounded, unlike the rough-edged, stuck together wooden chopsticks most places have.  No splinters here!

The only downfall of this place is small portions. The food was exceptional! I had the regular size poke bowl. It was very small, so next time I will get a large. You have many choices for toppings, but I went with the following, brown rice, carrots, cucumber, micro greens, cabbage, pickled cucumber, avocado, green onion, poke tuna, lobster salad, sweet wasabi and spicy mayo. The flavors were fabulous and on point. Everything worked well together. It was fresh and well worth the $9+ price tag. My only regret is that I didn't get a larger size. Atmosphere was very hip and cool. I will be ba
Besides being incredibly overpriced, this is a great spot to get poké. Lots of options to choose from and it's quick to order

I am from Hawai'i and this is not poke. The texture of the fish was mealy, the spicy ahi resembled no spicy ahi I've ever tasted, and the sauce that that was squirted on it very strongly tasted of lemon. For you haoles who don't know--LEMON DOES NOT GO WITH POKE. 

The rice had a crapload of vinigar on it. Sushi rice has vinigar in it. NOT POKE RICE. AND NOBODY SQUIRTS IT ON TOP THE RICE. 

Also, all the topping and stuff you put on the poke--no one makes poke like that. Just a way to get away with giving you practically no fish. 

I've never been more depressed to be in Indiana.

( Tbh, the lady who served me was nice. I hope they succeed cause the people seem nice. Haoles never gonna know the difference anyway. This review is for da local braddahs and sistahs.)

This place is ridiculously stingy for the price. I paid $18 for the large bowl and the lady that was working gave me the smallest scoops ever. Some scoops weren't even filled up. My bowl was barely halfway full and I'm honestly incredibly disappointed. The bowl itself wasn't very flavorful and the onions and wasabi barely tasted like anything at all. I took one bite of the ginger and immediately noticed a spoiled and rotten taste. I love poke and came to visit from Chicago and did not expect to be ripped off like this. I will make sure to never come back or recommend it to anyone. Potential customers beware, your money is far better off at a different poke restaurant.
Love this place, tons of choices, amazing staff, cozy place and so delicious, a little pricey but worth it, we went on a sat and got the deal bogo. Can't wait to go back!

Amazing!! Wish I would've tried this place sooner! It's basically a poke-Chipotle. You get to choose all the toppings of your poke bowl, with at least 2 choices of meat (for the regular bowl). As expected, the price is a little steep, so I wouldn't come in regularly, but definitely a nice treat after a rough week :) only complaint is that they have no/minimal temperature control so we were uncomfortable from the heat.

Poke is one of my favorite foods so I was super excited to see a place open up near campus.  I find the large poke bowl is a good amount of food.

The fish tastes quite fresh to new and I'm a big fan of both normal tuna and a poke sauce mix tuna.

If you love fresh vegetables and seafood, this is the perfect place where you can enjoy couple different things in one poke with reasonable price. They also offer really good steak or chicken, but it may not be enough meat for meat lovers. The discount is different and surprising everyday. You may be the lucky one 
to get good food with pretty low price!

Fresh and healthy. Absolutely delicious!!! Nice place in Purdue area! I think this is first poke shop in Purdue!

Also a lot of toppings to choose and they are updating very often.

Food quality was excellent and I really liked the interior. Cozy, neat place. The small bowl seemed a little too light. Large bowl is the way to go if you plan on this being your whole meal. With large bowl there is the choice of two proteins. I got the poke salmon and baby octopus. Both were excellent. Also loved the seaweed salad add-on. Avocado is also a must-add-on.

They had a lot of toppings to choose from. I would love to eat here again. Only negative is it's not cheap, but you get what you pay for.

We've visited two days in a row and we satisfied each time. The first day my kid ordered the steak hibachi and the second day she ordered a Poke' bowl. She thought both were good but preferred the Poke bowl. The large bowl is 11.99 and you get a choice of three proteins and many other toppings.  Some of the toppings are an extra .50, like the seaweed salad, mango caviar, etc. overall we paid 28. and some cents for 2 large Poke bowls with 4 add/owns.

reviews.text: Husband ran in for pick up so I don't know what it's like inside, but as far as the food: Loved it! Everything felt so fresh and loved how it wasn't greasy at all. So yummy! Got the grilled steak burrito enchilada style and chicken salad. Guac was good too. Will be back!!

My boyfriend introduced me to this place once they opened back up after Covid shut down and let me tell you, SO GOOD! Their burritos and queso are addicting! I have only ever ordered to go, but the staff is always super friendly. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good meal.

The food is amazing! We usually get it once a week if we can. Couple that with the kindness the owners show, they are out there making the food, and they are very friendly. 

I usually get a barbacoa burrito with all the fixings and I barely need dinner afterwards. Even their vegetarian options are delicious!
Outstanding local burrito shop. Homemade tortillas and sauces. Would recommend their pork with Spivey sauce. I get the salad and it's one of my favorite meals on campus. Simple and good.
This place is the best! A must visit every time I am back in West Lafayette. The tortillas are incredible and fresh made.

My all-time favorite restaurant in West Lafayette!! A chill and comfortable atmosphere to catch up with friends! The cheese quesadilla is delicious even with nothing else on it. Try with a side of rice, mild salsa, and guac

I've been coming to this restaurant for years and have loved it every single time.  Try out a burrito with enchilada style!  They take a freshly made tortilla and stuff it full of a meat of your choice and any toppings that you want, then cover it in sauce.  I get this every time I come, and I've probably eaten here more than 100 times.  I've tried every meat selection for the burrito and they all taste good.  It's a testament to the quality that I've been to this restaurant so many times and have never once had a bad experience.

Also, yes, it is indeed a Mexican restaurant that is owned and operated by a Chinese family.  The food tastes great though!

The tortillas here are the closest that I've found to the ones at Cafe Rio. They are delicious! If they sold them separately, I would get a dozen to take home. (Hey, Fiesta Mexican Grill: You all should totally consider selling your tortillas a la carte!) 

In fact, my whole pork barbacoa burrito tasted quite a lot like the pork barbacoa burritos from Cafe Rio. So, if you're looking for a Cafe Rio substitute, this Mexican restaurant might fit the bill. 

The rice here is not my favorite, but it's not NOT good -- it just tastes like instant rice. They only have one type of rice option here (cilantro lime), but I wish they would consider also offering Mexican rice. 

The ordering system is set up like Chipotle, in that you tell them what you want (burrito, tacos, nachos or quesadilla), and then you can customize it however you want. Protein offered is shredded chicken, shredded beef, pork barbacoa, grilled chicken and grilled steak. You can also get your meal vegetarian (which does not come with a protein). 

Because this restaurant is located near Purdue University, it can get pretty busy with students filtering in and out. Also, there isn't much parking on the street. We ended up parking in the parking garage located across the street from the restaurant.

Oh my gosh the other reviews were absolutely right! I LOVE THE TORTILLAS! I've been here quite a few times. My go to is the salad. The portion is very generous! I always get steak. The meat is seasoned well and cooked to perfection. I would say this is a step above chipotle in my opinion! Not super authentic but still amazing. This is my favorite spot for lunch!

Good price.  Good food.  Friendly service.  Stopped by for a quick lunch.  Tortilla was fluffy and tasty.  Enchilada style burritoes were food and allowed us to eat civilized using fork and knife.  Sauces can be bit less salty for my taste but I guess they are typical level of salt.  We chose this place over Chipotle and we were glad (not to say Chipotle is bad).

The place was pretty dark and I personally did't really enjoy eating in the place. The food was okay and I always ordered the quesadilla with double steak on. I would pick a side of lettuce and sour cream. The lettuce was optional depending on if it is e-coli season or not. But overall, it is a decent place in Purdue area.

A lot of people love this spot, and I have to admit I don't understand why. I've been here probably 5 times now, and I don't really have any complaints about the food or service, but I also don't understand what makes it so special. Apparently they make their own tortillas, but they don't taste much different to me than the ones at other restaurants in town or even (sorry) at the grocery store. To me, it's very similar in taste (and price) to Chipotle, but I know that's an unpopular opinion locally.

I was disappointed in Fiesta. Maybe I was expecting too much from the high Yelp rating, or was it an off-day for the ingredients? I ordered one of the most popular items, the chicken burrito - enchilada style - with the cheese and sauce on top. To start, Fiesta makes their own tortillas in the store, cooked on a circular flat top. Pretty cool! The ingredients looked fresh, service was fast, and the staff were friendly. I stopped in for an early lunch, and by the time I left the line was 15+ deep. This place obviously has a following. 

The final product looked good but suffered from several problems. First, the tortilla was doughy. I don't know if it was undercooked or too thick, but it was like chewing a mushy washrag. Second, the rice was too wet, soaking the tortilla even more from the inside. Third, the chicken, beans, and rice filling were not hot enough. I ended up discarding the wet tortilla and scooping up the ingredients with my high-priced side order of chips.  I thought the Diet Coke was flat. Overall 2.5 stars.

What are best in class items here? If they can get the tortillas cooked right, I think that is a big draw, and the salsa is very fresh and tasty. The lettuce was good too. I'll give Fiesta another try sometime, but I won't go out of my way for a repeat visit.
Fiesta is my favorite restaurant in the Chauncey area. Cheap, fast, plenty of seating. Get your burrito enchilada-style or be surprised at how delicious the salads are.

This is hands down the best food near Purdue - these burritos (always enchilada style!) are to die for!! I always get mine with shredded beef, although I've heard all the fillings are great. You get a ton of food for a really reasonable price. Check this place out if you like amazing burritos!
LOOOOVE this place. Wish it was open in Sunday's, that's the day I always crave what I can't have!! Get your burrito enchilada style with a side of the ranch. TO. DIE. FOR.

I've been going to Fiesta Mexican grill every week for months now. The soft, chewy, made-right-before-your eyes fresh tortillas are to die for. I see a lot of the reviews recommending the burritos, but my favorite is ordering the salads because I love to savor every bite of the tortilla after I'm done. I have occasionally ordered their tortillas a la carte -- they're that good. Be sure to ask for a loyalty card at the checkout. After 5 purchases, you get a free drink. Five more purchases gets a free meal.

The service here is great.  They are friendly, efficient, and always get everything right.  I usually get one of the burritos enchilada style.  Their chips, guac., pico, are all excellent as well.  Good (and on the cheaper side), reliable, and a great location.

Nice and fast place to eat. Agree that tortillas are best I've had in long time. Portions are huge.  The salsa fresca with citrus twist was amazing. Service was friendly and fast and also took time to make sure we knew about all the additions possible to customize our burritos. Nice!
reviews.reviewerLocation: Town N Country Alliance, Tampa, FL

reviews.text: It's amazing how built up it is around Chauncey now at Purdue. I was in town recently for some meetings and met someone here for lunch. Great choice for quick, economical lunch on a college campus. I opted for a burrito smothered in sauce. Enjoyed every bite.

reviews.text: Really good experience here! They were the safest restaurant I've been to in terms of COVID rules. All of the food was amazing, and although it is on the pricier side, the portions are very fair. I highly recommend the crab cakes and the creme brûlée.

Upping this to 5 stars since this has been one of our favorite and most consistent restaurants for takeout during the COVID-19 situation. We really appreciate that, unlike some other places, they've continued doing contactless curbside pickup, even after they reopened their dining room. Some of the dishes we've had and really enjoyed this summer include the pecan crusted trout, the mushroom cavatappi in marsala cream sauce, the burrata caprese salad and the french onion burger. I like that they change their menu seasonally because most other restaurants around here don't, and even great menus get boring when they've been offering the exact same food for years. It's definitely pricey for the area (entrees, especially ones containing seafood, can be $30+) but the food puts them up there among the best restaurants in greater Lafayette.

I'm kind of torn between 4 and 5 stars but am erring on the side of generosity primarily because I think restaurants should be supported in these Covid-19 times and Bistro 501 deserves special mention for having curbside no-contact pickup, which not all restaurants do. The food is also excellent-- the French Onion burger, which is what I always get when my wife and I visit our daughter and her family and get food from here, may very well be the best hamburger I have eaten in Lafayette. 

There are two reasons, though, that I am a little ambivalent about giving 5 stars. The first is the fairly skimpy menu, at least as far as I am concerned. The primary reason that I always get the French Onion burger is that there really aren't any other entrees that I like all that much. There are nine entree items, only two of which involve red meat (I'm a carnivore); the other items include seafood, vegetarian, and chicken or hen selections. The other meat item, filet mignon, looks good, but I'm not about to pay 44 dollars for a steak.  

And that brings me to the second reason: the prices. 18 dollars for a burger? That seems kind of ridiculous, given that this restaurant is in Lafayette, Indiana, not New York City. It is, as I noted above, a first-rate burger, but I don't really believe it's worth 18 bucks. 

Bottom line: very good food and a nice place to patronize if you're nervous about eating out or having contact with strangers, but meat eaters may find the pickings a bit slim and I'm not sure the quality of the food justifies the prices. A great place to eat, though, if you're looking for a special treat, trying to impress a date or are taking a job candidate out to dinner.

Literally the best food I've had in the Lafayette area! The atmosphere here is excellent and the food and service are really superb. It's pricier but you get what you pay for here. Definitely an elegant place to have drinks, go on a date, or just have a nice night out! You really can't go wrong with any of the drinks or food on the menu.

This location is busy and parking in the area can be difficult. Get an early start looking for parking if you have a reservation during peak hours. The staff will call and check up with you to see if you're still coming if you are running late. I was--driving in circles looking for a spot, d'oh!--but they held my table without issue.

My server was super nice and the manager was beyond delightful. She really took the time to connect with the many guests there and made me feel super welcome. I'm so excited about their future endeavors and will definitely be back!

I had a coconut drink (so good!!), bread/butter, a gorgeous salad, a duck confit dish, and creme brûlée. Everything exceeded my expectations and was so wonderful to enjoy. 

I can't wait to take some guests to this restaurant in the near future!

I honestly wish I had pictures to do this place justice. Had a reservation there during the snow storm and the staff was very understanding and lenient of us being late. Obviously as a French restaurant they have a great variety of wine choices. Typically three course dinner. We had the shrimp tempura and Tuscan bruschetta as our first course ( exquisite !!!) for our main course we both had the pork chop ( seasonal / on temporary menu that the chef releases frequently ) and it was AMAZING. I definitely am looking forward to visiting again for brunch and during the summer time.

One of the great high-end classic dining experiences offering the extravagant blend of craft, quality, and variety with attention to creative and unique menu items. There is so much to enjoy here from the wonderful staff, tastefully decorated inside and out, and a traditional blend of French cuisine with American flair. I came here for my birthday for the first time with my group of four others and all enjoyed dishes from soup, duck, lobster to beef. The Burger was the surprise, easily the most Fantastic Burger I have ever had in my life. What an amazing blend of ingredients that come together for flavors making many steaks embarrassed. The duck poutine was also a stand out, amazed us all! My lobster and crab cannelloni was rich and even though the cream and ricotta took over most of the dish there was some nice flavors poking through. Good words also for the soups and boeuf bourgignon - pure delicious beef and extremely well done with very soft and tasty morsels. The drinks were also well crafted, the desserts very nice, and we will definitely be back for another celebration.

Still my favorite restaurant in Lafayette/West Lafayette area! Maybe even all of the Indiana area! 

Their menu changes seasonally but also hangs onto a few things.

My favorites of the menu items that have stayed are:
Daily quiche at lunch,
French onion soup,
The pate,
Pom frites, 
Bread pudding, 
And so much more!

I love that they now serve brunch on Sundays! So incredibly delicious!

Please! If you haven't given this amazingly delicious restaurant and it's phenomenal staff a shot, make a reservation today!

While do some work in Lafayette , Keisha and I wanted to enjoy some French food . The escargot was authentic with olive oil and pesto , dipped in a goat cheese sauce.  Delicious,  with quality ! 

The cannelloni, stuffed with lobster and blue crab had a delightful taste leaving you wondering when we could have another . 

The desert , caramel whiskey bread pudding wasn't overbearing with sweetness. Had the correct texture for a dessert. 

Sticky toffee carrot cake , had medjool dates given it a great taste . This restaurant is outstanding with the food , and service as quality in quality out !

Keep improving restaurant. Our third time visit here and more satisfying food. New manus are unexpectedly good and genuine. The pistachio ice cream is absolutely delicious and must try item. Recommend this place and will visit again!

A chic French bistro with country charm and incredible cuisine -- what's not to love about Bistro 501?
 
Although I'm not a Lafayette local, I travel here frequently for business and this has become my go-to for sit-down meals. Most recently, I stopped in for an early lunch during the busy Christmas shopping season. While I didn't have a reservation, I was quickly seated. The staff was very attentive, taking my order and then bringing out my meal before the dining room filled up for the big lunch rush.
 
The menu always features seasonal and sophisticated dishes. This time I started with a cup of sugar pumpkin and wild rice soup, which was perfectly rich and creamy -- just as a French soup should be! For my main course, I ordered the humongous beet and goat cheese salad, which was well appointed with lots of other goodies like wild rice, pepitas and oranges. I added salmon, which turned out to be a full portion. The whole dish was so flavorful it could easily stand on its own, but a few touches of the creamy apple cranberry dressing put it over the top!
 
The beautiful details -- lovely old portraits, antiques and carved wood finishings -- throughout the dining room make a spectacular backdrop for the meal.
 
Keep in mind, this is an upscale French restaurant, so you should expect to pay a little more. But the portions are large and the overall experience is well worth it.

Came here on a Friday night without reservations and we were lucky to get a table immediately.

Everything was delicious and warm if not hot in temperature.  The portions are fair and prices are a little more but it is a white table cloth setting.  The ambience is like being in someone's home.  Food timing was done well too.

Service needed some improvement with timing, friendliness and attention to details.  Some suggestion include but not limited to:  Paying attention to the water glasses, not rushing in choosing a wine, providing recommendations, asking if dinner was a special occasion etc.

I would still come back bc the food is that good especially in this tiny town with super limited choices.

Tried out this quaint place on a Sunday morning for brunch - highly recommended!

The bistro is very tastefully decorated, and has a certain charm to it. There's indoor and outdoor seating, but as it was a chilly October morning we decided to warm up inside. 
Service was fantastic, no complaints. 
With regards to the food - no disappointments! Every dish we tried was delicious. We tried their fried chicken on waffles (yummyyyy), pancakes, eggs benedict, burger and the full breakfast. Although I only had the chicken on waffles, everyone else seemed very happy with their orders. 
The one thing I would highlight is that their French press was a little on the weak side, not sure what kind of roast they use. 
They have good sized portions!

Covid wise, best I have seen - tables are thoroughly cleaned and sanitized after each group leaves, servers serve food only, designated people take things away.

Went to brunch today and food was good (chicken and waffles, breakfast tamales, crabby patty sandwich and chicken salad croissant sandwich + poutine appetizer), but appetizer was served late and chicken salad croissant came on a pretzel bun.  When asked, our server said 'they may have run out of croissants today' (11:30 am when they open for brunch at 10).  She apologized for not telling us. Disappointed for a $100 brunch.  We have been here for dinner a few times pre/post Covid and have had better service.

Came here for a new hire dinner with some of the employees of the company I'm working for this summer, and the food here completely blew me away. The Atlantic salmon was absolutely the best I've EVER had, perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned with the perfect amount of crispness on the outside. It came with these wonderful little sweet roasted carrots and sat on this delicious bed of polenta. Our waitress was so attentive even though we had a big party. Their crème brûlée was divine and it came on a cute little dessert spoon so it was just enough to satisfy my sweet tooth! Our pommes frites also came with this really yummy red curry ketchup, plus two other fun sauces which I thought were unique and added a nice twist. 

Cute little thing that has nothing to do with food, nor does it really matter in the grand scheme of things but I'm adding it anyway: the bathroom sinks had cool little color-changing lights on them so that you'd know when the water was hot, warm or cold (,: 

Overall I really loved this place, and I'd say it's worth the price!

Is it pricey? Yes. It is worth it? Absolutely. Bistro 501  is very well put together and prepared. The cuisine is exquisite, flavorful, and super fresh. The whole staff is professional and experienced. We had the Turkish lentil soup which was slightly sweet and hardy, really delicious. The pork chop was so soft and cooked perfectly. The broccolini pasta was amazing, creamy and perfect texture with the walnut crust. Props to the chef and the owner. The place does has strange hours and is always booked so make sure to call to make a reservation even if they aren't open. You can leave a voicemail and they'll call you back.

It's not often that we Funkster four are in the same place at the same time these days, but when we are, a great meal is usually not too far away.  

This holiday season, that "all together" day found us in a Christmas state of mind at Bistro 501 in Lafayette, IN. Fine Dining in the home of Astronauts, Engineers, a world renowned Collegiate Music Organization (with no music degree available?!?) and a big-a$$ bass drum... who'da thunk it!

On this early December evening The French inspired Bistro provided a spectacular meal and impeccable service as a Lafayette Christmas parade floated by. 

A table next to a warm easy burning fireplace for the evening, at least 2 1/2 hours, made way to signature cocktails, beginnings of meat and cheeses followed by delicious and beautifully presented pasta's, chops, fish and steaks accompanied by a bottle of red and a bottle of white (nod to B. Joel) from the Bistro's superb cellar.

The evening was finally closed with shared desserts, in Funkster fashion, and an aromatic and rich cup of French roast, naturally from... a French press.

It truly was L'Amour from first bite, just remember to have plenty of Francs on hand - even though dead presidents is easier.

Will we return? Well as my good friend PePe Le Pew has said, "One nice thing eez, the game of love eez never called on account of darkness!"

My previous review from 2015 was a 3, and the reason for it was that it was an "institution" and so while the food was just okay you kind of knew were you stood with it. 

Well. Bistro kind of took us for a terrible ride when we were planning our rehearsal dinner spot for our wedding. My mom hosted the rehearsal, so we planned her visit to Lafayette so she could try the two choices (Bistro and East End). My now husband's parents came along as well as a treat. We tried basically everything in the menu that was vegetarian**. The food was okay, but not mind blowing. Still, it's the type of atmosphere that my parents prefer, so they were leaning toward hosting the dinner at Bistro for about 30 people. However, despite having talked to my mom before, and knowing that she was the one paying, the manager just kept on addressing only my husband's parents. Was it because they're American and my mom has a thick accent? (despite being fully fluent?) I don't know, that was kind of our assumption. At some point my mom said "excuse me, I'm the one that's hosting" and the manager said something really awkward like "yes, of course I know" just to go back to ignoring her. Anyway, maybe this all seems like a bunch of petty stuff, but mediocre food (see previous review), poor manners, and feeding me fat duck (see note below). Just no.

** pretty sure, as I found out later, their fries are fried in duck fat, and we talked several times about how we were vegetarians at that time, so wtf. Extra wtf.

We Went here for our 6th anniversary and it was phenomenal. Our waiter, Eric, was considerate and took great care of us. We had the calamari appetizer and it was cooked perfectly, my husband had the half chicken and I had the duck. Both dishes were absolutely delicious, highly recommend eating here, the owner was super friendly and spoke to us for a little bit which we loved and we will definitely be back.
Delicious brunch. Made a reservation for our daughter's birthday and had a wonderful time. We were seated right in front of the fireplace. Service was great! Timing was perfect. Thank you.

One of my favorite places in town!  The food and drinks are amazing!  

Everything we ate was divine!  After living in Europe for a few years and being able to get escargot pretty much anywhere, I'm thrilled to have a place here in town to satisfy that craving!  And they were as good as any I've had before!  I plan on returning just to sit at the bar and enjoy a glass of wine and escargot!  

While this restaurant has a French emphasis, their menu is diverse.  After enjoying my escargot, I had an excellent bahn-mi sandwich.  For dessert, scrumptious creme brûlée.

Their cocktails menu is fabulous as well!  I've always wanted to try the cocktail, The Last Word.  The ingredients are expensive so I've never been able to buy them to make one for myself and not a lot of restaurants and bars around here have them on the menu, but Bistro did!  I was so excited and it was delicious.

I've only been the one time, but I look forward to going back whether it be for a drink and some escargot, a full dinner, or their brunch which looks absolutely amazing! 

The restaurant itself was cozy and well decorated and has outdoor seating on a sidewalk patio in nicer weather.

reviews.text: We went for lunch at the Blue Nile prior to Thanksgiving break.  Restaurant was clean, with hand sanitizer at every table.  We ordered falafel as an appetizer, along with the Blue Nile Chicken and Beef Schwarma sandwiches.  Falafel was tasty and came with a light tahini sauce for dipping.  Both sandwiches came out hot, packed with meat, onions and tomato, in a grilled wrap;,each sandwich also came with a bag of potato chips.  Sandwiches tasted great and had a little spice to them (pickled onions?) - we'll be back to try some additional dishes.

LOVE blue Nile! The owner works very hard to make sure the experience is perfect. The hummus is always stellar. Chicken shawarma is a favorite. Also the shish tawook is a must try. I always look forward to dining here!

I really loved my experience there. We ordered an eggplant dish and the lamb biryani dish. The service was quick and very friendly and the food was served very fresh. The sauce on the dishes was well balanced and it dishes were pretty filling. They let is try a taste at their fresh stuffed grape leaves and those were fantastic too. Their lentil soup was also delish.

Overall a great experience and probably my favorite restaurant so far in LF/WL.

It looks like this is a one-person operation, so I'd definitely recommend phoning in your order. I walked in to order and no one ever came around, so I phoned in instead and waited. Aside from that, the food was delicious! They gave me generous portions of the combo meal and I honestly had food from them that lasted me a few days. The worker who assisted me was incredibly kind and hospitable. I highly recommend their massa platter and combo meal--all delicious!
Delicious food and wide selection- there's lots of good vegetarian options. The owner is also super friendly!

What a great little spot. The food was amazing! We ordered the fava beans dish and it was one of the best foods I've ever tasted. All of our meals were flavorful and the service was amazing. The portions were generous at a great price. Will definitely be getting food from them next time I'm in West Lafayette.

Extremely rude service! I ordered a biryani and a lentil soup to go as attached in the picture. I asked her while paying 'may I get some more soup?'. She said since this is a half order this I the amount we give. I said okay and ended the conversation. Then, from her side she said and I quote her' you get what you pay for, if you want more soup be ready to pay another 4$ for it'. Hearing her say this and bring up money I told her politely it doesn't matter giving a little extra soup if it satisfies the customer. And then she said it matters to us the quantity we give and told me we are happy to not serve customers who are unsatisfied. I said then 'okay thank you, maybe I will not come back ' again in a polite way. I left and she came outside the restaurant while I was going toward my car and said' it will be our honor not to serve you'.

This is an extremely bad service and impolite behavior. I hope this review gets shared and this person realizes how rude she is! Being kind is the first we learn as a child and teach our kids. I think she needs a lesson on that.

This place is so cute and the service is awesome. The man serving our table was very kind. There were disinfectant wipes at each table and the restaurant overall was very clean. The food was really good too!!

This is my absolute favorite restaurant! I've come so often, the owner knows me by name. He is so friendly and truly knows the meaning of hospitality. The Lamb Biryani and Chicken Shawarma platters are my favorite, but I normally get the half portion because the portion sizes are so large! And of course, you have to start off with hummus with pita bread. The best Mediterranean restaurant I've ever been to, hands down!

Great food and service.  Sorry for that old half-order person, but our experience was great.  Egg plant, beef kabab, fava, etc were tasty.  Both Jewish and Arab style salads were excellent.  Falafal was on the salty side.  Nice little place for dinner.

1. Amazing service! The gentleman who helped me was so gracious. He made some recommendations and I decided to try something new (Mazaa Platter). Delicious food and I left feeling like that one experience made my day.

I've been here a couple times now. The food is really good. They have vegan options. Sorry no pictures, I forgot to take. I had a falafel sandwich the other day. It comes with a small bag of ruffles. I wish they put more tomatoes on it, but oh well. I'll go back.

Really good choice if you are open to try something new and Mediterranean. Family run restaurant at a relatively hard to find location in west Lafayette. Interior could be a bit updated. Visited on a weekend; probably explains why there weren't anybody at the front desk to take us to seating; had to wait a bit longer than the time I would prefer. But, we go to a restaurant and if the food is food and place place is clean, it is easy bear all other issues. And yes, the food is good and authentic. Worth trying if you are around- you won't be disappointed.

Easily some of the best Mediterranean food we've had. The lentil soup was super-flavorful, and the hummus was perfectly spiced. I suppose if you're going to have a restaurant like this, your hummus game had better be strong, and theirs is! 

Our awesome server was super accommodating to a large party with a bunch of kids, and I'm pretty sure everybody left happy. I'd go out of my way to stop here again.

I've come here several times in the past few months and ordered the lamb biryani each time. It is always delicious hot, and fresh. The lamb is tender and and the rice is the perfect amount of spicy. If you prefer you can also get the dish with chicken. 

The staff are friendly and accommodating and the prices are great. Many foods come with the option of a half portion for a lower price, and honestly that has always been more than enough food for me (the attached photo is actually after I've eaten about half)

Can't wait to come back soon!
Decent food, rude staff. Mandatory "gratuity charge" is insulting.
best service of any restaurant i have ever been to. we cleared all the plates EASILY as the food was to die for. we will definitely be back as long as we are in WL

I almost never have Middle Eastern food, but my friends and I were in the mood to try something completely new and expand our horizons. We found this place by chance and decided to give it a chance after seeing other positive reviews. 

The place was much different than I expected on the inside. The decor was really interesting and aesthetically please. It was incredibly clean as well. Our waitress was really nice and friendly. She was also quite fast with taking out order and getting us our food. 

I started out with the lentil soup. I had never had anything like it before, but it was very good. I saved most of it to use as a palate cleanser when the spice of my main course started to overwhelm me. I would recommend trying it. It's finely pureed and has an interesting flavor.

My main course was the chicken biryani. I did really enjoy it, even though the spice was a bit much for me at times (tag in the lentil soup). I wish there had been more chicken. It was seasoned and cooked perfectly. There was a ton of rice that wasn't anything to write home about. 

I would definitely say it's worth a try. I enjoy trying something new and out of the ordinary, so this was a great choice for a random dinner.
It's a simple place tucked away from the others with delicious food. I'm almost afraid to let the news out, but they make the best falafel I've ever had.

I am very upset I have to give this heartbreaking review to one of my previous top Purdue area restaurant.  Tonight's dinner ruined my day. If it is possible I will give negative infinite.

Food:2 star. Taste Met my expectation. But could be better.  More Serious problem is, three of us who ordered lamb kebab, had diarrhea problem after dinner. 

Price: 2 star, overpriced and couldn't tell the difference between a half/full size of hummus regarding the serving size.

Service: Negative 100.  The lady who served us dinner tonight was extremely rude and unprofessional. The were more than 4 (usually it would be 6 for other restaurant)of us, for sure she could get guaranteed 18% gratuity. Probably that's why we were treated like that. I, politely, asked her how long our food will take for coming, after 30mins wait, she rolled her eyes in my face. Interesting reaction. . Technically speaking, I don't think we did anything wrong or treated her in a unfair standing. We were being polite and patient meanwhile she made us feel we own her 10000 grants.

reviews.text:
AMAZING  bbq spot! Their prices have gone up recently, so a little less bang-for-your-buck, but the impecable quality hasn't budged an inch in years!! The pulled pork is tender beyond description, and the fries are great! Actually, pretty much everything is really great. The coleslaw? Seasoned perfectly. The beans? Yeah you'll want to make sure you get those too. The fried pecan pie? You'll think you've died and gone to heaven.

The only thing that's a little lacking is the somewhat curt service, but the humble dining room and down-to-earth staff paired with authentic BBQ make it the perfect lunch spot for everyone, from a business meeting to the drywall tradesmen taking a break.

My Mom & I went to South Street Smokehouse today for lunch to go (they do not have a dine in option now). My mom is 92 and is hard of hearing.  In accordance with the Indiana Mask Mandate we are not required to wear a mask so that I can communicate to her. As we entered South St. the cashier told me we needed a mask. I said thanks but we have a mask exemption. ANY OTHER business here in town has been nice about this because this is a disability issue. One of the men behind the counter told me we needed a mask. I told him we had a mask exemption and asked if it was going to be a problem to order food to go. He asked another man who told me no they would not serve us. I asked again if they were refusing to serve us given that we had a masks exemption. He said yes and we left. I did not want to embarrass my mom as she had not heard what happened. There were 2 customers in there waiting for their food. We were not a threat to anyone. I sent South Street a FB message because I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt that they did not know. (screenshots below of my message, the exemption) and they responded in a very RUDE way. (Screenshot below) "Please feel free to report the problem. Your moms hard of hearing doesn't justify you not wearing one. Please feel free to never enter MY ESTABLISHMENT again!" They put up a post a couple of hours later that said they followed the Indiana Mask Mandate. They have now removed that post but I also have the screenshot of it. People that knew me had found out about this were commenting on the post. They have now deleted it. I left a bad review because they could have handled this very differently. I have also filed a complaint with the Civil Rights Division of the US Dept of Justice. I sent them a copy via FB messenger but they have blocked me.
Is this overkill? ... maybe but the rudeness of the response needs to be addressed. There are people with disabilities that are dealing with this pandemic. Why can't we be kind and help them? Would it have hurt them to let us order food, stand against the wall while we waited and then left? My mama loves BBQ and she was so excited about this but I told her we will not be going back. We will give our business to D&R!

We like going here for the food. The staff though could use some work on how they talk to customers. The guy taking orders was very impatient not not please tell with customers face to face or on the phone. I have been there when it's been busier and we were there around 5 and it wasn't very busy, so for him to seem so stressed was strange. Some of their main items were not prepared and it was over a half hour wait if you wanted them. 

The ribs we had were good. The breaded pork tenderloin was less desirable. Mac and cheese is frozen kind you buy from US Foods and it's just thawed out and warmed up. (I used to serve that kind in a kitchen I ran at a school). It's good don't get me wrong just over priced.

This place is so freakin good and always has been. Go. Now. 
Succulent authentic bbq. 
Don't hesitate.
A group of us from work ordered lunch,  the lady taking the order was rude as hell.  The missed several items and missed 2 full orders.
Rude, over priced are just a few words for this place. Better bbq on a McRib. A McRib!

First time here - great place! Nothing fancy, but very fast. Several different sauces to choose from. Mac & cheese and cole slaw very solid. Brisket was tender, but not really smoked, more of a gray than a red. But a great lunchtime place when you are in a hurry. Prices are very sensible, too.

This is a must stop hole in the wall!

Came on a Friday during lunch rush at noon but they move quickly!

Sauces all on the side which is great!  Food quality is awesome and accurate!  I have to come back!

The sauces are not honest.  The spicy is not and the hot isn't hot enough.  So don't be scared to try them out.

Portions are fair but on the smaller side considering this is indiana.  Pricing is fair.

The menu is straightforward and this place is simple no nonsense.

Hard to access the parking lot if you come from the east.  Parking is ample if they're not busy.

Ordered the chicken dal quarter and it was super juicy but fully cooked!

Okay, let me just say yes they are a bit on the rude side, but if you know what you want when you get to the counter you will be fine! Just don't you dare not know what sides you want or ask any stupid questions such as about the nutrition content or if this or that is gluten free!  It is what it is and I guarantee they could careless if you think they are rude.

About the food, sides were excellent and we loved the rub they used.  We have had better barbecue but this was very good.  We only had to wait about 5 minutes which was surprising because it was quite busy.  My husband liked the sauces but I am more of a Sweet Baby Ray's kind of gal and not a barbecue sauce connoisseur.  

So, as long as you are not expecting sugary sweet friendly service you should get along just fine at this place!

I stopped by South Street on a business trip to West Lafayette hoping for some awesome BBQ. 

I will begin this review by saying that I am in love with excellent BBQ, and have been fortunate enough to enjoy some of the best across our great country. I take it very seriously and put a lot of effort into learning what makes great BBQ and how to make it happen. Although my personal BBQ results are varying levels of good, I have had the chance to enjoy what I consider to be excellent BBQ. 

That being said, I was extremely hopeful of a great lunch on the cold January day of my visit. Unfortunately, I left disappointed. 

This seems like a shop that should be able to do it right, and the place was packed during lunch, which makes me think that they are either usually better, or the bar is just not that high, their 4.5 star here on Yelp reinforces my hope that it is the former. 

On to the food. I got my go to that I consider the standard scorecard of good BBQ...Sliced brisket and spare ribs. 

I knew I was in trouble as I began ordering. First of all, there was no combo or option on the menu for brisket and ribs, and when I asked for it I was told to buy two lunches, the brisket lunch, and the spare ribs lunch. It wasn't very expensive, just strange. As I was ordering I asked for my brisket to be a half fatty and half lean. The gentleman helping me looked at me like I was asking for something strange. Realizing that maybe they call the cuts point and flat I restated my order as that and got an equally quizzical look. When this happens I lose hope that they speak great BBQ. 

Sure enough, when my food was ready I received all flat (lean) brisket, although it did have more fat cap than most prefer, so I expect that they believed that is what I meant by half fatty. 

The brisket was very over cooked, when held sideways it broke right in half, which the novice would say means "it is super tender right?" Well, over cooked BBQ falls apart easily, but is super dry and loses all of the things that make excellent BBQ magic. The smoke ring was very light and the taste was that of oven roast beef, which is fine, just not great. 

The ribs were dry and bland, they appeared to also be over cooked (no bark, just jerky on the outside) mushy texture. 

Sides were beans and slaw, I tried a few bites of the beans, but moved on quickly, mainly due to lack of appetite at this point. Not a fan of sweet beans and these tasted like they came from a can, not bad jus not my preference and not special. At some of my favorite places, the brisket beans are my favorite after I finish the main event.  Never tried the slaw. 

I hope I caught them on a bad day, regulars would know better. 

Ribs - 3/10
Brisket 3/10

Not a 1 star, but well below average.

This is my buddies favorite BBQ spot to eat who lives here. My feelings are 50/50 on this one. The food was decent I had BBQ chicken which was really good, the corn bread is a little corn tasting and they didn't have honey that was not expired so it made it taste a little off. The potato salad was really good. They have a few flavors of BBQ sauce they were all pretty good really. The people working didn't look like they wanted to be there which I mean nobody wants to be at work but a smile never hurt nobody. All in all it was OK at best. Not writing home to mom about this one.

Fwitw- went to KC and had their signature brisket sandwiches at 4 different places... South St holds up as good (and my gf thought it was better.) 

This place rules- make a stop here and the the KC brisket sandwich and enjoy the blues on the speakers.

Not BBQ grilled food is not BBQ.
Used to be good but not anymore should have known the place was empty

J.B (2 Star review) and John F. Explain it well in their reviews.  How can you call yourself a smoke house when you don't smoke anything??  Brisket tasted like dry roast beef, 1/4 dark chicken was mushy and had no flavor, certainly never spent any time in smoke.  Or it was held in a steam table so long it lost all flavor?  If you like to add lots of sauce, their sauces are pretty good, but $25 for two lunches is way over priced for what it is.  I also have been to many BBQ joints, I can't understand how the other reviewers can say they've been to great BBQ joints and put this place in the same category.

This place is so freakin' good.

It's super casual, so if you wanna bring a date here that's cool.  Just don't dress up.

You order at the counter and sit down.  They shout out your number and you go get it.

Portions are LARGE and prices are RIGHT.  They have Barq's Red Creme soda on tap (fountain) and that shit is like the tears of virgins.  

Brisket sandwich was TO DIE FOR and the Pulled Pork sandwich looked heavenly, too.  

The fried pickles are spears and you get a million of 'em.  I know that there are fried pickle enthusiasts out there that favor chips over spears and that's find.  I'm not one of you.  If it's a fried pickle, I'm eating it.

The different sauces are all very good.  Get a lil cup of everything so you can try it out.  

Skip the cornbread.  It's extra and it's nothing fancy.
Awesome ribs, super quick, delicious sauces, no frills just good bbq. Nice relaxed atmosphere!

Food was okay. Not the best BBQ, but good enough. The worst was how incredibly rude they were. They were out of everything but two meats and a couple sides at 7:00 and were annoyed at every customer asking for items they didn't have. They were so impatient and yelling. We got our food and ate at a decent pace listening to them yell at every customer trying to come in that they were out and closed. Before we even finished they shut the blinds and turned lights off while we were still at our table.
The brisket was grey, no red ring no crispy rub and bland. Sides were ok. Dining room was clean.

I was expecting the food  to be better.  It was just ok.  Par to a lot of other places. The corn bread was very good tho, moist!  Pulled pork seemed a little greasy and the sauces we nothing spectacular. Onion rings were really good, I think the breading that makes it.
Best smoked turkey I have ever had. Going with 4 stars because they always run out of sides. I understand running out of brisket, but not sides! Really good brisket, but definitely try the turkey.

reviews.text: Looooved the udon here when I lived here while in graduate school. Perfect antidote for the unpleasant frosty winters of Indiana. The broth was so flavorful and I loved how you sat kinda on the floor like an authentic Japanese restaurant.
The food is decent, but they've changed a lot. And not for the better. The menu is different. The prices are higher. The staff is alright. But it's not as good as it used to be.

My wife, fluent japanese speaker, loves Heisei.  It attracts many japanese nationals, and people with kids like us.  The young man doing hosting and our server were fantastic, and we enjoyed the fried chicken and sashimi very much.

Visiting the area for my cousins graduation from Purdue and came here for dinner. It was around 8:45 and it was really busy, but we had reservations so were seated right away.

Service here was friendly, but the food did take awhile to come out. The soup, salads, and sushi/sashimi came out first. The fish here was very fresh and pretty good. Two of us got their dinner combo sets. This came out last, about 30 mins after ordering. However, portion size was very large, and most of it was pretty good. The combos do come with a stir fry of vegetables though which was basically a waste of space in the bento box. The tempura was slightly soggy. It also mentions a "fruit salad", which was just a slice of cantaloupe. Overall, an ok Japanese restaurant for the price.

This review is a little late so I cannot remember what sushi I had but I loved it.  Delicious.  My daughter had a curry and was craving it again but they are closed on Sundays, which makes me sad.  Oh well.  Cannot wait to go back.  GO HERE!

This is my absolute favorite Japanese restaurant in the area. They offer traditional dishes like cold soba noodles and sake don to bento boxes, in addition to a variety of sushi. They also have traditional-style floor seating, which is always fun. I recommend the green tea soba with tempura, udon noodle soups, and sake don. 

Side note: they oddly close at 1:30pm for lunch.
Different experience than other sushi places I've been- but the food was still good and the staff was very attentive

Used to be my most recommended curry around Lafayette. Japanese style curry, large amount with decent price below 10. However, they raised the price few months ago. 3+1 star due to how it wasn't pricey before.

Very good Sushi and very reasonably priced. Authentic short tables to sit at if you want the very Asian experience.  Ate here with my daughter,who is a student at Purdue, because she wanted to try it and it was AOK with me as I am inclined to enjoy Asian cuisine having been to Japan as a Toyota business man. I was passing through towards Michigan on business and it was a welcome stop.

Heisei has been a standard in West Lafayette for many years. We were excited when they finally reopened at their current location!  If you are looking for truly authentic Japanese fare and sushi, this is your place!  They also have traditional seating for an authentic dining experience!  Love the New Spider Roll too!  It's sooooo good!

We've gone to Heisei many times over the years. I hadn't been in a few months but I had the mackerel combination dinner tonight and it's so good. The potstickers (gyōza) are very nice. If you haven't tried mackerel I recommend it. Their tempura is lovely. The vegetables were delicious. I lived in Japan for five years, lived (and learned to cook) with a Japanese family, worked as a Japanese-English translator. I know Japanese food, and the food at Heisei is excellent. I like the new setting (they moved a year or two ago); it's very spacious and relaxing. We were there tonight with little kids, and it's very family friendly.
The best japanese restaurant in West Lafayette~ The environment and taste are both very authentic.

Got the to tonkatsu ramen and chicken karaage. Also got a bit of nigiri to test it out. The ramen was a bit too salty but good nonetheless if you're trying to satisfy your Japanese ramen craving. The karaage was pretty good, with the perfect amount of crunch and tender of the chicken. The nigiri really good, almost reminded me of being back home in Los Angeles!

I'm not sure about options for ramen in West Lafayette - they seemed a bit limited when I had a craving and was doing search - but the dishes here were a little less than impressive. For the price, one would expect some richer broth, better cuts of meat, and higher quality noodles involved. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case. 

The tonkotsu, normally a rich pork bone broth created after a marathon of simmering, was flat and salty. It didn't have the usual signs of fresh-made creation: oils and fat bubbles or robust flavor. Instead, it just had a creamy color and had some spices lazily added.

I loved Heisei in its previous, decades-long incarnation in the Payless shopping center. Once it fled West Lafayette, we were left with a void that was shortly filled by Katana. Heisei has been back for a while now and I finally went after having become a regular at Katana.

The restaurant space is modern, bright, chic. All solid surfaces, so it's a little loud in there. The sushi counter is pretty nice. Wooden table around an interesting sushi setup. I liked the look of the place.

Staff were ok. A little slow but not that bad. 

I ordered the sushi & sashimi combo lunch. It was served with both salad and miso. Lucky me! The salad was very poor. They either don't dry the lettuce or use a very watery dressing. It's the classic "pool" at the bottom of the salad bowl. Not good. The miso was nice and tasty. I applaud that effort.

The lunch came with four sashimi, four nigiri and a small roll half cucumber, half chopped fish of some sort.

Sashimi was so-so. I liked the octopus and clam but the actual fish was not as fresh as I expect from a good sushi place. Nigiri was the same story. Just blah.

Sushi roll came with Nori on the outside. Who's still doing that? The roll was the quality I would expect from crappy college campus sushi places.

On the whole, this fish was just not *nearly* as high quality as Katana and it was not as fresh. One piece was actually semi-frozen still. Attention to detail. 

I would suggest Katana over Heisei for sure. Prices are about the same.

This place is legendary. I am told that its history dates back to a decision wise Subaru executives made back in the day to hire in a sushi chef to provide landlocked Hoosiers with quality sushi. Today the skills of the staff are indeed apparent in every bite. The menu is expansive, with noodles, rice balls, bento boxes, entrees, and more in addition to sushi selections. 

The house sake is good quality at a great price. We have eaten here several times and tried various sushi orders, rice balls, bento boxes, and udon, in addition to appetizers including various seafood and seaweed salad and a beef tongue special. Everything has been consistently excellent. 

The aesthetic is spare and a bit sterile, in keeping with what you might find in Japan. We have had efficient and courteous service in our experiences at Heisei. The kitchen does tend to get behind on busy nights; the servers have been apologetic about that, and we have found the food well worth the wait.
They changed the order system that you have to order and pay before being seated. The system is so stupid and you have stand there and think about what to eat. Not recommend anymore.

I'm a big fan of ramen when it comes to Japanese food.

This had been one of my favorite places around Purdue that serve Japanese food. Their sushi was the best in West Lafayette at the time I wrote this review.

I wished they had a bigger space so that a big group could reserve a large table. Once, I tried to reserve a table for a large group, and they could not take it. too bad.

Make sure to come for their dinner menu, which I found much better than their lunch menu
Good selection of Japanese dishes. Had Katsu curry, sukiyaki, and got unajyu tonight. Clean restaurant, good service

Yum! Cute Japanese restaurant and was a lot bigger and nicer than how it looks on the outside. They have sushi bar seating, tables, and the nice Japanese tables that your feet sink into the floor. Two of us got seated right away and the sushi bar and were greeted nicely by the sushi chefs. The menu items are a little pricey, but I think it would be a deal to come at lunch time. We got a variety of rolls and the katsu curry. Everything was delicious! The customer service was also outstanding. We got our waters refilled, plates cleared promptly, and the chefs made sure we were okay. Definitely coming back with my friends to try the lunch specials! They also have good daily deals as well :)
